When extrophulos are of phlegm and cold humors and do not respond to digestion by medicines, and you wish to slightly digest those, then you ignite the cautery whose shape is this following, having two open extremities so that the smoke escapes from the cautery through the other extremity, and place it on that abscess once, and another if you judge it necessary, until it reaches the bottom of the abscess.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the abscess is small, then place the cautery according to the size of the abscess, and then leave it for three days and place a cloth soaked in water on top of it until that which the fire has burned is subdued.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with gargles and poultices and bandages until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the cannula or the two cauteries is as conveyed.
Capitol .xxiii.	Chapter XXIII.
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	Of cauterization of hoarseness of voice and constriction of the throat.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When the humors come upon the throat of the lungs, and most especially when that is of cold complexion, then it is necessary that the patient be evacuated at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize that part of the root of the goiter in the depressed location.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And be careful that you do not reach the cautery to the goiter nor burn the flesh of it, but only a little.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize that with another cautery at the junction of the neck at the last vertebra of it.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	And the cautery of it be a clove according to the previous manner.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with water that is preceded until it is healed.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter XXIV.
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	Of cauterization of lung disease and cough.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and lung disease are of cold humors and the patient has no fever or phlegm and it is an old ailment, then cauterize that with two cauteries on the breastbone in the depressed locations of the left and right sides; and with another cautery in the middle location of the foot between the two toes; and let the cautery be a clove according to the previous form.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, let your cauterization be pointed with the cautery that is called a point, the shape of which you have seen in the cauterization of ear pain.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And make points within those; and then cure that with water that is preceded until it is healed.

De cauterizacio dels ronhos.	Of cauterization of the boils.
Quan en les ronhos endeve dolor per freg o per grossa ventozitat, e per aysso le coyt del malaute es amermat, lahoras cove que cauterizes aquel sobre les ronhos am cauteri sobre quascun ronho am cauteri clavilh del qual precesic la rememoracio.	When in the boils it is necessary to have pain from cold or from thick wind, and therefore the body of the patient is inflamed, then you should cauterize on the boils with a cautery over each boil with a chisel cautery of which I have previously mentioned the remembrance.
E fort leu cauterizam am le segon un petit dejos, per que vindran tres cauteris liniatz, e donc siran mays deriers en juvament.	And firmly cauterize with the second one a little, so that there will come three linear cauteries, and then they are more beneficial in benefit.
Capitol .xxxviii.	Chapter .xxxviii.
De cauterizacio de la vesica.	Of cauterization of the bladder.
Quan accideys en la vesica debelitat e mollificacio per freg e per humiditatz ayssi que·l malaute la urina no retengua, lahoras cauteriza aquel en la partida pus dejos sobre la vesiqua, la hon comensan les pels del pentenilh, e cauteriza am un cauteri en la partida dreyta, e am autre en la senestra de lu.	When there occurs in the bladder weakness and softening from cold and humidity so that the patient does not retain urine, then cauterize on the part below over the bladder, the one that begins the hairs of the navel, and cauterize with one cautery on the right side, and with another on the left side of him.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la cantitat dels not del pous; e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en la partida pus bassa del dos, o am dos cauteris si es necessitat.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the quantity of the knots of the pulse; and cauterize that with a cautery in the lower part of the back, or with two cauteries if necessary.
E sia cauteri clavilh segon que es procesit.	And cauterize the clavilh according to what is processed.
Capitol .xxxix.	Chapter XXXIX.
De cauterizacio de la mayra.	Of the cauterization of the  mayra.
Quan veno en la mayra freg e humiditatz, e per aysso es prohibida enpreignacio, e son corrompudas las mestruas de lu, e es tardada la provocacio de lor, e accideys dolor deves le haveniment de lor, lahoras cove que·l loc sia cauterizat am tres cauteris en le circuit del ombelic, ayssi cum havem dit en le cauteri de la vesica; e am cauteri sobre le loc pus dejos del dos, o am dos cauteris, e sia le cauteri clavilh.	When there comes in the womb,  moisture and corruption, and therefore pregnancy is forbidden, and the menses of her are corrupted, and the  provocation of them is delayed, and pain occurs in the  movement of them, then it is necessary that the place be cauterized with three cauteries in the circuit of the navel, as we have said in the cautery of the bladder; and with a cautery over the place below the back, or with two cauteries, and be the cautery clavilh.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter XL.
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	Of the cauterization of the dislocation of the hip.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When moist humors are poured into the part of the hip, and are made causes of the swelling of its place, and a sign of it is that the thigh is prolonged over the other when they are compared between them.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the place of the dislocation is felt in it where it is raised.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Therefore, it is necessary that you cauterize the patient over the part of the hip of it with a cautery in a circle resembling, as much as you will have felt with the finger in the circuit of the part as it is turned, and so that the part falls in the middle of the circle.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And be the cautery of which preceded the form in the cauterization of the stomach.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	And if this cautery is not present to you, then cauterize that with three cauteries with a large olive cautery.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And be made the cautery according to the quantity of the thickness of the whole bone; and take care of it that it be healed.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter XLI.
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	Of the cauterization of the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain comes in the part of the hip, and it is caused by it, cold and moisture, the patient is cured with what we have said and do not confer, and this is ancient, then it is necessary that you lance the patient of thick humors with fetid pills or with artificial pills or similar; and then cauterize it.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	And the manner of the cautery in that is according to two manners: the cautery with burning medicines, or the cautery with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	It is according to two scientific manners, of which one is that you cauterize it over the part of the hip of it with three triangular cauteries according to this form; and make with those a good depth.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And be the spaces the which is between each cautery the quantity of the thickness of the finger and if the olive cautery or large.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	Sometimes, however, the cautery should be on the middle of the top of the hip so that there are four cauteries.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	And if you wish, cauterize with the circle of which is preceded the form in the cauterization of the dislocation of the hip, that is, a circle containing and burning the thickness of the whole bone.
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is the manner of cauterizing sciatica when pain is adherent to the hip and is not extended into the thigh.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	But if it is extended into the thigh, then cauterize it with two cauteries on the thigh over the place where you feel the pain; and with one cautery on the  bone for four fingers a little below the  cylindrical part.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if the cautery is a knife, and be the depth of the cautery according to the quantity of the thickness of the bone.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if the patient feels that the pain is extended into the place near the toes, then cauterize it here where you feel it with a cautery for three points or four or more if it is necessary of that.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if the patient feels pain below the  thigh in the leg, then cauterize it here with a knife cautery.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And guard yourself in all cauterization that you do not end with the cautery as much as you burn nerves or large arteries, and that for that to you is upon the patient no harm or contraction.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And I have already seen one and another of those who cauterized on the bone and ended in the cauterization, and the foot inflamed until the tumor reached the foot, and fire perforated and corrupted the whole foot.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And then a very strong solution of the belly, and then death.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two parts at once, cauterize each one according to this manner.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	And some wise men say in the cauterization of the hip, the cautery of which this is the manner: make it resembling a circle of iron of which the circuit is the majority of a palm; and be its orifice according to the thickness of a finger bone or a little less.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And from that circle be another third; and be the spaces the which is between them the quantity of the pulse of the hand; and be those circles opened of two parts; and be the length of those cais a finger or two fingers, and make in those marks of iron decently adorned in the circles; and this is the form of it:
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Then it should be ignited in the fire until it glows red and throws sparks, and then it should be placed on the patient's back, the patient lying on their side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And therefore cauterize that with three round cauteries at once.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then leave that for three days; then plaster that with butter and leave the wound open for too many days; and then cure that with ointments until it is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Says Albucasis: Oh, sons, of this kind of cautery we have used little because of the terror of looking at it, and because we have found few who guard over it.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	May the cauteries to those who suffer them, and find a place for it.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	May cauteries with medicinal ointments be that you make two circles having a hole pierced in which they put the gauge of the iron door; let the length of the sides in the breadth of them be two nuts or whatever those are.
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And if the spaces which are between some the quantity of the thickness of the finger; and be open below and above, and be that they contain themselves between them according to this form:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	And then place on the patient's back, the patient lying on their side, and compress your hand on the area of the back; and then take some boiling water and pour it between the two circles, and the quality of that be with the small fire little by little, and keep that for the quantity of an hour, and suffer the patient the bite and the burning of it — for that biting is like fire — until the bite ceases.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	And then raise your hand with the instrument and wipe away the boiling water from the whole back with sweet water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	And then leave that for three days and place over that butter until the blackness of the burning is gone, and leave that for some days, and it will run from it a pus; this is called in healing.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then cure that with ointments until it is healed.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	And if the pain is extended into the thigh or leg, make to it a statue in it that contains water as it is made in the back equally.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	And this is the manner of boiling water, and you already have written that in the treatise of the rectification of medicines.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Recipe of alkali and of lime in the extinct of both a part one, and three them and place them in a new bowl of which the lower part be pierced by a small hole, according to the quantity that enters into it ray.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	And place below the bottom of the bowl another bowl inverted, and pour over that alkali and lime alive of sweet water which covers them by a finger, and as you compress those with your hand by good compression, and leave the bowl that descends from it water sharp in the lower part to the inverted bowl.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	And then adjust all that water, and pour it over another live lime and another renewed alkali, for that one at that time is of strong force sharpness, which is administered in many operations of medicine and in cauterization of the other members, for operation makes of fire.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And so of the medicines some with which it is cauterized much, as tezizic and honey anacrat and lime with sabon so that they are mixed.
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	And Gualia recounts of an ancient man the operation and cure with which is cured pain of back and of sciatic vein, and magnifies much well to be of that, and says that no has need of other cure, and that is healed by one time as he recounts, for strong leu that interweaving in bath and he already sees of that.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	And it is that it be taken of certain rag green, and if it is not found green, it be taken fig leaf recent; and much be it trissad with a little of gray and it be placed on the back in which is the pain, or in the thigh, or in the leg, and it be tied.
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	And it be left for the quantity of three hours or for the quantity that the patient feels cessation of the burning.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	And then put that in bath and then when the body of it be red, introduce that in the sun, for the pain ceases and it is healed.
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	And know that no one should use cautery with these medicines except after the evacuation of the body.
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	But already Escorides says that when with a goat's flen the sciatic vein is cauterized, it profits him very well; and let the cautery be with it according to this manner: let wool be taken and be soaked in old oil, and let it be placed between the toes of the foot and between the bones.
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	And then take a dry goat's flen and inflame that with fire until it be made charcoal; and then place it on the wool and leave it until it be extended.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	And then repeat that, and do not cease to do that until the sensation of the bite reaches into the back and repauses the pain.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	And this manner of cautery is called cautery of goats.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter .xlii.
De cauterizacio de dolor de dos.	Of cauterization of pain of two.
Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida.	Sometimes pain is in the two for many causes, such as for blows or for percussion or for superfluous evacuation, and for causes to those similar, for infusion of matter cold and humid.
E cauteri no catz sino en aquesta sola specia la qual es fayta per efusio de materia frega.	And cauterize only this particular type which is made by effusion of cold matter.
Donc cove, aprop evacuacio del malaute am pillulas fitidas e am semblant a lor, que sian faytas sobre·l dos en le qual es la dolor tres linhas segon la latitut de lu, pus que senhas am tentha en quascuna linha v cauteris o mays, segon la quantitat que ve de la tolleransa del malaute e de la vertut de lu.	Then, after evacuation of the patient with pills and similar ones, which are made on the two sides of the one where the pain is, three lines according to the width of it, because you have to cauterize each line with a cautery, according to the quantity that comes from the tolerance of the patient and the virtue of it.
E sia fayta cauterizacio am cauteri de punt.	And make cauterization with a pointed cautery.
E si vols, cauteriza am tres cauteris o am quatre am cauteri clavilh medial segon aquesta forma:	And if you want, cauterize with three cauteries or four with a medial chisel cautery according to this form:
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter .xliii.
De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	Of cauterization at the beginning of inflammation.
Motas veguadas endeve aquesta malautia als petitz enfantz; e senhal del comensament de lu en les enfantz es que accideys sobre lor estrectura en le ale eves la elevacio e·l movement.	Often this disease happens to young children; and a sign of the beginning of it in children is that they stumble over their structure in the leg and have elevation and movement.
E atrobas en le derier espondil del dos e dels notz de lu que ja comensa a sobremontar sobre les autres spondils.	And atrophy in the last vertebra of the lower back and of its nodes that already begins to rise above the other vertebrae.
E donc quan tu vezes aquo e voles prohibir, lahoras cauterisa aquel am cauteri que sia cercle segon aquesta forma:	And therefore when you see this and want to prevent it, then cauterize that with a cautery that is circular according to this form:
que prengua le cauteri sobre tota partida del spondilh engualment.	that presses the cautery over the entire part of the vertebra evenly.
E si vols, cauteriza en le circuit del spondilh am le cauteri de punt dos linhas o tres.	And if you want, cauterize in the circuit of the vertebra with the pointed cautery two or three lines.
E sian les puntz propdas entre lor.	And let the points be close together.
E aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat am aquo que havem dit.	And after the cure the place until it is healed with what we have said.
Mays guarda que cauteri no sia administrat en gelbositat que sia fayta per spasme de nervi.	But beware that cauterization not be administered in inflammation that is made by spasm of a nerve.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter .xliv.
De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	Of cauterization of gout and joint pain.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.
E donc cum es curada podagra de causa frega am manieyra de cura e no so remaugudas las dolors, lahoras las remau cauteri.	And therefore, as gout caused by cold is cured with a method of cure and the pains are not removed, then the pains are removed with cautery.
E es que tu cauterizas aquel aprop evacuacio en le circuit de la junctura del pe am motz cauteris.	And it is that you cauterize that after evacuation in the circuit of the joint of the foot with many cauteries.
E sia cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And let it be an olive cautery of which this is the form of it:
E si es necessitat que puntz sia fayt sobre la fassia del pe, lahoras fay am cauteri de punt.	And if it is necessary to make points on the surface of the foot, then do so with a pointed cautery.
E si las dolors pujan entro als denolhs o a las autras juncturas, e aquo motas vetz s’endeve, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre quascun donolh am tres cauteris o quatre de tota partida am aquest cauteri olivar.	And if the pains rise into the tendons or to the other joints, and this often happens, then cauterize that on each tendon with three or four cauteries of the entire part with this olive cautery.
E si motz cauteris que aquestz cauteris sian a tu necessaris, lahoras cauteriza aquel e no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri abans, sia tant solament enviro la specitut de la codena.	And if many cauteries that these cauteries are necessary to you, then cauterize that and do not press too hard your hand with the cautery before, be only around the outline of the bone.
E si las dolors pugan entro al donolh e·l dos, lahoras aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le sieu capitol.	And if the pains rise into the tendon of the lower back, then administer the cautery which we have said in its chapter.
E si las dolors so en las mas tant solament, e es apelada suagra, lahoras puncta en le circuit dels focils ayssi cum se revolvo, puncta en aquels dos linhas.	And if the pains are in the muscles only, and it is called sciatica, then prick in the circuit of the fossae thus as it revolves, prick in those two lines.
E si reman de las dolors en les ditz, lahoras puncta en le cercuit dels focils sobre quascun notz e sobre la pinche de la ma.	And if the pains remain in the fingers, then prick in the circuit of the fossae on each node and on the palm of the hand.
E si las dolors pugan aprop alscus jorns als coydes o als muscles, lahoras cauteriza les quascus de tota part dels ajutoris.	And if the pains rise to certain joints in the shoulders or to the muscles, then cauterize the certain parts of the joints.
E no evacuas le malaute de bon regiment e de recepcio de medicinas, quar si es fayt bon regiment e flacma es evacuada am aquest cauteri sira sanat, Dieus ajudan.	And do not evacuate the patient of good regimen and reception of medicines, because if it is done good regimen and the evacuation is done with this cautery, it will be healed, God help.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter .xlv.
De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	Of cauterization of ruptures.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When a rupture happens in the groin and the intestines are protruding in front of the hernia, and this begins to protrude, then it is necessary that you order the patient to leave their food for the day and that they use lenient causes so that the wound descends from their belly.
E aprop segua le malaute entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e comanda a lu que tengua le sieu ale entro que sia foro getat o aparesca l’atela o·l budels.	And then hold the patient between your hands over their back, and command him to keep his leg straight until the hernia is thrown or the intestines appear.
E aprop retorna aquel am les tieus ditz e senha am tenta la ruptura sobre le os del pentenilh am senhal la extremitat del qual sia semblant a la maytat de cercle a las subiranas partidas del cors.	And then return that with your hands and feel with your fingers the rupture over the bones of the pelvis with a sign the extremity of which is similar to the majority of a circle in the upper parts of the body.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then ignite the cautery of which this is the form of it:
entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	until it be very hot and throws sparks.
E aprop reduzeys le budel o l’atela a la sua conquavitat, e aprop pause la sua ma sobre le loc per so que le budel no yesqua.	And then return the intestine or hernia to its cavity, and place your hand over the area so that the intestine does not come out.
E tu ja has ubert entre las coyssas del malaute e dejos lu as pausat un coyssi, et autre servent sia sus las cambas de lu, e autre sus le pietz de lu, le qual tengua las suas mas.	You have already opened the space between the patient's thighs, placed a cushion under them, another servant on their legs, and another on their chest, holding their hands.
E aprop pausa le cauteri sobre aquel senhal am la tua ma am cauteri stan dreyt, e te aquel entro que am lu consieguas le os del pentenilh entro al mieg del duiduni; e itera am aquel autra veguada si a tu aquel no has conseguit en la primieyra veguada entro al os.	And then place the cautery on that sign with your hand with the cautery standing straight, and hold that until with it you can feel the bones of the pelvis into the middle of the groin; and repeat with that another time if with that you have not succeeded in the first attempt into the bone.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	And observe carefully the position of the intestine during the cauterization, so that you do not burn the intestine so that it does not come to death or other great harm to the patient.
E sapias que quan tu am le cauteri no atenhas le os, no confereys la tua operacio.	And know that when you have the cautery do not touch the bone, do not compromise your operation.
E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	And know that the cautery of children should be subtle according to their size and measure.
E aprop cura le loc del cauteri per tres dias am boder entro que sia remauguda la scara del foc.	And after carefully care for the cauterized area for three days until the scar of the fire is healed.
E aprop cura aquel am les autres enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And after care for that with the other ointments until it is healed.
E le malaute sia jasent sobre le sieu dos per xl dias entro que sia sigillat le loc e la plagua.	And the patient should lie on their back for forty days until the area and the plague are sealed.
E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And know that you should pause the nourishment of him according to the length of time of his cure, which the lines his belly, and that the intestine should not come out due to the effort of healing.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And after, when he wants to stand up, after forty days, then administer him decent food, and keep that for another forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And be moderate in work and in the repletion of food and drink, and of voice vehemently, for when he uses this regimen of healing entirely he will be healed.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And you should say the cure of ruptures in the other parts of the belly, and so at the beginning, and you want them not to pull, then cauterize the rupture of that with a round cautery according to the quantity of it, and it is that which is extracted from the codena as if it were the third part of it; and after care for that with what we have said, and it is not adjusted.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And already some first ones say that rupture should be cauterized with a triangular cautery according to this form, because it is marked with a tenta:
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	And it is placed a line that goes by the latitude in the broadest part of the rupture, and another line below; and place your hand with a pointed cautery, but the first cautery is lighter and better.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter .xlvi.
De cauterizacio de torcio.	Of cauterization of torsion.
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When in some members by accident or by percussion pain and that pain persists for a long time and does not help in the cure with medicines, then know that you should cauterize with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And be the cautery of every member according to its magnitude and its smallness, and its virtue and weakness, and location of torsion and pain of it.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	Therefore, if it is healed by the first cautery, well is; and if not, then repeat over it the cautery; for by custom of those pains it is that they are pointed of member to that member which approaches to it, so that know that you should cauterize those until the patient is healed.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter .xlvii.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	Of cauterization of leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Leprosy some times is cauterized by great benefit, and especially if it is the kind of leprosy that is made by putrefaction of phlegm and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And therefore, as you want to cauterize that, consider if the leprosy is common and has that cured with what we have said in the division and do not desist, nor is it, and fear over the patient that the corruption comprehends the whole body of it and the whole complexion of it, then cauterize that over the head with 5 cauteries: one in the middle of the head, and the second further down from it, and the front to the end of the hair; and two on two horns; and one behind, on the nape or service.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And finish your hand with the cautery a little while before it imprints on the bone a small impression, and from it the scabs be displaced, so that the expiration of thick vapors be alleviated from it; and cauterize over the flesh according to what is necessary.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	And if the leprosy is already expanded over the patient and appears manifestly, then know that you should cauterize that with those cauteries the ones which we have said in the head; and with a cautery over the extremity of the nose, and with two cauteries over the two cheekbones, and with two cauteries over two vertebrae of the neck, and with six cauteries over the vertebrae of the back, and one large one over the vertebrae near the hip, and one over the ribs, and with two over the knees, and one over each knee, and with two over the elbows, and with two over the muscles, and with two over the tendons of their feet; and cauterize that over all the joints of the fingers of the hands and the feet, and over each heel of their feet, and over the hollows of their arms.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And guard yourself from the nerves which are on the heel that you do not burn those.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And sometimes it is cauterized with a cautery over the bone of the palate and with another over the mouth of the stomach, and another over the liver.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And know that as much as you adjust cauteries, so much is it more beneficial and more conferent; and know that the patient does not have in the cautery pain, as if they have their own, because for that the body of it is already stupefied.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And know that the cauteries should be great or few according to the members and the joints according to what is preceded by the species of the tools.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then carefully apply the cautery to the surface with a mixture of flour, honey, and the other remedy while it is healing.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter XLVIII.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	Of the cauterization of stupor.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When any limb is numbed or asleep and is treated with medicines, oils, and plasters, and is not healed, then you cauterize that numbed limb with a cautery according to what merits the size of the limb or its smallness.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And let your cautery enter the depth of the bone a little.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then carefully apply that with an ointment while it is healing.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And sometimes, certain stupors are cauterized which extend to the arms and legs, and to the vertebrae of the lower back and the spaces of the nerves which supply that limb, and the stupor is removed.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	But do not presume to do this except for one who is wise in the anatomy of the limbs and the egress of the nerves throughout the entire body.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter XLIX.
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	Of the cauterization of ulcers that are mortified.
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When an ulcer is old and does not respond to any of the medicinal ointments, then you cauterize over it with a cautery, pricking it a little, according to the quantity of the depth of the bone, until the whiteness and color of it are removed, and the color of it is changed.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	And then carefully apply that with a mixture of flour, lentils, and rose oil, and with arnica leaves, and either pigeon's blood or round robin's blood, from each one a part, and all mixed together, and then apply a linen cloth and place it on the spot until it is healed.
Capitol .l.	Chapter L.
De cauterizacio de cranc.	Of the cauterization of crabs.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When a cancer begins and you want to stop it, then cauterize it with a circular cautery around its circumference as it is turned.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And some wise men say that it should be cauterized with the pointed cautery in the middle place; but to me this is not seen, because I fear that it will be ulcerated, and I have already seen this some times.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	And it is more proper that it be cauterized around its circumference with a circular cautery as we have said, or with a moving cautery.
Capitol .li.	Chapter LI.
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	Of the cauterization of abscesses.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When some abscess is delayed in maturation, and this is because of the superfluity that causes it, or because of the patient's age, who is old or decrepit, with little blood, or because of time, and you want to hasten the maturation of the abscess; then cauterize around it with a small, moving cautery, and then leave it so that it will hasten in maturation.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	But if you want the perforation of it with a cautery, then you ignite the cautery, the shape of which is this: and pause that in the middle place of the abscess until it penetrates the bone.
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the cautery in that place that is furthest, so that the body of the arm be relieved; and then carefully apply that until it is healed.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter LII.
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	Of the cauterization of corrodents.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	A corrodent is a corruption that walks in the limb, which corrodes it as fire consumes dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	Therefore, if you see that corrodent in a place that suffers cauterization with fire, then you ignite small, moving cauteries, and large ones according to what is convenient in that place where the corrodent is.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And then cauterize that from all sides until you eradicate all the corrosion and no cause of it remains.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	And then leave it for three days, and place over the cauterized places a compress with oil mixed until all the scars are eradicated and all the corruption is gone.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	And then carefully apply that with ointments that generate flesh.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	But if after three days you see that the flesh grows healthy in which there is no corruption, it is good; but if not, then repeat the cauterization over what is raw in the corrupted places.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And a corrodent is medicated some times with sharp medicine, which that is placed in the place of cautery.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	But nevertheless, cauterization with fire is of more gentle help.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And I have already said the cure of it with sharp medicine in the division, and therefore take that when you have need of it.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter LIII.
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	Of the cauterization of warts and other similar things.
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	Many times there is a malady on the lower parts of the foot called a wart, and it is a rough, protruding cause, which makes the foot lame; and cauterization in those is done in two ways, so it is cauterization with fire and cauterization with boiling water.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	But cauterization with fire is that you ignite the cautery concave in the shape of a vulture's beak, which is made of iron according to the quantity which contains the wart from all sides, and is of subtle margins.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	And then place that ignited one over the wart, and then revolve your hand with the cautery around the circumference of the wart until the cautery reaches the depth of the wart.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And let him rest for three days before he begins to throw up.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	And apply a poultice made with wild herbs crushed with salt to that, and leave the poultice on it for a night, so that it is eradicated from its roots.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And treat the area with a gargle of generative meat until it is healed.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	And if it is not converted, and many times it happens on the surface of the body, mostly in the hands and feet, then you must administer cauterization to those with water, and take a small quantity of lead or iron or vulture's bone, and place it on the boil; and then pour a little water into the cavity of the tool, and hold your hand, and you revolve that with the pressure of your hand, and press the edge of the tool into the root of the boil, and it will draw the water into the root of the boil; and wait for the patient a little while for the bite of the water for an hour, and then remove it, because the boil with its roots will be eradicated.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And so do this to those and the other until you come upon all of them on their body.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And treat those pus that the roots of the boils are eradicated with this water that the flesh generates.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter .liiii.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	Of cauterization of tremor.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When someone has a tremor due to heat in the nerve or fever of heat, or for some similar cause, then you must cauterize that with four cauteries or five on the vertebrae of the back, between each vertebra with a cautery; and with a cautery on the feet of him, and on his stomach, with an olive cautery.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the tremor of him will be rested and hastened the health of the feverish illness.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter .lv.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	Of cauterization of white spots accidents on the body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When on the body are spots white, and are pustules split that are made of thick corrupted matter; therefore at the beginning when it appears, that it be cauterized over the top of the fistula with a subtle cautery with twigs of myrtle, the extremity of which is extended with fire; or with roots of erestologia long; or with a lenticular cautery.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	And sometimes it is cauterized additionally at the beginning of its expulsion in this manner; and if they are not believed, and the superfluity is ruptured, then those, and it heals from those.
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	But however, it must be done after evacuation with phlebotomy.
Capitol lvi.	Chapter lvi.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	Of cauterization of flux of blood accident by incision of artery.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Many times there is a flux of artery that is incised, the plague which must be forced, or due to the incision of abscesses or cauterization of the member, and then similar, and it is difficult to remove that.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	Therefore, when it happens to someone, then you must tightly grasp with your hand the orifice of the artery, and place over it your finger, stretching that many times until it stops the flux of blood from your finger, and that it does not come out.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And place in the fire the olive cauteries few and large, by number many, and exhale over them while they are burning.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And take from those one small or one large according to the place and the plague in which the artery is ruptured, over that vein, quickly, as you have removed your finger, and bring the cautery until it is abcised and constricted that blood.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood is expelled from the orifice of the artery when you remove your finger and extract the cautery, then take another cautery tightly from the cauteries that in the fire are prepared, and therefore do not cease to do this one after another until the blood is constricted.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And guard yourself that you do not burn the nerve that is here, and that it comes upon the patient another malice.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And know that when from the artery flows blood, then it is not possible in those to constrict the blood, and especially when the artery is large, if not by one of four ways: or with cautery as we have said, or with extraction when it is not extracted, because when it is extracted the extremities of him are burned well and the blood is constricted, or that it be tied with a thread or with a ligament for strong structure, or that they be placed upon him medicines of which the virtue is to restrict the blood; and be tightened with a cushion with decent constriction.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	But he who administers decent constriction of him with a ligament and with structure with cloths or by position of burning causes and similar, do not confer otherwise than briefly.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	But if this happens to someone and the physician is not present nor medicine, then open with the placement of the finger indicated over the orifice of that vein as we have said, and understand to the great constriction of it until the blood is stopped from the sovereign part of the plague, and over the artery the finger is not removed; and over the artery be sprinkled with cold water of much great coldness until the blood is congealed and thickened; and more cossire in which he has to cauterize or of medicine necessity.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begins the second part.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Of incision and perforation and ventoses and of phlebotomy and of poultices and of their kinds.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucazis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	We have already said in the first chapter all the illnesses in which it is convenient to use a cautery with fire and with medicine that burns, and the occasions and causes of it, and the instruments necessary in those with the forms of the cauteries; and I have arranged the chapters of the hierarchy of the head within the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And I will proceed in this chapter in that same manner, so that the one who wants to know this may be satisfied, about what he has asked.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before that I begin this, know, my son, that in this chapter it is for terror what is in the first chapter of cauterization.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And for that, know that great caution must be exercised, because in the operation which is in this chapter many times the evacuation of blood is necessary, which is the life of man; the sprinkling of the vein or incision upon the abscess or opening of the fistula or purification of the poultice or extraction of the arrow or incision of the stone and their kinds.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And of all those, fear and trembling accompany, and in the hands of them, the death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I admonish you that upon you may not fall this which is said, because sometimes it happens that you handle men with many kinds of illnesses.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And of those there are some who will go away with their illness and it is lighter for them the death, and thus by the vehemence of what he finds of his illness, and by the length of his illness, and with the illness is fear which means death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And of those is the one who gives to you his trust and saying, you expecting with that health, and his illness is pernicious.
E donc no cove que tu consentas en aquel que ve a vos del qual es aquesta manieyra; e la vostra cautela sia major que covesitat e la vostra rapacitat; e no presumatz alcuna causa sobre aquo sino aprop sciencia certa la qual virifica aquo deves vos, e al qual perve successio lausabla.	And therefore, know that you should not consent to that one who comes to you of whom is this manner; and your caution should be greater than covetousness and your greed; and do not presume any cause about this unless with certain knowledge which verifies this, and to which by succession, praiseworthy success.
E usatz en la curacio de totz vostres malautes de pronosticacio e indicacio de lu al qual es salut convertida, quar en aquel es a vos ajutori sobre adquisicio de fama e de memoria, de lausor e de gloria.	And use in the cure of all your illnesses of prognosis and indication of them to which is health converted, because in that is to you an aid on the acquisition of fame and memory, of praise and of glory.
O, filhs, Dieus en vos spire le sieu entendement e no oste a vos direccio e proteccio, quar aquo es en la sua ma.	Oh, sons, may God inspire in you his understanding and no obstacle to your direction and protection, because that is in his hand.
E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat.	And I have ordered this chapter distinguishing by chapters as preceded in the chapter of cauteries, of the cure of the head within the feet, so that it may be to you alleviated what you ask of this and of which you have need.
Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	Of the cure of the water which is contained in the head of children.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	Know that this illness many times happens to children after childbirth and when the midwife tightens the head of the child, its vitality.
E alcunas veguadas endeve per causa amaguada la qual no es saubuda.	And sometimes it happens because of a hidden cause which is not known.
Mays yeu no vi aquesta malautia sino en les enfantz; e a totz aquels les quals yeu vi se coytec la mort, e per ayssi es a mi vist layssada obra en aquels.	But I have not seen this illness except in children; and to all those whom I have seen, the death came, and thus it is to me the work left undone in those.
E yeu e vist que un enfant le cap del qual era d’aygua omplit, e·l cap de lu era totjorn ayssi magnificat entro que ceser no podia sobre si meteys per la grandesa del sieu cap, e mays que la humiditat fe aucmentada entro que foc mort.	And I have seen a child whose head was filled with water, and the head of him was always so magnified that he could not stand upon himself because of the greatness of his head, and more than the humidity increased until fire died.
E aquesta humiditat o es agreguada entre la codena e l’os, o es agreguada dejos le os sobre le ciphac.	And this humidity is either added between the bone and the bone, or it is added after the bone upon the skull.
Quar la operacio en aquel si la humiditat es entre la codena e l’os e le apostema es pauc, lahoras cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am una fissura en la latitut, e sia la longitut de la fissura cays dos notz entro que corra la humiditat, e aquesta es la forma del spatum:	Because the operation in that if the humidity is between the bone and the bone and the abscess is few, then you must do in the middle place of the head with a fissure in the latitude, and be the length of the fissure as two nights until the humidity runs, and this is the form of the spatula:
E donc si la humiditat es mays augmentada e l’apostema es major, lahoras son aqui dos fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	And therefore if the humidity is more increased and the abscess is greater, then there are two fissures according to this manner:
E si la humiditat es dejos le os, senhal de lu es que tu vezes la comissuras del cap ubertas de tota partida e l’aygua es spremuda quan tu compremes aquela am la tieua ma a las partidas dedintz e no es aquo a tu amaguat.	And if the humidity is after the bone, the sign of it is that you see the sutures of the head open from all parts and the water is squeezed when you compress that with your hand at the parts of the head and it is not that to you hidden.
Cove que tu fendas en le mieg loc del cap am tres fissuras segon aquesta manieyra:	Know that you must do in the middle place of the head with three fissures according to this manner:
e aprop la inscizio extratz ne tota la humiditat; e aprop strenh las fissuras am draps e plumassols; e aprop enbroca aquo de sobre am vi e oli entro al quint dia, e aprop deslia le liament e cura la plagua am tentas e enguentz, e strenh le cap am equalitat; e mange le malaute am vianda secca de pauca humiditat entro que·l membre sia confortat e sanat.	And after the incision extract all the humidity; and after strengthen the fissures with cloths and cotton; and after embroca that with wine and oil until the fifth day, and after untie the bandage and cure the wound with tents and ointments, and strengthen the head with equality; and feed the patient with dry food of little humidity until the member is comforted and healed.
E es autra manieyra de incisio, que consideras hon apar la magnitut del apostema e la colleccio de l’aygua, quar alcunas veguadas es mays en le occipicii, o en la partida denant, o en la destra, o en la sinistra; e donc aten am la incizio on appar le apostema e la replecio de l’aygua, e fen aquo segon que a tu es miels possible.	And there is another manner of incision, which you consider honor to appear the magnitude of the abscess and the collection of the water, because sometimes it is more in the occiput, or in the front part, or on the right, or on the left; and therefore attend to the incision where appears the abscess and the repletion of the water, and do it according to what is best for you.
Et observa que no inscindas la arteria e endevengua flueys de sanc e mora le malaute per aquel flux de sanc am evacuacio de humiditat.	And observe that you do not incise the artery and it happens that it flows blood and dies the patient because of that flow of blood with the evacuation of humidity.
Capitol .ii.	Chapter II.
De inscisio de las arterias las quals so aprop las aurelhas, apeladas hilasseysse.	Of the incision of the arteries which are near the ears, called hilasseysse.
Capitol segon.	Chapter Second.
Quan endeveno ad alcu catars o raumas als huelhs o al pietz, e es antiquat aquo, e no confereys en aquo la curacio de las medicinas, lahoras la deriera curacio en aquest es incizio de aquelas dos arterias.	When a catarrh or wound occurs in the hands or feet, and this is old and does not respond to the cure of medicines, then the following cure in this case is the incision of those two arteries.
E donc cove quan tu vols inscidir aquelas que le malaute raza lo sieu cap, e aprop fregua le loc am drap aspre per so que aparan las arcerias, e aprop sia strengut le col del malaute am alcu drap; e aprop considera on polsa la vena; e les locs de quascuna sobre les locs les quals so aprop las aurelhas depremutz, e tant se occultan sino en alcus homes.	And therefore, when you want to incise those that the patient raises their head, and then press the area with a rough cloth so that the arteries appear, and then tighten the patient's neck with some cloth; and then consider where the vein is; and the places of each on the places which are near the ears, and so they are hidden, except in some men.
E aprop senha sobre la arceria am tenta, e aprop inscideys quascuna am le spatum de quascuna partida agut am inscizio pervenient entro al os, e sia aquo per la latitut del cap.	And then pierce over the artery with a tent, and then incise each one with the spatula of each sharp part with incision reaching into the bone, and this by the width of the head.
E si vols, entromet le spatum dejos la arteria e trenqua aquala a las inciden a las partidas desus.	And if you want, insert the spatula below the artery and break it at the incisions at the upper parts.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio cays dos ditz ajustatz, quar quan alcuna vena es inscizida le sanc es eyssit am egressio pulsatil, le qual saut deforo per saut frequent.	And the length of the incision is two fingers adjusted, for when any vein is incised, the blood is emitted with a pulsatile exit, which jumps out by frequent jumps.
Mays si la arceria no apareys al cintiment, lahoras cove que tu mesures de la aurelha la quantitat del spazi de tres ditz, e aprop senha am tenta, e fen entro al os.	But if the artery does not appear to the touch, then you must measure from the ear the quantity of the space of three fingers, and then pierce with a tent, and end inside the bone.
E aquo que cove getar del sanc es quantitat de vi unc., e fort leu ne geta de lu mays o mens, e tot aquo es segon la quantitat la qual appareys de la vertut del malaute e de la replecio de la arceria de lu.	And this that you must get out of the blood is a quantity of one ounce, and very little less or more, and all this is according to the quantity which appears of the virtue of the patient and the repletion of the artery of him.
E aprop considera la plagua, e donc si reman sobre le os alcuna causa del ciphac, lahoras inscindys aquo per so que no endevengua apostema caut.	And then consider the plaque, and therefore if there remains on the bone any cause of the head, then incise this so that it does not become an abscess caut.
E aprop strenh la plagua am plumassols e am liamentz de drap de li, e aprop cura aquela am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then strengthen the plaque with cotton and with bandages of cloth, and then cure this with poultices until it is healed.
Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	Of the extraction of the arteries which are in the temples.
Quan ad alcu accideys emigranea antiqua o catertz agutz, per humiditatz agrimonials e per qualiditat en les lacertz des templas, o sodo antiqua vehement e semblantz ad aquels, e es medicat am las manieyras de curacio de medicina e aquo no comfereys, lahoras nos hem sproatz en aquestas malautias extraccio de las arcerias en les templas, o cauterizacio de aquelas ayssi cum havem mostrat.	When a certain  ancient migraine or catarrh occurs, due to humidity of the  agricola and the quality in the lacerations of the temples, or a very vehement ancient sore and similar to those, and it is medicated with the ways of cure of medicine and this does not respond, then we have resorted in these ailments to the extraction of the arteries in the temples, or cauterization of those as we have shown.
E la manieyra de la operacio e extracio de aquelas es que·l malaute raza les pels les quals son en les templas; e entenda a la arceria apparent en le templar quar ela es a tu mostrada per le sieu pols, e·s occultada sino en paucs homes per vehemencia de freg.	And the manner of the operation and extraction of those is that the patient raises the hair which are in the temples; and understand the artery appearing in the temple because it is shown to you by its pulse, and it is hidden except in few men by the vehemence of the flesh.
E si a tu es occultada, lahoras le col del malaute sia strengut am alcun drap; e aprop fregua le loc am un drap aspre o evapora le loc am aygua cauda entro que aparesca a tu la arceria manifestament.	And if to you it is hidden, then the neck of the patient be tightened with some cloth; and then press the area with a rough cloth or evaporate the area with hot water until the artery appears manifestly to you.
E lahoras tu pren le spatum del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then you take the spatula of which this is the form:
E aprop tu scorja la codena am aquel am facilitat entro que pervenguas a la arceria; e aprop geta en lu onti e extratz aquela a las partidas sobiranas entro que extraguas aquela de la codena e descobras aquela de las tunicas las quals so dejos aquela, de tota partida.	And then you scrape the bone with that with facility until you reach the artery; and then get into it and extract that at the sovereign parts until you extract that from the bone and discover that of the tunics which are below that, of all parts.
Mays si la arteria es subtil, lahoras envolveys aquela am la extremitat del oncii, e aprop inscindeys de aquela una partida segon la quantitat per la qual sian alonguadas las extremitatz de lu e sian contraytas, e no endevindra flux de sanc, quar si no so inscididas no pujara le sanc de tot.	But if the artery is subtle, then envelop that with the extremity of the oncii, and then incise that one part according to the quantity for which the extremities of it are lengthened and contracted, and it will not have a flow of blood, because if they are not incised it will not raise the blood at all.
E aprop evacua del sanc de vi unc. entro a tres.	And then evacuate of the blood of one ounce. within three.
E si la arceria es gran, lahoras cove que tu lies aquela en dos locs am fiel dopble fort de ceda o am cordas a lonc, e no coyte a lu putrefaccio denant la consolidacio de la plagua e endevengua flux de sanc.	And if the artery is large, then you must tie that in two places with a double strong cord or with long ropes, and do not let it putrefy before the consolidation of the plaque and it will become a flow of blood.
E aprop incideys la superfluitat la qual es entre dos liamentz; e fay aquo en aquela hora o aprop autra ora.	And then incise the superfluity which is between two ligatures; and do this at that hour or another hour.
E si vols, cauteriza aquela am cauteri entro al os am cauteri cutellar entro que sian incididas las extramitatz de lu, e stara en loc de aquela meteyssa obra.	And if you want, cauterize that with a cauterizer inside the bone with a cauterizer cutler until the extremities of it are incised, and stay in place of that same work.
E es milhor obra sino que·l malaute aia febre o es de escalfada compleccio; quar cauteri es de aquelas causas que ajudan a las humiditatz finidoras, e donc es milhor en juvament.	And it is a better work if the patient has a fever or is of a hot complexion; because cauterization is of those causes that help the final humors, and therefore it is better in judgment.
E cove aprop la extraccio de las arcerias que huomplas le loc de coto antic, e sian pausatz sobre lu polvils decentement fayt, e aprop sia curat am medicinas seccas fazen naysser la carn e am calguas entro que sia sanat.	And cover after the extraction of the arteries that you have placed the area of the wound, and be laid upon it poultices decently made, and then be cured with dry medicines that make the flesh grow and with hot water until it is healed.
E si mentre obres autra veguada endeventa flux de sanc de la arceria, lahora tu te coyta a restrenger aquel sanc, o am cauteri, o que omplas le loc de coto, e strenh la tua ma entro que sia restreyt le sanc.	And if while you work another vein becomes a flow of blood from the artery, then you must take care to restrain that blood, either with cauterization, or that you fill the area of the wound, and tighten your hand until it is restrained the blood.
E si deguna causa de aquelas no es a tu present, lahoras pausa le tieu dit sobre le loc entro que·l sanc sia congilat, e enbroca le loc am aygua de vehement fregiditat entro que la acuitat repausa, e sia strengut segon que cove.	And if any cause of those is not to you present, then pause your finger on the area until the blood is congealed, and pour the area with water of very cold heat until the sharpness rests, and tighten according to what you must.
