And others are of abscesses in which the incision ought to be concave and be incised, when it is done so that bread is made and it is done in the term that it already follows, such as those that occur in heaps of boils and buboes.
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those are those that are incised with a section having three angles; and of those is the one in which it is incised as the figure of a myrtle leaf, as the abscesses of the angles.
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of those are those in which a round incision and a lunar incision, and similar to those, are administered.
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But that one to whom there is no such as his abscesses are superficial, you ought to lance that with a superficial incision, or flat only.
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And you ought when the abscess is large and has already collected much sania, to lance it and not be covetous that you extract all the pus in that hour; having extracted from it one part, and then close the abscess until the next day, and then extract a greater part, and so do this many times according to the gradation until it is healed.
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is of weak virtue, or a pregnant woman, or a small child, or an old person in decrepitude, for the animal spirit many times is resolved with the egress of the sania, and therefore the patient may die, and you operate on them.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	And guard this chapter with great care, and in the lancing of these abscesses, you ought to abstain from plagues and consider therefore if the plague of the abscess is little, or a flat incision, then you administer the poultices of it or of cotto anti-septic; and if the abscess is large, and the incisions of the lancing are many, then you ought to put meca in each one until they arrive together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if in the abscess is incised a part of the incision or has concaved that in the circuit, then you ought to cover it with old cotto or a thread made of cloth of it, as when you have treated poultices or razors, its humidity; and strengthen that within the third day; and then process that and cure it with that which is ought of the ointments until it is healed.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if blood flows during the operation, then you administer cold water and wine in which you have soaked a cloth, and place it on the location of the blood flow many times.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the bleeding persists, then you must administer treatment and care, and follow the powders that I have recommended in many places in this very book and of division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is in winter, and the location of the abscess is a place of many nerves, then you must enclose powders in wine and hot oil, and place them on the location.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is in summer, and the locations are fleshy, then you must place powders soaked in water and oil or in wine and oil, and all that be cold until the third day, as we have said, and then you must open the abscess and cleanse it and administer to its cure what is convenient to it until it is healed.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary for the knowledge of the cure of abscesses universally, but according to the way of distinction I have already said of every abscess in what manner is the way of its cure by chapters individually.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter .xli.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Of the incision of abscesses which come in the neck of the head.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the neck of the head small abscesses, and they are of a kind of nodes which contain tunics that are to their making; and the kinds of them are many.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And of them are pimples, and of those it is that contain humidity similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And of those are those that contain humidity similar to dust, and resembling to them; and of those are those that are stony, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the incision of all, and in the extraction of those there is no fear, as you must the extraction of those does not make contrary artery.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in incision of those is that you probe those with an instrument the shape of which comes near thus, the one which is called entromes, as long as you know that it contains.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	Because if that which contains is humidity, then you split it with a section according to the length by superficial section according to this form:
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	And begins in the section of the line of .B. within to the line of .G. Therefore, as the humidity is evacuated, then you excoriate that skin that contains that humidity, and do not leave of that any cause of all, because troops many times return, if there remain of that any cause.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	And then you submerge a cloth in Egyptian wash, if it is present, and if not, in water and salt; and fill with that the wound and leave it in for another day, because with that you corrode all that is raw of that skin.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	And then repeat on that cloth with Egyptian wash second and third time if you need it, until you are confident that there is no longer any raw cause of that skin; then cure the wound with wash until it is healed.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if the abscess contains fatty nodes, then you incise it according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	with a section having the form of a cross, and get oncis between two lips of the section and scrape it from all parts, and exert your strength in the extraction of the tunic which contains that.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if your artery makes opposition, then do what I have recounted to you first.
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly do in the stony abscess of incision and cure according to what I have told you; and incision on a stony abscess is easier, because it is of little blood and of little humidity.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	And some times there are some of these abscesses which are in the head in some men with which there is no humidity at all; the cause of which is because I incised on an abscess in the head of an old woman and brought back the abscess as a hard, rough, white, which could not be punctured, and if anyone was struck with that, it would plague them.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in the other abscesses accidents in the head other than this one, this is not this chapter, as well as the abscesses that come to the heads of the children and you must the roots of the ears, but the incision of all these is superficial.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And pause the perforation of those from the lower part of them so that the body be relieved of the blood in the lower parts.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And then cure those with what is convenient for that cure.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter .xlii.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Of the incision of scrofulas which occur in the neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	Many times these abscesses become in the neck and in the armpits and in the groins; and sometimes they occur in the other parts of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur in the neck, and there are many that are generated among them, and all scrofula of those is within its own tunic, and as in the nodes and abscesses of the head, as we have recounted.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the kinds of these scrofulas are many, because of those there are some stony, and of those there are that contain humidity, and of those are malignant ones which do not obey cure.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, in that one which you see of good disposition in the Touch, of which the color of that which is manifest is proper to the color of the neck, and is maugre in all parts, and is not annexed to the nerve of the neck, nor to the veins, nor to the artery, and is not tender, then you must incise it with superficial section from the lower part to the upper part of the body from the line of .G. within the line of .B., and scrape it from all parts, and extend the lips of the neck with a scalpel, or with many scalpels if you have need of them, as we have said in the abscesses of the head, and extract it little by little.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	And it is more careful that the vein or nerve be not incised.
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	And let the spatula not be too sharp, that it does not injure your hand while inciding, or that it disturbs the patient, and that you cut only what is necessary to cut; for if you were to cut a vein or artery and you prohibit yourself from your operation, then the wound will stop with vitriol or other powders that stop the flow of blood, and tighten the wound, and leave that within which the sharpness of the abscess remains and the wound is softened and begins to be pus-filled.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When the blood is cut.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Therefore, return to your operation while you have completed it.
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then inquire with your little finger if there is any cause of the other small abscesses, therefore cut those and clean them.
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is in the root of the large abscess, cover it so that you do not cut that abscess from its root.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Cover it so that you place that with a strong bent iron and that you leave it there until it falls by itself without harm.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	And then fill the wound with old cotton which you have already submerged in Egyptian ointment, and then cure that.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you cut that abscess entirely, then cover it so that you adjust the two lips of the wound and close it as soon as pus comes out so that there is no remaining superfluity.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is superfluity due to the size of the abscess, cover it so that you understand to cut the root of it, and extract it and administer a suture and that which is said.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And those of the abscesses that contain humidity, perforate it with a superficial perforation here where you see the place of maturation of it, and place a perforation of it so that it lets the pus out from the bottom of the body, as we have said.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	And then administer a perforation, poultices with ointment and similar things to those, so that it corrodes what is left of the corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	And then when you see the wound already cleaned, then cure it with ointment of generative flesh until it is healed.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter .xliii.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of the section of the pile of the abscess that happens within the gullet.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients said this section in the epiglottis, and no one has seen in our land that it has been done.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of the sermon of those.
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men having a hernia, cover that the extraction of the epiglottis be avoided, as for that it is not done well for that all the veins and major arteries of the patient are here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But in those who have abscesses caused in the mouth or gullet or both ears, when the illness is not in the canal, cover using the section of the epiglottis to avoid the damage which is done by perforation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, when we want this, that they cut the epiglottis below three circles of the circles of the epiglottis, or four with a small section for the width in the one that is between two circles by quantity, that the section be in cartilage, not in the flesh, and this place is convenient for section, because it is deprived of flesh and the blood vessels of it are few.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the physician is fearful, cover that he extends the throat of the gullet with an incision, and then make the incision until it reaches the canal, but avoid the blood vessels if you see any cause of them.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	And then cut the cartilage as we have recommended; and it is signified over the section of the canal by the flame which is of that exit with that which is of it disrupted and by the abscess of the voice.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And leave the wound open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore, as the hour is remade in which perforation is feared, add two lips of the throat of the wound, and stitch that alone with the cartilage.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	And then administer medicines that cause flesh to grow until it is healed.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis says that the sum of the sermon which we have recounted, the exposition is not but that you see that some of those abscesses have already opened the throat of the patient, and the patient has come into death, and the air of it is contracted, and some go to cut the epiglottis so that the patient breathes over the place of the wound by some respiration, and be saved from death.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And for this command to leave the wound open until the malice of the illness is consumed; and the malice of it is for three days; and then cover the wound, and cure it until it is healed.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And that which I have seen with my own eyes, is that a servant took a knife and put it in her throat and cut with it a part of the canal of the lung, and I was called to the cure of her, and I brought the woman back as she was dying, and I uncovered the wound and brought back the blood which was coming out of the wound small.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore, I was confessed that she had not cut a vein nor guidegi, and the wind was coming out of the wound, and I cured her until she was healed.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And I did not accuse the servant if she did not recover her voice, and after some days she returned to improvement of her dispositions.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that there is no fear in the section of the epilhot.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter XLIV.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of the incision on the abscess that occurs in the throat outside, and is called a throat hernia.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This abscess called a throat hernia is a large abscess according to the color of the body, and it moves in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	And it is in two ways, whether it is natural or accidental.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And in the natural one it is not born to cure.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	And the accidental one is in two ways, of which one is similar to fatty nodes, and the other way is similar to an abscess that is made by the blockage of an artery, and in that one there is fear.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And no cove that it be presumed to him as iron, but in that one that is small.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then you probe that and investigate that with the finger, and if you find it similar to a fatty node, and it is not suspended by any of the veins, then you incise it as the nodes, and extract it with that which contains it from the skin and the bursa; and if not, then you scrutinize its whole being, and then cure the place with what is necessary for healing before it is healed.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter XLV.
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	Of the incision of the species of nodes.
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	Of nodes there are many species, and I have already said all the species of them in the division.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And I have to count thus the difference between a node and an excrescence as if there were a doubt.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Therefore, I say that in an excrescence there is heat and fever and vehement pains until the boiling of the superfluity is subsided; and it is a complication of putrefaction that at the hour ceases the fever, the pain, and the heat.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But in a node there is neither heat nor fever nor pain, and it counts that which is the lion's head which is in its own sac.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it is according to the color of the body, and the beginning of it is like a seed and it is made as a vessel, whether it is larger or smaller, and they are according to two species, whether they are fatty and contain humidity, and the colors of the humidity are many, according to what I said in the division.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you come to the cure of a node, that you probe it and inquire about it at the beginning with the instrument that is called intromes, according to what will come its form in the chapter which is next to this.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And this way of inquiry of abscesses and of all nodes, and it is that you take this instrument and introduce it into the moist place which you find in the abscess, and you revolve your fingers with it little by little until you know that the instrument has already penetrated the core.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	And then, finally, your hand according to the measure of the greatness of the abscess, and you extract the intromes and consider what is issued in the trace of it.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the humidity is flowing out, of whatever color it may be, then you incise it with a superficial incision according to what I have said in the other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if from the trace of the intromes there is no humidity, then you know that it is fatty.
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And cut over it with an incision having the shape of a cross according to this form:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	as you have been taught, and suspend it with forceps, and excise the core from all parts with ease, and keep the skin or sac, if you can, over it and extract that sania with the node.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it is broken in the operation, it is not possible to extract that sania, and many times it must be so, and then you extract it in pieces until there remains no cause from it.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	For if from it remains no cause, little or much, the node returns according to the most.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that from it remains any small part, then complete the wound with some sharp corrosive powders and strengthen the wound, and place over it that which sits abscess caut, and cure it from the other cure until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it is a large node, then you sew the two lips of it and cure it with that which incarnates.
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if a pulsating vein is in it opposite, or non-pulsating, then you cauterize and moisten the place of zegi trissat that is vitriol and leave that strait for two or three days until you can pierce the wound and that the boiling of the blood rests; and then return to incise that which is broken from the node.
Capitol .xlvi.	Chapter XXXVI.
De las formas del sturmentz necessaris en seccio e perforacio.	Of the forms of the instruments necessary in incision and perforation.
De aquels so las formas dels intromesas, e so de tres specias, que de aquels es alcu gran, e de lor es migier, e de lor es petit.	Of those there are the forms of the intromes, and they are of three species, of which one is large, and of them is medium, and of them is small.
La forma de intromes gran es aquesta:	The form of the large introme is this:
La forma de intromes migier es aquesta:	The form of the medium introme is this:
La forma de intromes petit es aquesta:	The form of the small introme is this:
Sian faytz de ferr, de alfulud, de extremitatz cayradas decentment, per so que festino le intrament en les apostemas.	They are made of iron, of lead, of extremities well-rounded, so that they facilitate the entrance into the abscesses.
E aquestas so las formas dels experientz, e son nompnatz albered, e un de aquels es apelat berid.	And these are the forms of the experients, and they are called albered, and one of them is called berid.
E so de tres especias, quar de lor es gran, migier e pauc.	And there are three kinds, for of them is large, medium and small.
La forma de experient gran, forma de lu:	The shape of the large one, its form:
La forma de experient migier, forma de lu:	The shape of the medium one, its form:
La forma de experient pauc, forma de lu:	The shape of the small one, its form:
Conveneysso que sian per aquels apostemas e exituras e fistulas e bubos per so que entre aquelas so dels osses e de autras causas.	It is conveyed that they are for those abscesses and fistulas and boils so that among them are of the bones and other causes.
E so faytz redontz, grosses, leons, ayssi cum grans agulhas am las quals son cosidas las selhas, e son faytas de eram citri, o de eram o de ferr, o de argent, E las milhors so quan so faytas de eram citri.	And they are made round, thick, long, like large needles with which the stitches are sewn, and they are made of citrus copper, or of lead or of iron, and the best are when they are made of citrus copper.
E son faytz les experient de plum negre, les quals se acordan que per aquels sian ubertas las fistulas en la conquavitat de las quals so reflexios, que sian reflectidas am la sua levitat am aquelas refleccios.	And they are made the instruments of black plum, the ones which are agreed that for those to be opened the fistulas in the concavity of which are reflections, that they are reflected with their lightness with those reflections.
E so de tres specias, quar alcus de lor so loncs, e dels autres migiers, e dels autres breus, segon la quantitat del ample de la fistula e de la strictura de lu.	And they are of three species, for some of them are long, and of the others medium, and of the others short, according to the quantity of the width of the fistula and of the stricture of it.
Forma del experient gran de plom:	Shape of the large plum instrument:
Forma del experient migier de plom:	Shape of the medium plum instrument:
Forma del experient petit de plom:	Shape of the small plum instrument:
Las formas dels oncis so de motas specias, quar de aquels so alcus simples, als quals es una curvitat solament, e so de tres specias: grans, paucs e migiers.	The shapes of the probes are of many species, for of those some are simple, to which there is only one curvature, and they are of three species: large, small and medium.
E de lor so uncis orps, e so de tres specias.	And of them are curved probes, and they are of three species.
E de aquels so uncis haventz doas curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And of those are probes having two curvatures, and they are of three species.
E de lor so haventz tres curvaturas, e so de tres specias.	And of those are having three curvatures, and they are of three species.
E totz aquetz so necessaris en lor loc.	And all of these are necessary in their place.
Forma de unci simple gran, forma de lu:	Shape of a simple large probe, shape of it:
Forma de unci simple migier:	Shape of a simple medium probe:
Forma de unci simple pauc, forma de lu:	Shape of a simple small probe, shape of it:
Forma de unci orp gran:	Shape of a curved large probe:
Forma de unci orp migier, forma de lu:	Shape of a curved medium probe, shape of it:
Forma de unci orp pauc, forma de lu:	Shape of a curved small probe, shape of it:
Forma de unci gran havent dos curvaturas:	Shape of a large probe having two curvatures:
Forma de unci migier havent dos curvatas:	Shape of a medium probe having two curvatures:
Forma de unci pauc havent dos curvaturas:	Shape of a small probe having two curvatures:
Forma de unci gran havent tres curvaturas:	Shape of a large probe having three curvatures:
Forma de unci migier havent tres curvaturas:	Shape of a medium probe having three curvatures:
Forma de unci pauc havent tres curvaturas:	Shape of a small probe having three curvatures:
E aquestas so las formas dels scalpels am les quals son seccatz e scorjatz les nodes e le apostemas, e so de tres specias, quar de aquels es gran, migier, e pauc.	And these are the shapes of the scalpels with which the nodes and abscesses are cut and scraped, and they are of three species, for of those one is large, medium, and small.
Forma de scapel gran:	Shape of a large scalpel:
Forma del scapel migier:	Shape of the medium scalpel:
Forma de scapel pauc:	Shape of a small scalpel:
Las extramitatz de aquels am les quals es fayta seccio so agudas e las autres extramitatz so no-agudas, e no so pausadas en tal manieyra, sino per que sia fayt juvament en la excorjacio dels nodes la temor de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e per aquels sia sanat le malaute e atrobe tranquilitat un petit per la adustio la qual atroba deves la excoriacio del apostema.	The extremities of those with which the section is made are sharp and the other extremities are blunt, and they are not placed in such a manner, but that it may be made gently in the excoriation of the nodes the fear of incision of vein or nerve, and by those the disease may be healed and peace be restored a little by the application which brings the excoriation of the abscess.
E aquestas son las formas de almagidas, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc, ayssi cum veyras.	And these are the shapes of spatulas, and they are of three species: large, medium and small, as you see.
La forma de magda gran:	The shape of a large spatula:
Forma de magda migier:	Shape of a medium spatula:
Forma de magda pauc:	Shape of a small spatula:
Sian faytas de eram e so semblantz de ray am le qual e fayt alcofol.	They are made of copper and are similar to a ray with which and alcohol is made.
E es en la extramitat lada punctada am spatum occultada e en aquela corr a las partidas dedintz e defora, quan tu vols, ayssi cum veses.	And it is in the lateral extremity pointed with a spatula hidden and in that one runs to the parts inside and outside, when you want, as you see.
Las formas de spatimis, les quals so amaguatz entre los ditz deves la perforacio dels apostemas e no les percebo les malautes, e so de tres specias: gran, migier e pauc.	The shapes of spatulas, which are hidden between the fingers during the perforation of abscesses and not perceived by the patients, and they are of three species: large, medium and small.
E aquestas so las formas de aquels:	And these are the shapes of those:
Las formas de ventozas am las quals es abscindit le flux del sanc, e so de tres specias; gran, migiera e pauca; las formas de lu:	The shapes of cupping glasses with which the flow of blood is abscised, and they are of three species; large, medium and small; the shapes of them:
Sian faytas de eram citri, redondas am alcuna longitut , e sian subtils.	They are made of citrus copper, round with some length, and they are subtle.
E cove que sian aquestas specias de ventosas deves tu grans, migieras e paucas, per so que per aquelas abscindas flux de sanc am velocitat en necessitat, e lahoras quan a tu primieyrament no es medicina.	And know that these species of cupping glasses, you large, medium and small, so that by those you abscise the flow of blood with speed in necessity, and then when to you first it is not medicine.
Enpero no uses de aquelas ad abscidir sanc en tot loc del cors, e non uses sino en locs carnoses, ayssi cum en les lacertis de las cambas e de las coyssas, e en les lacertz dels brasses, e de las mamillas e del ventre e dels engonars, e semblantz a lor dels lacertz carnoses humitz.	However, do not use those to abscise blood in every location of the body, and do not use them except in fleshy locations, such as in the folds of the arms and thighs, and in the folds of the breasts, and of the belly and of the groin, and similar to their fleshy and moist folds.
E alcunas veguadas son faytz de aquels strumentz autres petitz semblantz scorsas de fisacs segon aquesta forma; per les quals lo sanc es abscindit quan es fayt per fleubotomia, o deves inscizio de vena o de arceria.	And sometimes those instruments are made other small ones resembling scorsas of fish according to this form; by which the blood is abscised when it is done by phlebotomy, or by incision of vein or artery.
E alcunas veguadas son faytas redondas segon aquesta forma:	And sometimes they are made round according to this form:
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter .xlvii.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	Of the cure of the breasts of men which are assembled from women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Sometimes breasts of certain men become inflamed, like those that begin to be hairy, and then the breasts become inflamed, and the breasts are assembled like those of women, and they are pus-filled, they are removed.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And to him who has this, he must cut those with a lunar section according to this form, from the line of B. to the line of G., and then scrape the entire thickness, and then fill the wound with a medicament of flesh color, and then adjust the two lips of the wound with stitching, and care for him until it is healed.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the breast inclines to the sides and is softened by its magnitude as it should to women, then it is cut in two parts, its surpluses, with two sections similar to the lunar figure, of which each one is contained in the other, as long as the major line contains the minor one according to this form of the line of B. and the line of G. And then scrape the flesh which is between the two lips of the wound, and remove the fat, and administer what we have said of the suture and the powders, what is necessary in the cure until it is healed.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not comply with the incision of this one that must be cut because of the restlessness of the patient, and the flow of blood, then you must fill the wound with a cloth submerged in corrosive liquid and leave it until that corrosive one that is the flesh, and then care for him until it is healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter .xlviii.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	Of the perforation of abscesses that come from the nipple.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	These abscesses that come from the nipple are of the kind of scrofulas, hard, which contain a skin that is removed.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And of those, some contain humidity; and those that contain humidity must be incised with a lunar section according to this figure: from the line of G. to the line of B. And as soon as everything that is in the abscess of the healthy is evacuated, then you fill it with old cloth and leave it until the next day.
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	And then the cloth is removed and it is cured with a suitable ointment to it, until it is healed.
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	And if the abscess is of the kind of nodes and scrofulas, then you cut it as we have said in the section on scrofulas similarly.
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	But if the wound is extended so that it is a pockmark, then administer cauterizing in it according to what we have said before.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter .xlix.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	Of the incision of abscesses that occur because of an artery or vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery is ruptured, and the flesh which is over it is consolidated, then many times abscesses occur. And the signs by which it is known that inflammation and abscess are from the artery or vein: that when the abscess is from the artery it is long aggregated in the front of the body; and that when you pierce the abscess with your fingers, you feel in it a kind of stridor.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And that one which is from the vein is red and manifest on the front of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And incision over this abscess is an error, and most of all in those that are from the armpits, and the corners, and the neck, and many other places of the body; and it is very large, so that its cure with iron should be avoided, and that one which is in the extremities, or on the head, should be avoided.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But over that one which is from the inflammation of the orifice of the artery, cut in the flesh a long section; and then probe the section with a probe and the artery, and deliver from the tunics until it is uncovered.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And then put on that needle and make it penetrate into the other part, and tighten the artery with a double thread in two places, — which cause you to see in the extraction of two arteries which are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And then poke the place which is between two ligaments with a spatula until all the blood that is in it is removed, and the abscess is dissolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then administer a cure in which it is generated power until the ligaments fall; and then care for it with suitable ointments to it until it is healed.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if the abscess is from the section of a vein, then you must have with your hand that which is possible of the abscess with the flesh, and then introduce the needle from the place which you have had from your hand, and make it penetrate; and be in that double thread until you extract it from the other part, and then tie the abscess with a good ligament according to what I have told you in the ligament of the grape of two parts with two extremities of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you fear that the thread will be extracted, then introduce the thread with that needle from all the abscess, besides the incision of the first needle, and tighten your threads in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	Then dry the abscess in the middle of it until when it is issued the water that is in it, then you cut the superfluity of the flesh, and leave what of it is tied.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then place on it the powder which you have submerged in wine and oil, and then administer the cure which is made with poultices and ointments until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter 1 of the abscess which occurs due to a twisting of nerves.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Thus as abscesses occur in arteries and veins, and similarly abscesses occur in nerves when they are struck or when they are overworked, and similarly.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is made most in the places of the helpers or the heel, or in any place where the joints are sore.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a serious abscess, and it is assembled to the color of the other body, and in the major parts of it dispositions are seen, and when it is tightened with violence, the patient feels in it a seeming stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not an abscess added in the front of the body, and for that it is left the code, and it is sore to all parts and does not go to the parts in front or behind.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, those that are in the joints should not be treated with iron, because it will certainly cause a contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But the one that is in the head or in the front, treat it with a spatula.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a small abscess, then take that with the forceps and cut it to the root.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then you suspend it with a hook, and excise it, and then you cover it; and adjust the wound with suture, and cure it until it is healed.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 2.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	Of the section of an abscess which occurs from a boil that occurs to the belly.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	And it happens to some men, growths in the bellies of those and in other parts of the body of those, which are called fungals because of their similarity to fungi, of which the root is subtle and the head of it is thick; and already the lips of those are converted, and it is of those that are small, and it is of those that are magnified.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have already seen one, and in the belly of him were two parts which were more like fungi, and there was no difference between those white, of fine root.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And already the lips of those were reversed and they were splitting, and humidity was running from it all the time.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore, I incised those and brought out in one of them about eighteen inches. and the other about six inches.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the operation in the incision of them is that you consider, then if the patient is humid, and the color of the boil is white, humid, of subtle root; then you should cut it with a spatula, and be in your presence cauterize it with fire, because many times the secretion of it must be expelled with much blood; and if you come to the blood, cauterize it.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if you see the patient pale and fearful, guard yourself from incision with iron; but then take a piece of recent lead made, and strengthen it with that boil, the manner of which is that we have said; and leave it there for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	And then adjust in the stricture of the lead wire; therefore, do not cease to strengthen the lead greatly, until it is excised and falls by itself with its work.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the boil is of a thick root, then in the incision of it there is some cause of fear and of terror, and more so in the one that is in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But it is possible that you should cut most of it, and then cauterize it so that it does not return.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And then cure it until the wound is healed.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And guard yourself that you do not presume to cut the boil which is of a dark color, of little feeling, of slight regard, for that is an abcess cancerous.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I come with the remembrance of cancer, then.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter 3.
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Of the cure of an eminence of the navel.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	An eminence of the navel is made for many causes; or by fissures of the fascia which is over the belly, and veins of it the tissue or intestine according to what it should be in the other ruptures; or by blood which flows from a vein or artery according to what is said before, or by wind contracted in it.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is by fissure of the fascia and by protrusion of the tissue, then the color of the abscess is similar to the color of the body; and it is lean in its pain, and then appears from different situations.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is by the exit of the intestine, then the situation of it with it of what we have recounted, of more vehement diversity, and when you press it with your fingers it is hidden, and then it returns; and very much is felt in it, and it is magnified much by the entrance of bath and vehement work.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is by humidity, then it is lean and it is not hidden when you press it with your hand, nor is it constricted, nor is it increased.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is by blood, then with these signs appears the abscess in a dark decline.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is by flesh nothing, then the abscess is serious, thick and hard, and it is placed according to a quantity.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is by wind, then the touch of it is lean.
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the operation in it is that you consider, then if the eminence of the navel is by blood of artery, or of vein, or by wind; then it is necessary that you should be prohibited from the cure of it, for in that there is fear and terror as you have been taught in the chapter in which I have said the abscesses by artery and by vein.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the prominence of the navel is due to a hernia or a tumor, then command the patient to hold their leg, and be standing extended; and then feel with your finger around the entire navel, and then command them to lie between their hands on their back, and then surround it with a broad spatula around the area which you have felt with the finger; and then extend the majority of the abscess to the upper parts with a large probe; and then tie it around with a strong thread or with a cord in the manner of tying properly.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And then insert the tip of the probe extended over the ligament and introduce your finger into that area and seek the hernia; and if you have found it or guarded it by the ligament, then you extract it and push the hernia to the sides of the belly.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you have found the tumor, then take it with a probe; and cut away the superfluities of it.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is contrary to your artery or vein, then surround that spot, and then return to your operation; and take two needles and put in those two strong threads and introduce the two needles into the circuit which you have made around the abscess in a manner of cross, which you make penetrate; and then strengthen the abscess in four parts over the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you want, remove the needles and leave the spot until the flesh can extend and fall by itself; or cut it when it is softened and can be cut, and then cure it with water which the physicians prescribe until it is healed.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the prominence of the navel is of flesh nothing in it or by humidity, then command that you make the abscess as we have said and extract the blood or humidity, which you find in it, and then cure it with water which the physicians prescribe and which consolidates the area.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter .liii.
De curacio de cranc.	Of the cure of cancer.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already said, in the division, of the special kinds of cancer and in what manner it is treated with medicines, and that it is dangerous to treat it with iron because it is not ulcerated; and we have said that cancer is generated in the marrow and the caution of its cure.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients said that sometimes cancer is in a place where it is possible to eradicate it, as in cancer that is in the nipples or in the groin and their likeness of the limbs allocated to extract all of that, and especially when it is just beginning small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is ancient and is large, do not command yourself to it, because I have not been able to heal from that at all, nor have I seen another, nor that has come to that.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the operation in it is when it is allocated as we have said, is that you proceed and leave the patient and purge of black cholera sometimes, and then bleed him, if a manifest repletion is found.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And then prepare the patient with preparation in which he is located for the operation, and prohibit in the tract the probes which command to that; and concave from all parts with the good codena careful extraction so that no remains any cause of the roots of it.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And let the blood run, and do not cut it lightly, and express the places, and absorb the thick blood all with your hand or with an instrument with which is at your disposal of the instruments.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if it causes you trouble of thick blood incision of vein or artery, then cauterize that until the flow of blood is ceased, and then cure it with the other cure until it is healed.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter .liv.
De curacio de ydropici.	Of the cure of dropsy.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recounted, in the division, of the kinds of dropsy of water, and the signs of each kind, of the cure of it with medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And that which is cured with iron is only the kind of althitas alone, and it is not approached with iron to the kind of timpanistres nor to the kind of yposarcha, because that is mortal.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have already medicated this kind of timpanistres dropsy with medicines and do not confer your medication, then consider, that if the patient already has achieved weakness, or is with that other illness another dropsy, as if it is in his cough or body of the belly and similar to those, then guard yourself that you do not medicate him with iron, because fear is upon that.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you see the patient of exuberant virtue, and in him there is no other illness but dropsy alone, and not a child nor an old man, then the manner of the operation of him is that you elevate the patient between your hands, and the minister then expresses the belly of him with his hand, impelling the water to the side below the navel, and then take a spatula spines according to this form:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	it is of two parts sharp long, of sharp extremity as a spatula; but however, let it be in it some shortness small by small, so that in the operation with that you do not pass into the hernia, and that you lead that.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And consider if the generation of dropsy is of the part of the hernias, because then command that with the section you are distanced from the navel for the quantity of three digits to the sides below, in the right of him over the navel.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the generation of dropsy is by illness of the liver, then your section be left of the navel for three digits.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if the generation of him is by the measles, then the incision should be on the right side.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And do not let the incision be on the side where the patient wants to cough, so that the superfluities do not run to that place freely.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And then pierce with the instrument the entire chain, and then introduce into that incision, and elevate your hand with the spatula between the chain and the siphon, and you excoriate that; and if the quantity of a fingernail or around.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And then pierce the siphon until the spatula reaches the desired location, and it is the place of the water.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then extract that and introduce an instrument of which this is the shape:
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and is similar to a silver cannula; it is made of silver or brass or lead, to which at the lower part of it is a small hole, and on the sides of it are three holes: two on one side and one on the other side; and the end of it is made blunt according to the manner of a feather, as sometimes:
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And at the end of it most sovereign is an armlet, for when the instrument reaches the water, then immediately it rises upon the instrument, therefore evacuates the water in the middle quantity, for if you evacuate more of that which is not due in the hour, very soon the patient will die by resolution of his animal spirit, or it will happen to him five-pi that is approaching death.
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	But evacuate of that according to the quantity of the virtue of it and according to what the dispositions of the patient signify to you of the virtue of the pulse of it and of the goodness of it.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	And then extract the instrument, and retain the water which causes is for it is immediately retained by the chain which retains the hole which is on the siphon of which and recommits to you that you pierce it according to that manner.
E aprop itera le instrument al autra dia si vezes le malaute tollerant aquo, e extratz de la aygua petita quantitat, e fay aquo per alcus jorns sobre temor, e guarda te de error entro que no romangua de l’aygua sino pauc.	And then repeat the instrument on the other day if the patient tolerates water, and extract from the water a small quantity, and do water for some days out of fear, and guard yourself from error so that it does not remain of the water but little.
Mays si tu temes sobre le malaute, e leyssas de l’aygua gran quantitat, lahoras cura aquel am sepultura en arena cauda, e mota suzor en banh, e al solelh espere per lonc temps; e cura aquel am medicinas dessicativas entro que sia sanat.	But if you fear about the patient, and let out of the water a large quantity, then cure that with burial in damp sand, and move him to a bath, and in the sun wait for a long time; and cure that with drying medicines until it is healed.
E cauteriza sobre le stomac, e la melsa e·l fitge aprop la extraccio de l’aygua, segon que yeu he recontat en aquo que es precedit.	And cauterize on the stomach, and the measles and the fig,  approach the extraction of the water, according to what I have recounted in what is preceding.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter .lx.
De la curacio dels enfants les quals so natz les locs de la urina no-perforatz.	Of the cure of children who are born with the places of urine unpierced.
Alcunas veguadas alcun dels enfantz es eyssi del ventre de la sua mayre e·l cap de la sua mixtio no es perforat (o es trauc streyt o no es en son loc).	Sometimes some of the children are born from the womb of their mother and the head of their mixture is not pierced (or it is a straight hole or it is not in its place).
Donc cove coytar am perforacio de lu tantost que es nascut am spatum mot subtil segon aquesta forma:	Therefore, it is necessary to return with the perforation of it as soon as it is born with a very fine spatula according to this form:
E aprop pausa en le trauc un clavil subtil de plom e ligua aquel, e te per tres jorns o per .iiii.tre.	And then place in the hole a small lead nail and tie that, and keep it for three days or for four.
E quant vol urinar sia remaugut e hurine; e aprop retorne aquel.	And when it wants to urinate, it will be disturbed and urinate; and then return that.
E si tu no pauses le plom, ja es possible que la urina la qual va sobre le loc, no leysa aquest claure.	And if you do not place the lead, it is already possible that the urine which goes over the place, does not leave that opening.
Mays aquel del qual le trauc es streyt sia medicat am clavil de Plom, ayssi cum havem dit, per trops dias entro que sia amplificat.	But that one of whom the hole is straight, be medicated with a lead nail, as we have said, for too many days until it is amplified.
Mays aquels en les quals es le trauc no en son loc, so leditz, la qual causa es quar de aquels, aquel que es nat e·l trau es deves la fi del cap de la vergua per que no pot urinar a las partidas dedintz, entro que eleva la vergua am la sua ma a las partidas desus; e no es a lu generacio, per so quar le sperma no pot pervenir a la mayre segon rectitut, e es malautia mot laga.	But those in whom the hole is not in its place, are ledged, the cause is that of those, that one who is born and the hole is the end of the head of the vagina because it cannot urinate in the middle parts, until it elevates the vagina with its hand to the upper parts; and it is not to its generation, for so the sperm cannot reach the mother according to rectitude, and it is a very bad disease.
E la manieyra de la operacio en lu es que·l malaute sia envessat sobre le sieu dos, e aprop exten le cap de la vergua de lu am la tua ma sinistra am vehement extraccio, e inscideys le cap del cap de la vergua del loc del perpucii am spatum agut, ayssi cum es inscizio de pluma, o que tu ne razas alcuna partida, per so que·l mieg de lu vengua semblant al cap de la vergua e que le trauc caia en le mieg loc segon que cove.	And the manner of the operation in it is that the patient be inverted upon its two, and then extend the head of the vagina of it with your left hand with vehement extraction, and inscise the head of the head of the vagina of the place of the perpucii with a sharp spatula, as it is incision of a feather, or that you do not scrape any part, so that the middle of it comes to resemble the head of the vagina and that the hole falls in the middle place according to what is due.
E guarda te que en la tua operacio de flux de sanc, quar motas vetz accideys aquo; e pausa te a lu am aquo que abscindeys le sanc, e cura la plagua entro que si’ sanada.	And guard yourself that in your operation of flux of blood, for many times accidents happen with water; and pause yourself to it with water that you have separated the blood, and cure the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lvi.	Chapter .lvi.
De albater le qual accideys en le prepucii en le cap de la vergua e de corropcio e negror e adherencia del prepucii del cap de la vergua.	Of albation which happens in the prepuce in the head of the vagina and of corruption and blackness and adhesion of the prepuce of the head of the vagina.
Motas veguadas accideys aquest albater en la vergua e es eminencia de carn laga.	Many times this albation happens in the vagina and is a prominence of flesh very bad.
E de aquela una es maligna e autra es no-maligna.	And of that one is malignant and another is not malignant.
No-maligna, cove que suspendas am unci subtil e abscindas aquela entro que aquela mondes tota; e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto submirgit en enguent egipciac; e aprop aquel, cura le am enguent diafinicon entro que sia sanat.	The non-malignant one, it is necessary that you suspend it with a fine needle and cut that until that it is all gone; and then place upon that a cloth submerged in Egyptian ointment; and then that, cure it with diaphicon ointment until it is healed.
E si albater es maligna, de lega color, lahoras cove que tu aministres cauteri aprop la inscizio de lu e la razio de lu.	And if the albation is malignant, of bad color, then it is necessary that you administer cautery near the incision of it and the rawness of it.
Mays si albater es en le prepuci del cap de la vergua no-circumcis, e la una partida de albater es dedintz le prepucii e l’autra partida es defora, lahoras cove que tu ostes albater le qual es dedintz al comensament entro que es consolidat; e lahora tu cura aquel deforo, quar quan tu curas aquel ensemps le prepuci, no es asegurat que no sia trinquat.
