But if there is pus in the foreskin of the uncircumcised penis, and one part of the pus is inside the foreskin and the other part is outside, then you must drain the pus that is inside first while it is still fresh; and then you treat the pus that is outside, because when you treat the pus at the same time as the foreskin, it is not guaranteed that it will not be torn.
E ja eysamen accideys en les genetius e en le prepuci negror e corruccio, adonc cove que tu conquavas tot aquo que ja es denigrat e que ja se vol corrompre o que ja es corrumput; e aprop lineys sobre aquel aprop aquo am mel, le qual es contusit am farina de scorsa de milgrana e de errs trissatz e crivellatz.	And if there are black and foul blemishes on the genitals and foreskin, then you must cleanse all that which is already corrupted and which is about to corrupt or which is already corrupted; and then apply a poultice on that which is corrupted with honey, which is mixed with ground quince peel and dried and crushed herbs.
E aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sana.	And then treat it with the other cure until it is healed.
Mays si endeve flux de sanc, lahoras aministra cauteri lunar segon aquesta forma:	But if there is a flow of blood, then administer a lunar cautery according to this form:
quar cauteri juvatiu es a dos disposicios ensemps, so es a flux de sanc e a la plagua quan es corrumpuda.	Because a helpful cautery is in two dispositions at once, so it is for the flow of blood and for the plague when it is corrupted.
E si le cap de la vergua es corrodut e es destruit tot en la hora, lahoras cove que tu intrometas en lo meat del prepucii una canula de plom per so que le malaute urina per aquela.	And if the head of the penis is corrupted and is destroyed all at once, then you must introduce into the meat of the foreskin a lead tube so that the patient urinates through that.
En la adherencia del prepucii am le cap de la vergua (et aquesta adherencia no accideys sino en aquel del qual le prepucii es sa, e sobre lu no es exhigida circumcizio; e quan accideys adherencia per plagua o per apostema) cove que excorjas am spatum obtus entro que sia dissolvut le liament e sia deliurat le cap de la vergua de tota partida.	In the adhesion of the foreskin to the head of the penis (and this adhesion does not occur except in that of whom the foreskin is his, and on which circumcision is not performed; and when adhesion occurs due to plague or abscess) you must excise with a blunt spatula until the ligament is dissolved and the head of the penis is released entirely.
E si es dificil desirnir aquelas exquisidament, lahoras cove que tu excorjes am spatum alcuna causa del cap de la vergua e del prepucii, e aysso es quar le prepucii, quan es subtil, fort leu es perforat per la sua subtilitat leugierament.	And if it is difficult to separate them delicately, then you must excise with a spatula some cause from the head of the penis and the foreskin, and thus it is because the foreskin, when it is subtle, is easily perforated by its subtlety.
E aprop separa entre·l prepucii e·l cap de la vergua am dra7 de li subtil, le qual ja es mulhat en l’aygua frega per que no adherescan autra veguada.	And then separate between the foreskin and the head of the penis with a thread of silk, which is already soaked in cold water so that they do not adhere again.
E aprop sia curat am vi stiptic entro que sia consolidat.	And then treat it with a poultice of vi stiptic until it is consolidated.
Capitol .lvii.	Chapter .lvii.
De mundificacio dels enfants e de la curacio de aquo que accideys ad aquels de circumcisio.	Of the purification of children and the cure of those who suffer from circumcision.
Circumcisio no es solucio de continuitat ayssi cum las autras plaguas: mays empero cum sia de la nostra operacio e de nostra voluntat, e lus de aquela sia propriament en les enfants, es necessari que asignem en aquela milhor operacio e via pus leugiera perdusent a salut.	Circumcision is not a solution of continuity like other plagues: but since it is of our operation and our will, and it is proper to those of our children, it is necessary that we assign in that better operation and way less harmful to health.
Donc dic que les antics no diyssero circumcisio en alcu dels lors libres, quar no n’usan en las suas leys, e no es sino quar havem aquisit per speriment, la qual causa es que yeu he atrobat la major partida dels artifexs e dels barbies usar circumcisir e mundificacio am novacula e am torores; e usan de liament am fiel e de inscizio am la ungla.	Therefore, I say that the ancients did not write about circumcision in some of their books, because they did not use it in their laws, and it is only because we have acquired it through experience, the cause of which is that I have found the majority of artificers and barbers to use circumcision and purification with a scalpel and with torches; and they use a ligature with a thread and an incision with the nail.
E yeu ja he prohadas totas aquestas manieras e no atrobegui milhor mondificacio am forfexs, am liament am fiel que en mondificacio cum la ungla, quar motas vetz efugeys la codena pus desus, quar la codena del prepucii a dos tunicas, e roman la tonica pus dejos, e fort leu es forsat ad autra inscizio e dolor sicura.	And I have already tried all these ways and have not found better purification with scissors, with a ligature with thread than with purification with the nail, because many times the cord escapes from below, because the cord of the foreskin has two tunics, and the tunic remains deeper, and very easily it is forced to another incision and sure pain.
E am mundificacio le qual es fayta per alphecati, e es digital, del qual usan les sabatiers, no es segurada la inscizio de la extremitat del membre viril, quar fort leu intra en le trau de lu.	And in purification which is done by alphecati, and is digital, of which the barbers use, the incision of the extremity of the virile member is not secured, because very easily it enters into the tract of it.
Mays en la operacio am ungla, fort leu obazeys ferr e corromp la tua operacio.	But in the operation with the nail, very easily it obscures iron and corrupts your operation.
E la codena del enfant es breu per natura, e motas veguadas nays en tal manieyra que no ha necessitat de mondificacio, e yeu he vist aquel.	And the cord of the child is short by nature, and many times it is in such a manner that there is no need for purification, and I have seen that.
Mays de la mondificacio que·s fa am forfexs e liamentz am fiel, la bontat, experiment descrobic a mi, quar las forfexs so de proporcional inscizio, per aquo quar la acuitat que es desus es ayssi cum la acuitat que es dejos; e donc cum tu premes la tua ma so proporcionadas dos acuitatz, e inscideysso segon una comperacio en un temps; e es fayta compressio del fiel am figura contenent la codena de la vergua de tota partida, am le qual no catz error de tot.	But of the purification that is done with scissors and ligatures with thread, the goodness, experience has shown to me, because the scissors are of proportional incision, for which the sharpness that is below is as the sharpness that is above; and therefore as you press your hand so proportionally to the two sharps, and incision is made according to a comparison in one time; and it is made compression of the thread with a figure containing the cord of the penis entirely, with which there is no error of all.
E la manieyra de la operacio primeyra es que tu fassas estar le enfant majorment si es de aquels que entendo un petit, que no fassas sino que tu lies le fiel en la sua vergua tant solament, e que leysses aquel entro al autra dia.	And the manner of the first operation is that you make the child stand most if it is of those who understand a little, that you do nothing but tie the thread in its penis alone, and that you leave that in for the other day.
E aprop fay aquel alegrar en tota aquela manieyra que es a tu possibla de aquo que recep la sua intelligencia.	And then do that with all that manner that is to your possibility of what receives its intelligence.
E aprop fa aquel estar entre las tuas mas estatuir preparadament, e no sia ges cezent; e occulta las forfexs en la tua ma o dejos le tieu pe, que l’enfant no veia aquelas ni degun autre dels instruments.	And then make him stand between your legs, prepared, and do not be gescent; and conceal the scissors in your hand or below your leg, that the child does not see them nor any other of the instruments.
E aprop entremet la tua ma a la vergua de lu e suffla en la codena, e tira aquela entro que sia eyssit le cap de la vergua, e aprop mondifica aquel de aquo que es agregat en ela de sordicia.	And then introduce your hand to his penis and puff in the cord, and pull that until it is issued the head of the penis, and then purify that which is added in it of filth.
E aprop lia le loc signat am fiel dobla, e aprop ligua pus bas de aquel un petit le segon liament, e aprop te am le dit pous e endic tieu le loc del liament dejos am bona retencio, e inscideys entre dos liaments.	And then tie the place signed with thread double, and then tie the pus lower of that one little the second ligature, and then put your hand on the place of the ligature below with good retention, and make an incision between two ligatures.
E aprop eleva la codena sus leugierament e estratz le cap de la vergua; e aprop leyssa le sanc corre petit e petit, quar es milhor ; e pausa polvera desus e sobre la polvera pausa drap en le qual es spandut mugol de huou coyt en ayguaros concosit am oli rozat recent bo; e layssa aquel sobre aquel entro al autra dia; e cura aquel am curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then elevate the cord slightly and stretch the head of the penis; and let the blood run little by little, because it is better; and put powder above and on the powder put cloth in which is spread hog's lard in hot water mixed with fresh rose oil; and leave that on it for the other day; and cure that with poultice until it is healed.
La forma de las forfexs a mondificacio, aquesta es la forma:	The shape of the forceps for modification, this is the shape:
Sian las unas extramitatz no-talhantz e las autras sian talhant, que non sia yssit le ram del clau, e sia la longitut de las doas acuitatz ayssi cum la longitut de dos manubres engualment.	Let one be non-cutting and the others cutting, that the ram of the key is not removed, and the length of the two points is as the length of two arms equally.
Mays la error en mundificacio es quar fort leu efugeys la codena intrinseca tota, o partida de lu deves la inscizio.	But the error in modification is that if the strong one flees the intrinsic chain entirely, or part of it, you must make the incision.
Donc cove que tu extendas aquela de la tua hora am la tua ungla denant la apostemacio del loc e que inscidas aquela segon equalitat.	Therefore, as you extend that one with your fingernail in front of the abscess of the place and that you cut it according to equality.
E si no la podes tenir am la tua ungla, lahoras extratz aquela am unci e inscideys aquela.	And if you cannot hold it with your fingernail, then extract that one with a pin and cut it.
Mays si son passatz tres dias, e roman aquo que es imflat dejos la vergua apostemat, lahoras tu leyssa aquo entro que sia cedat le apostema caut, e excorja aquel am fecilitat, e inscidex aquel segon que a tu es preparat.	But if three days have passed, and what is swollen remains, after the abscess, then you let it enter until the abscess is cauterized, and exfoliate it with ease, and cut it according to what you have prepared.
E guarda te del cap de la vergua, quar no nosera a lu aquo.	And guard yourself from the head of the abscess, for it would not be good for it.
E donc cura aquel am aquo que la plagua consolida de las polveras las quals havem recomtadas en le tractat de las polveras.	And therefore cure it with that which the plague consolidates from the powders which we have recommended in the treatise of the powders.
E si es inscidit de la codena sobre mesura, e obezeys a las partidas desus, aquo no notz a lu.	And if it is cut from the chain beyond measure, and obeys the parts above, then it will not be good for it.
E mays cura aquel am aquo que havem dit entro que sia sanat.	But cure it with that which we have said until it is healed.
Capitol .lviii.	Chapter .lviii.
De curacio de urina retenguda en la vesiqua.	Of the cure of urine retained in the bladder.
Retencio de urina en la vesica es fayta per oppulacio fayta per peyra o per sanc congilat, o per poyre o per carnada, e semblantz ad aquels de aquo que havem dit de las manieyras de curacio en la divisio.	Retention of urine in the bladder is made by obstruction caused by a stone or by congealed blood, or by pus or by flesh, and similar to those of water which we have said of the ways of cure in the division.
E si no es dissolvuda la urina, e veses retencio de lu esser per peyra le qual ja es en le col de la vesica, lahoras cove que le malaute sia encorbat sobre les sieus denolhs.	And if the urine is not dissolved, and retention of it is because of a stone which is already in the neck of the bladder, then it is necessary for the patient to be bent over his knees.
E aprop conponeys les pes de aquel sobre le sieu dos e extendas le sieu ventre de la partida pus desus del sieu dos, e le malaute estrengua le sieu ale tant quant es a lu possible.	And then place the feet of that one on his hips and extend his belly from the part above his hips, and the patient strains as much as is possible to him.
Donc lahoras le col de la vesica es costreyt ha espulsio de la peyra a las partidas detras, per que la urina es absolta.	Therefore, then the neck of the bladder is constricted to the expulsion of the stone to the parts behind, so that the urine is released.
E si no es dissolvuda am aquo que havem dit he vehement es fayta la causa sobre le malaute, lahoras cove que aministres extraccio de lu am instrument le qual es apelat siringua, del qual aquesta es la forma: Sia de argent e sia subtil leon conquau, ayssi cum canula de pena de ausel am subtilitat de ray lonc en similitut d’un palm e mig, al qual sia cana subtil en le cap de lu.	And if it is not dissolved with that which we have said and the cause is very strong upon the patient, then it is necessary that you administer extraction from him with an instrument called a syringe, of which this is the shape: It is of silver and it is a subtle cone, as well as a pipe of bird bone with a subtlety of a ray long in similarity of a palm and a half, to which there is a subtle tube in the head of it.
E la manieyra del eyssiment de la urina per aquel es que prenguas le fiel doblat e lies en la extramitat de lu lana o coto per bona liadura; e entrometas las extramitatz del fiel en la partida dejos de la ciringua, e inscideys am las forfexs si superflueys alcuna causa de la lana, mays intromet la en la canula am vehemencia E aprop enongeys la ciringua am boder e am album de huou.	And the manner of the emission of the urine by this one is that you take the faithful doubled and tie it in the middle of the wool or thread for a good binding; and introduce the extremities of the faithful in the part below of the syringe, and cut it with the forceps if there is any superfluity of wool, but introduce it into the tube with force, and then introduce the syringe with border and with album of egg.
E fay cezer le malaute sobre la selha, e embroca la vesiqua de lu e la vergua am olis umitz, e oli de oliva e ayguaros.	And make the patient lie on the bed, and rub his bladder and the abscess with olive oil, and olive oil, and water.
E aprop entromet la ciringua am facilitat entro que pervengua a la razit de la vergua; e aprop dobla la vergua desus a la partida del embelic; e aprop empelleys la ciringua dintz aquela; e aprop empelleys aquela entro que pervengua a la vesica, e aquela centa le malaute esser pervenguda a la causa vuoda, e no es fayt asso segon aquest orde, sino le meat en le qual va a tortuositat.	And then introduce the syringe with ease until it reaches the bottom of the abscess; and then double the abscess above at the part of the navel; and then push the syringe into that; and then push it until it reaches the bladder, and that the patient has arrived at the root of the cause, and it is not done according to this order, but the meat in which it goes to tortuosity.
E aprop exten le fiel am la lana petit a petit, quar la urina siec la lana.	And then extend the faithful with the wool little by little, for the urine will soak the wool.
Aprop extratz aquela e fay per curacio urina, e usa ciringua, no cesses fer aquo e usa ciringua entro que sia evacuada la vesica e le malaute atrobe alleviacio.	Then extract that one and do for the cure of urine, and use syringe, do not cease to do this and use syringe until the bladder is emptied and the patient recovers relief.
Capitol .lix.	Chapter .lix.
De qualitat de clisterizacio de la vezica am clampcedra e am semblantz instrumentz les quals sian acordants ad aquo.	Of the quality of clysterization of the bladder with clampcedra and with similar instruments which are according to this.
Quan accideys en la vesica ulceracio o apostema, o sanc congilat en aquela, o es coartat poyredura, e vols en aquela destillar ayguas e medicinas, lahoras sia fayt am instrument le qual es apelat clampcedra, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When ulcers or abscesses occur in the bladder, or congealed blood in that, or it is constricted by a constriction, and you want to distill waters and medicines into it, then it is done with an instrument called a clampcedra, and this is the shape of it:
sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	But in the middle of it is closed, so it is closed.
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	And in that there are three tubes: two from one part, as well as the other.
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	At the beginning is the concave place, in which is the water that is expelled, and as much as it is expelled, it is added, until when any cause is taken by that of the humidities, it is thrown away, and when it is expelled with water, it is thrown away, and when it is expelled long, according to how the clampcedra is done with which is phicat naphta in the battles of the sea.
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra.	Therefore, as you want to introduce humidities into the bladder, introduce the extremity of the clampcedra into the humidity, and throw with that the water that is expelled to the parts above, so that the humidity is thrown into the concavity of the clampcedra.
E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	And then introduce the extremity of the clampcedra into the abscess as we have recommended in the syringe; and then push the humidity with that which you push, so that that humidity reaches the bladder immediately, and the patient feels that.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	The form of the catheter is subtle, by which the bladder is catheterized, and that is the form:
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	And it is made of silver or lead, of which the tip is like a small feather, and there is a tube inside it.
E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.	And then take the bladder by its root, and place in it the humidity that you want to catheterize in the bladder, and then tie that between two with a strong double ligature, and heat that humidity over the fire.
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	And then introduce the tip of the catheter into the urethra.
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	And then press your hand over the bladder with the humidity and structure descending until the patient feels that the humidity has reached the bladder.
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	But if you do not feel the bladder, then you take a piece of parchment and make a circle from it; and pierce that with all its roundness; and then introduce a strong thread into those holes, so that it is turned; and then attach the circle so that it is attached to the sofat, because you put in that water that you want from the humidities, and oils and waters.
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	And then you tie that onto the instrument and do with it as you have done with the bladder, and express with your hand until the humidity reaches the bladder.
Capitol .lx.	Chapter .lx.
De extraccio de peyra.	Of the extraction of stones.
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already said in the division the species of stones and their cure with medicines, and the difference between stones generated in the kidneys and stones generated in the bladder, and the signs of that.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have said the stone in which the operation is done with the hand, and section.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And the stone generated in the bladder properly is that which is located in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	And I am narrating that with a manifest exposition and abbreviation.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	Therefore, I say that stones generated in the bladder mostly come to children; and the signs of it are that the urine that is excreted from the bladder is similar to water in its subtlety, and appears in it sand; and the patient feels his urethra, and many times it hurts, and then it is dressed; and with this, they feel the anus in many of those.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And it is easier the cure of children of those who have reached fourteen years; and it is difficult cure in the old.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	But in the young it is milder because of what is between those.
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And of that one in which the stone is larger and the cure is easier; And if it is small, it is contrary to that.
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	Therefore, as we come to the cure of that, we must, at the beginning of it, modify the patient with a catheter which extracts all the fistula that is in their bowels; because that fistula sometimes prohibits the passage of the stone, and therefore the investigation of it.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And then place the patient on their feet and have them sit and moan in a way that the stone descends to the neck of the bladder, or what jumps from that place or sometimes.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And then make that cushion between your hands prepared, and the hands of it are placed on the things of him, so that the bladder is entirely made declining to the parts below.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And then pierce that and all of that through.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	Therefore, if you feel the stone in the space, then you immediately cut with a section above it.
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if you do not catch all of it from your touch, then you must have that with oil your said finger of the left hand, if the patient is a child, or the said finger if it is a young complete, and introduce that into their anus.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And pierce the stone until it is below your said finger.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And turn that little by little into the neck of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	And then press on that with your said finger, and expel that to the outside parts before the place where you made the section.
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	And command the minister to press the bladder with his hand; and command another minister that with his right hand extend the genitals to the upper parts, and with his other hand massages the cord which is below the genitals, in the part of the place where the section is made.
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then introduce a spatula, well incident, of which this is the form:
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	And split in it the water that is between the anus and the genitals, not in the middle place, but on the left side of the vagina; and let the section be above that stone and your finger be in the anus, and let the section be transverse, so that the section outside is wide and inside narrow according to the quantity that emerges from the stone be possible, and no more, because it is very difficult to compress your finger which is in the anus the stone and it is thrown out of its faculty.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that of the stone there are some that have an angle and margins, so that the extraction of it is made difficult because of that.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And of that one, water is like a gland, and it is round, and it is made of it light extraction.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	Therefore, if it is that one with its angles and margins, adjust it in the fissure.
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not thus thrown out, then you must engage upon that, or that you strengthen upon that with a decent gesture, the tip of which is like a file with which you strengthen upon the stone, and do not escape from it; or that you introduce below it a subtle instrument of curved tip.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	But if you cannot place it there, then you enlarge the wound a little, and if you see a flow of blood, cauterize it with vitriol.
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	But if the stone is more than one, then at the beginning you push your hand into the mouth of the bladder, and then you cut above it; and then you push a little bit further, and similarly do so if there are more than two.
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	And if the stone is very large, then ignorance is that you cut it with a large incision, because it happens to the patient one of two things: either it dies or it makes a continuous flow of urine, because of which the area is not completely consolidated.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	But administer the expulsion of it while it is outside, or devise in the fracture of it with the forceps while you extract it in pieces.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	Therefore, when you have completed your operation, then fill the wound with ointment of aloe and dragon's blood, and cauterize it.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	And place upon it a cloth soaked in oil and wine, or in rose oil and rubbed water, so that the abscess may be cauterized.
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	And then turn the patient onto their back, and do not untie the bandage until the third day.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	And when you have untied it, wash the area with water and oil, and then cure it with a diaphana and a diazilaco enema until it is healed.
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	But if in the wound there occurs a cauterized, putrid, and corrosive abscess, and of this kind as if the blood is in the bladder frozen, and for this reason urine is forbidden (and this is known by the emission of blood in urine), then with your instrument in the wound and extract that blood, because if it remains it provokes the bladder to corruption of the bladder and its putrefaction.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then wash the wound with vinegar, water, and salt, and in opposition to all kinds, with the water that you deem convenient for its cure until it is healed.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And cover in all the hours of the whole cure that you lie both things and adjust the medicines which are placed upon the area.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the stone is small and is in the middle of the urethra, and it is lodged there, and the emission of urine is prohibited, then cure it with the water that I recommended before you arrive at the incision, because troops of times by this cure it is accused of incision; and I have already explained this, and it is that you take a pointed iron perforator, of which this is the form of it:
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	triangular in its end, sharp, inserted into a shaft.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	And then take a thread, and tie it with that the urethra so that it does not return to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	And then insert the iron into the urethra, perforating with facility until the perforator comes to that stone.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And revolve the perforator with your hand on that stone little by little, and you perforate the hole of it until you make the other part penetrate; because the urine is immediately released.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	And then press your hand over what is broken of the stone from the opening of the urethra, because that is fractured, and is expelled with the urine, and the patient is healed.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	But if this cure is not available to you for any reason which prohibits it, then tie a thread below the stone, and another thread above the stone.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	And then cut above the stone in that urethra between the two ligatures.
E aprop extratz aquela.	And then extract it.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	And then untie the ligature and modify the congealed blood, which is made in the wound.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	And it is not necessary to tie a thread below the stone, but only so that it does not return to the bladder, and the other ligature above, because when the thread is untied, the stone's emission, the bladder returns to its place and covers the wound.
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	And for this reason it is necessary to you when you tie the thread above, that you elevate the bladder to the upper parts, or that you return to your compliment, and cover the wound as we have said.
Capitol .lxi.	Chapter .lxi.
De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	Of the extraction of stones from women.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	Stones in women are rarely generated.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	But if a stone is seen in any of those, then the cure of it is difficult, and it is prohibited by many manners.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of them is that the woman is very likely a virgin.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second is that you do not find a woman well-knowing who describes herself to the physician when she is chaste, or is of women having husbands.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	The third is that you do not have a woman well-knowing this art, mostly the operation with hand.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth is that the place of the incision over the stone in women is distant from the place of the stone, because you indiges of a pre-existing incision, and in that there is fear.
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	But if necessity provokes you to this, then cove that you take a female physician well-knowing, and few are found.
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	But if you are deprived of that, then seek a male physician who is well-skilled and subtle, or present a female matron well-experienced in the affairs of women, or a woman who in this art has a part of the art.
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	Therefore, do that, and command him to do everything that you order him, from the inquiry about the stone to the beginning; the reason for this is that he should see if the woman is a virgin, then when he puts his finger in her anus and wants the stone.
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	Therefore, if he finds that, force him to put his finger in, and then command him to insert over it.
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	But if she is not a virgin, then command the matron to insert her finger into the vagina of the patient and inquire about the stone, because she places her left hand on the bladder, and comprehends it with good understanding.
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa.	Therefore, if he finds it, then he must gradually withdraw it from the orifice of the bladder to the parts below with the utmost care, until it reaches the root of the vagina.
E aprop inscida sobre aquela apposicio de la maytat del conh deves la razit de la coyssa de qualque part sia a lu parada e cent la peyra en aquela partida, e·l dit de lu no sia remaugut de la peyra coartan dejos lu.	And then insert it over that position of the majority of the vagina, at the root of the vagina, from whichever part it is stopped and center the stone in that part, and the said one of him should not be removed from the stone, short of him.
E la seccio sia pauca al comensament; e aprop entrometa lo ray sobre aquela seccio, e si sent la peyra, lahoras ajuste en seccio segon la quantitat la qual sap que la peyra sira getada de aquela.	And the section should be little at the beginning; and then insert the ray over that section, and if he feels the stone, then adjust in section according to the quantity which he knows that the stone is thrown from that.
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And know that the kinds of stones are many: for some are small and large, and lion and sharp, and long and round, and having ramps.
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	Therefore, you know how many kinds are of it for what you signify about what you want.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, ajusta en le loc vetriol trissat e te aquela per una hora entro que sia abscindit le sanc, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	And if you see a flow of blood, adjust in the place vitriol trissat and take that for an hour until the blood is stopped, and then return to your operation until the stone is thrown out.
E fay que prepares am tu dels instrumentz les quals e ditz en la extraccio de peyra en les homes, per so que sias ajudat per aquels en la tua operacio.	And do that you prepare with you of the instruments the ones which are said in the extraction of stone in men, so that you may be helped by those in your operation.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, e sabes que la expulcio del sanc es de la arceria que es insciza, lahoras tu pausa polvera sobre le loc e estrenh aquel am pulvils e strictura descent, e no iteras aquo; e layssa la peyra e no extraguas aquela, quar fort leu morira la malauta.	And if you see a flow of blood, and know that the expulsion of the blood is from the artery that is incised, then you place powder over the place and tighten that with powders and constriction descends, and do not iterate that; and leave the stone and do not extract it, for very likely the patient will die.
E aprop cura la plagua.	And then cure the wound.
Donc cum es cedada la acuitat del sanc aprop alcus jorns, e·l loc se poyreys, lahoras tu retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	Therefore, when the sharpness of the blood is ceded after a few days, and the place can be touched, then you return to your operation until the stone is thrown out.
Capitol lxii.	Chapter LXII.
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	Of incision on hernia.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	Hernia is nothing but an aggregation of moisture in the white tunic which is below the codpiece of the genitals containing the urine, and it is named tunic.
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And some times it is in the proper panniculus which has it prepared nature in the part of the urine, before that it is known that already there is another urine; and it is the codpiece of the genitals between the white tunic which we have said, and it is not that but tart.
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	And the generation of this hernia is for weakness which happens to the genitals, for that to those is poured this matter, and some times it happens by percussion made upon the genitals.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	And this moisture is having many colors, for the color of it or is declining to citrine or to sanguine, or red, or it is black and slimy, or it is aqueous white, and this is what is most.
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	And the signs by which it is known where this aggregation of water is: for if it is in the white tunic which we have said, then the abscess is round declining a little to length as such as the figure of the urine, and appears the genitals, for the moisture contains that of all parts.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	And if the moisture is in the proper panniculus, then the abscess is round in the part of the urine and by this man estimates that it is another urine.
E si la humiditat es entre la codena dels genetius e·l ciphac blanc, lahoras catz dejos le centiment.	And if the moisture is between the codpiece of the genitals and the white tunic, then cats below the feeling.
E cum tu vols la cognicio de la color de la humiditat, lahoras tu esproa la color de la humiditat en le apostema am entromes cayrat del qual la forma es precedida; e segon aquo que es eyssit en le vestigi del entromes, jutga de aquo que es dedintz lu.	And as you want the knowledge of the color of the moisture, then you probe the color of the moisture in the abscess with an introme that the form is preceded by; and according to what is seen in the vestige of the introme, judge of what is there of it.
Donc quan nos vinem a la curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que comandem al malaute que sia fleubotomat si aquo es a tu possibla, e vezes le cos de lu ple.	Therefore, when we come to the cure of it with iron, then we must command the patient to be fleubotomized if that is to you possible, and times the body of him full.
E aprop sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos sobre alcuna causa un pauc auta, e pausa dejos lu motz draps.	And then be recumbent on his back upon some cause a little high, and place below him many cloths.
E aprop setz tu sobre la part sinistra de lu, e comanda al ministra que segua a la dextra de lu, le qual extenda la sua vergua a hun de dos latz a la codena dels genetius e a la partida del mirac del ventre.	And then sit you on the left part of him, and command the minister that follow on the right of him, the one which extends his arm to one of two sides to the codpiece of the genitals and to the part of the miracle of the belly.
E aprop pren spatum lat e scindeys la codena dels genetius del mieg loc per la longitut entro prop le pentenilh.	And then take a spatula late and scindeys the codpiece of the genitals of the middle place by the length until near the penis.
E sia fayta la seccio segon rectetut engualment distant de la linha que deveseys la pel dels genetius, entro que pervengua al ciphac blanc comprehendent.	And be made the section according to rectum equally distant from the line that devesys the skin of the genitals, until it reaches the white tunic comprehending.
E excorja aquel, e observa, e guarda te per aysso que tu no inscidas aquel; e la tua excoriacio am la qual aquel excorjas per partida jassia que sia suspenduda am le huou mays e subtilment escruta am la excoriacio segon la quantitat a tu possibla.	And excoriate that, and observe, and guard yourself so that you do not insert that; and your excoriation with the one which you excoriate by a wide part that it be suspended with the urine most and subtly scrutinize with the excoriation according to the quantity as much as possible.
E aprop perfora le ciphac ple de aygua am perforacio ampla, e extratz tota l’aygua.	And then pierce the bladder full of water with a wide perforation, and extract all the water.
E aprop separa entre doas labias de la seccio am uncis, e exten le ciphac a las partidas desus; e no toques la codena les genetius comprehendent, e inscideys le ciphac en aquela manieyra que es a tu possible.	And then separate between the two lips of the section with hooks, and extend the bladder to the upper parts; and do not touch the cord of the genitals contained, and incise the bladder in that manner that is to you possible.
E inscideys aquel am la sua totalitat o en pessas, e majorment le sieu latz subtil, quar si tu no perscrutas exquisidament la inscizio de lu, no es fayta segurtat que la aygua no retorne.	And incise that [bladder] with its totality or in parts, and mainly its subtle side, because if you do not meticulously scrutinize the incision of it, it is not done with certainty that the water does not return.
Mays si le huou procezeys de aquela defora de la sua codena en la ora de la tua operacio, lahoras quan tu auras complida la seccio del ciphac, retorna dedintz aquel, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la codena dels genetius am sutura, e aprop cura aquel ayssi cum las autras plagua, entro que sia sanat.	But if the humor proceeds from that outside of its cord during the time of your operation, then when you will have completed the section of the bladder, return it inside, and then adjust the two lips of the cord of the genitals with suture, and then care for it as well as the other plagues, until it is healed.
E si atrobas le huou corromput per autra malautia, lahoras cove que tu lies les vayssels les quals so sore le suspensori, e extrat le huou, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit.	And if you find the humor corrupted by another malady, then you must cut the vessels which are on the suspensory, and extract the humor, and then care for it with the water that we have said.
Mays si l’aygua es agreguada en doas partidas esemps, lahoras sapias que doas son las ernias; donc inscideys aquela partida segon que has feyt en l’autra engualment; e si es a tu vist que sia una opera, lahoras tu la fay.	But if the water is aggregated in two parts at the same time, then you know that there are two hernias; therefore, incise that part according to what you have done in the other, equally; and if it seems to you that it is an operation, then you do it.
E aprop tu abstergiys le sanc, e entramet en las seccios lana submersa en oli o en oli rozat; e pausa deforo autra lana la qual tu as submersa en vi e oli, e expandeys aquela sobre dos genetius e·l mirac del ventre; e pausa desobre draps doblatz e pulvils, e lia aquels desobre am liament le qual es segon aquesta forma:	And then you cleanse the blood, and insert into the sections wool submerged in oil or in rose oil; and place outside another wool which you have submerged in wine and oil, and expand that over the genitals and the miraculous part of the belly; and place above cloths folded and powders, and tie those above with a bandage which is according to this form:
e aprop sian preses dos draps e sian humplitz de lana carmenada segon aquesta semblansa; e sian faytas las extremitatz am les quals es premut de coto o de lana humida, e sian agreguatz am strectura en le braguier de las braguas, e la una de las extremitatz prengua del cul entro al dos, e la segonda prengua a la partida del pantenilh, e dos extramitatz sobre dos coyssas dejos e dos extramitatz autras sobre dos angonars, e tota extrictura sia ajustada en le braguier de las braguas.	And then they are taken two cloths and they are filled with carded wool according to this resemblance; and they are made the extremities with which it is pressed of cloth or of wet wool, and they are added with structure in the waistband of the breeches, and one of the extremities presses from the buttock inside to the other, and the second presses at the part of the knee, and two extremities above two cushions of wool and two other extremities upon two pads, and all the structure is adjusted in the waistband of the breeches.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta hernia es medicada artificialment am cauteri en loc de seccio am ferr; e es que tu prenguas cauteri cutellar subtil e que inscidas am aquel la codena dels ginitius, e es ignit segon que havem recomtat entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc contenent la aygua, e lahoras tu pren cauteri segon aquesta forma:	And some times this hernia is medicated artificially with cautery in place of section with iron; and it is that you take a subtle cautery knife and that you incise with that the cord of the genitals, and it is ignited according to what we have recounted until it is discovered the white bladder containing the water, and then you take cautery according to this form:
e es asemblat a letra greca.	And it is assembled like a Greek letter.
E aprop perfora am aquel ciphac, e es ignit entro que tota la humiditat sia fora-gitada.	And then pierce with that cautery, and it is ignited until all the humidity is expelled.
E aprop exten le ciphac am uncis, e excorja am uncis, e excorja am cauteri subtil ignit; e inscideys aquel segon que es a tu possible entro que eradiques tot lu; e guarda te del huou que·l foc no·l toque.	And then extend the bladder with hooks, and scrape with hooks, and scrape with a subtle cautery ignited; and incise that according to what is to you possible until you eradicate all of it; and guard yourself that the humor that the fire does not touch it.
E sapias que aquesta operacio es pus salva e pus longinqua de flux de sanc, e milhor que operacio am seccio.	And know that this operation is more safe and more distant from a flow of blood, and better than an operation with section.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat apostema caut en la hora de seccio o en hora de cauteri, o flux de sanc, lahoras cove que tu cures qual contrarietat fa a tu per aquo, am curacio la qual conveneys a lu segon que es dit.	But if to you there arises a contrary state abscess caut in the hour of section or in the hour of cautery, or a flow of blood, then you must cure what contrary state does to you by that, with a cure which you convene to it according to what is said.
Mays si le malaute es pauruc, e no spera la segonda operacio per la sua horribilitat, lahoras administra perforacio segon que yeu recomti aquo; e es quan es certificat deves tu, per aquo que havem dit de las significacios, que aquela hernia es ayguosa.	But if the patient is fearful, and does not expect the second operation for its horror, then administer a perforation according to what we have recounted here; and it is when it is certified that you, by what we have said of the significations, that that hernia is watery.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute sobre alcuna cezelha elevada, aprop perfora le apostema en la partida pus bassa de lu am spatum lat, e pausa la perforacio segon la longitut del cos.	Then you must make the patient lie on some elevated cot, then pierce the abscess in the lowest part of it with a broad spatula, and place the perforation according to the length of the body.
E sia la apercio ampla entro que corro tota l‘aygua.	And let the opening be wide until all the water flows out.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc coto e lia aquel e layssa aquel, per so que corro le romanent de l’aygua.	And then place over the location cloth and tie that and leave it, so that the remaining water flows out.
E aprop cura aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	And then care for it until the plague is healed.
Mays si contrarietat es a la egrecio de l’aygua en aquela hora tu perforas aquela: e aquo no es fayt sino per aquo quar le pannicol blanc en le orrifici de la plagua fa contrarietat e prohibeys le eyssiment de l’aygua, lahoras cove que tu metas en la plagua pena o instrument am la qual es extrayta l’aygua dels ydropitz, la forma del qual es precedida; o ajusta en la opprecio de la plagua un petit.	But if a contrary state is in the emission of the water at that hour you pierce that: and this is not done except for that which the white panniculus in the orifice of the plague causes contrary state and prohibits the emission of the water, then you must put in the plague a needle or instrument with which the water is extracted from the hydropites, the form of which is preceded; or adjust in the opening of the plague a small one.
E sapias que l’aygua retorna, e es agueguada aprop vi meses o enaviro aquels; e cum es agreguada, lahoras sia perforat segon aquela meteyssa manieyra, quar le malaute ayssi passara les sieus dias.	And know that the water returns, and is aggregated again after about six months or around those; and as it is aggregated, then it is perforated according to that same manner, so that the patient thus passes his days.
Capitol .lxiii.	Chapter .lxiii.
De seccio sobre hernia carnosa e la curacio de lu.	Of section over a fleshy hernia and its cure.
Sapias que en la seccio sobre aquesta hernia es temor perdusent a pernicia en las majors disposicios; per que a mi es vista la dimissio de lu e esser salvat per aquela milhor.	Know that in the section over this hernia there is fear of losing to pernicious in the major dispositions; for to me it is seen the dismissal of it and being saved by that better.
E yeu so rememorant la operacio en aquela e las specias dels apostemas.	And I you remembering the operation in that and the species of the abscesses.
Donc, dic que l‘apostemas natz en les cos dels quals les genetius so conponutz e es fayt aquo per motas causas: o per superfluitat aguda agra, la qual es efundida als genetius, o per percuscio.	Therefore, I say that the abscesses arise in the bodies of those whose genitals are composed and it is done for many causes: or by acute superfluity, which is poured into the genitals, or by percussion.
E es la color de la apostema segon la color del cos, e no es atrobat en lu dolor, e es apostema greu.	And the color of the abscess is according to the color of the body, and there is no pain in it, and it is a serious abscess.
E fort leu es apostema lapificada, del qual la color es fosca, e no es centiment a lu.	And the abscess is hard, of which the color is dark, and there is no feeling in it.
E alcunas veguadas es fayt per nodacio de las arcerias, e per imflacio de aquelas ayssi quo ja es perceubut la rememoracio de lu, o per imflacio de venas.	And sometimes it is made by a knotting of the arteries, and by inflammation of those in such a way that already the memory of it is perceived, or by inflammation of the veins.
Mays aquo que es per imflacio de arcerias es conogut per la dispercio de la apostema quan compremas aquela am les tieus ditz; e no cove que aquel toques.	But that which is due to the inflammation of the arteries is known by the dispersal of the abscess when you compress it with your fingers; and no cover that you touch.
Mays aquel que es fayt per imflacio de vena no es dispergut de lu alcuna causa deves la compressio am les ditz.	But that which is made by inflammation of the vein is not dispersed from it by any cause of the compression with the fingers.
E ja es possible que sobre aquesta specia sia fayta seccio e sobre les autres carns; e es que tu inscida la codena dels genetius, e aprop esten le huou a las partidas desus, e extratz aquel del ciphac blanc, e deliura le suspensori dels vaysels, e ligua les, e inscideys le suspensori pus que tu deliuras aquel de tota partida de las partidas del huou.	And it is possible that on this kind a section is made and on the other flesh; and that you insert the point of the scalpel, and then extend the fluid to the lower parts, and extract that from the white part, and deliver the suspenders of the vessels, and tie them, and incise the suspender more than you deliver it from all parts of the fluid.
Donc si l’huou ja es am aquelas carnadas consolida, lahoras cove que tu extraguas le huou e inscidas aquel.	Therefore, if the fluid is already with those carnations consolidated, then you must extract the fluid and incise it.
E si es adherencia entro alcuna causa del ciphac, o entre aquo que es entre les bayssels, lahoras cove que tu deliures tota aquela adherencia e inscidas aquela per inscizio redonda.	And if there is adherence for any cause of the white part, or between that which is between the vessels, then you must deliver all that adherence and incise it with a round incision.
Mays si es nativitat de carn en le loc de la adherencia la qual es detras, lahoras cove que tu inscidas tot aquo que es de lu, e extraguas le huou ayssi cum havem dit.	But if it is the birth of flesh in the place of the adherence which is behind, then you must incise all that which is of it, and extract the fluid as we have said.
Donc cum es complida la tua operacio, lahoras omple la plagua de lana imfuza en oli rozat e vi; e aprop cura aquela am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Therefore, as the operation is completed, then fill the wound with wool infused in rose oil and wine; and then care for it with the other cure until it is healed.
Capitol .lxiv.	Chapter .lxiv.
De la curacio de hernia que es de vitz.	Of the cure of hernia that is of the belly.
Vit es apostema envolut per alcuna envolucio semblant a broto am mollificacio dels testiculs, e es fayt dificil movement exercitiu e deambulacio sobre le malaute.	A hernia is an abscess wrapped in some wrapping similar to a sprout with softening of the testicles, and it is made difficult movement exercise and walking over the patient.
E en la curacio de aquesta malautia es per temor per aquo del qual es precedida rememoracio.	And in the cure of this disease it is by fear for that of which is preceded memory.
Empero cove que diguam opperacio en aquela segon que fero les primiers.	However, it is necessary to say operation in that according to which I did the first.
E dic que cove que fassas sezer le malaute sobre una cezelha elevada; e aprop enpelleys le suspensori dels testiculs a las partidas dejos; e aprop te la codena dels genetius am les tieus ditz am les baysels que so probdas a la vergua; e tengua aquels autre ministre que tu, e extenda aquels am extencio vehement.	And I say that it is necessary to make the patient lie on a raised cushion; and then you peel the suspenders of the testicles to the lower parts; and then take the point of the scalpel with your fingers with the vessels that are probed to the groin; and hold those other minister that you, and extend those with vehement extension.
E aprop inscideys am spatum lat agut per seccio traversa en le dreyt dels vaysels entro que sian les vayssels descubertz.	And then incise with a broad sharp knife with a transverse section in the right of the vessels until the vessels are uncovered.
E aprop excorja de tota partida ayssi quo a tu havem dit en extraccio de arceria las quals so en las templas.	And then excoriate from all parts as we have said in the extraction of the arteries which are in the temples.
E aprop fica en aquelas un’agulha en la qual sia fiel doble, e lia aquel en le primier del locs en les quals accideys vit, e lia aquel autra veguada en le derier de lor.	And then place in those a needle in which is double thread, and tie that in the first of the places in which you have incised the hernia, and tie that other time in the back of them.
E aprop inscideys aquels en le mieg loc per seccio dreyta segon la longuesa del cos, e extratz aquo que es agreguat de las humiditatz fetulentas e corruptas.	And then incise those in the middle place with a right section according to the length of the body, and extract that which is aggregated of the putrid and corrupt humors.
E aprop cura la plagua am curacio de las autras plaguas en las quals vols sania esser engendrada per so que caian les vaysels les quals noyreysso un de dos genetius, quar no es mal per aquo.	And then cure the wound with the cure of the other wounds in which you wish to be healed so that the vessels which are severed one of the two genitals, because it is not harm for that.
Mays si accideys vit a totz les bayssels, lahoras cove que·ls testicols sian extragutz o que les testicols per aquo se cequo am les vayssels, per que sia privat de tot nutriment per la inscizio dels vayssels, e que sian estaborits, o que cequo per so que no sia juvament am aquels.	But if you have incised all the vessels, then it is necessary that the testicles be extracted or that the testicles by that be tied with the vessels, so that it be deprived of all nourishment by the incision of the vessels, and that they be established, or tied so that it not be helpful with those.
Capitol .lxv.	Chapter .lxv.
De la cura de hernia entestinal.	Of the cure of intestinal hernia.
Le adveniment de aquesta hernia es per seccio que endeve en le ciphac extendut sobre le ventre de part dels angunars del mirac del ventre, per que deysendo les budels de aquela ruptura ad alcu dels budels.	The advent of this hernia is by a section that should be in the white part extended over the belly of the part of the angles of the navel of the belly, because by sending the intestines of that rupture to one of the intestines.
E aquesta ruptura es o del ciphac o de excencio de lu, e accideysso aquestas doas specias per motas causas: o percussio, o per sautz, o per clamor, o per elevacio de alcuna causa greu, o per semblantz.	And this rupture is either of the white part or of excencio of it, and these two species are caused by many causes: either percussion, or seizures, or clamor, or elevation of any heavy cause, or semblance.
E·l senhal de aquo, quan es per extencio del ciphac, es que accideys pauc a pauc en lonc temps, e no accideys soptament, e es apostema engual entro ves le preon per so quar le ciphac comprem le budel.	And the sign of this, when it is by extension of the white part, is that it happens little by little in a long time, and does not happen suddenly, and it is an abscess equal between the veins of the preon because the white part compresses the intestine.
E le senhal de lu es quan es per seccio del ciphac, quar al comensament fa accidir dolor vehement sobtament; e es apostema divers aparent dejos la codena propdana aparent, e aquo es per eyssiment del budel, e·l cos de lu a las partidas deforo del ciphac.	And the sign of this is when it is by section of the white part, because at the beginning it makes happen a vehement pain suddenly; and it is an abscess different appearing below the proper cord appearing, and that is by the extrusion of the intestine, and the body of it to the parts before the white part.
E alcunas veguadas es fora-getat am le budel la tela, e es apelada aquesta hernia entestinal zirbal.	And sometimes it is forgotten with the intestine the net, and this intestinal hernia is called zirbal.
E alcunas veguadas es fayta am ventositat, e alcunas veguadas corr en le budel fenda, e aqui es retenguda, e es am aquo gran pernitia3 del malaute, e alcunas veguadas fa endevenir dolor malvada e majorment quan es premut.	And sometimes it is made with flatulence, and sometimes it runs in the intestine wound, and here it is retained, and it is with this great harm of the patient, and sometimes it makes become a bad pain and more when it is pressed.
E en la curacio de las especias de aquesta malautia am ferr es temor, per que cove que sia esquivat le cazament en aquela.	And in the cure of the kinds of this disease with iron there is fear, because it is necessary that it be avoided the hunting in that.
E la manieyra de la operacio de aquela es que comandes al malaute que redugua le budel am la sua ma a las partidas dedintz de la sua conquavitat si obezeys al sieu retornament, e aprop sia envessat sobre le sieu col entre las tuas mas, e eleva las cambas de lu.	And the manner of the operation of this is that you command the patient to reduce the intestine with his hand to the parts within his cavity, if he obeys his return, and then place it over his belly between your hands, and elevate his legs.
E aprop sten la codena la qual siec la codena dels testicols a las partidas desus, e inscideys la codena dels testicols tota per le lonc; e aprop fiqua en doas labias de la seccio uncis segon que indigeysses a hubrir la seccio am aquels.	And then tighten the cord which is the cord of the testicles to the parts above, and incise the cord of the testicles all along; and then fix the two lips of the section with pins according to how you indicated to open the section with those.
E si’ la seccio segon la quantitat que a tu sia possible que de aquela le huou sia foro-getat.	And if the section according to the quantity that is possible for you that from that the pus be discharged.
E aprop excorja aquela ciphaqueth les quals so dejos la codena dels testicols, entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc dur de quascuna partida.	And then scrape that which is covered by the cord of the testicles, until the white hard capsule of each part is uncovered.
Lahoras tu entromet le tieu dit en aquo que siec le testicol, en aquo que es entre ciphac blanc, le qual es dejos la codena del huou, e entre le ciphac segon, e absolve am aquel’adherencia que es en la partida detras del huou.	Then you introduce your finger into that which is the testicle, into that which is between the white capsule, which is left the cord of the testicle, and between the second capsule, and dissolve with that adhesion that is in the part behind the testicle.
E aprop mau am la ma la codena dels testicols a las partidas deforo, e am aysso exten le ciphac blanc en sus am la ma sinestra, e eleva le huou am le ciphac a la partida de la seccio; e comanda al ministre que extenda le huou ensus e tu dissolveys la adherencia que es detras am solucio complida.	And then put with your hand the cord of the testicles to the parts before, and with this extend the white capsule upwards with your left hand, and elevate the testicle with the capsule to the part of the section; and command the minister to extend the testicle upwards and you dissolve the adhesion that is behind with a complete solution.
E cerqua am les tieus ditz que lay no sia alcuna causa del budel envelopat en le ciphac blanc dur.	And seek with your fingers that there be no cause of the intestine enveloped in the white hard capsule.
Mays si tu atrobas de lu alcuna causa, lahoras tu enpelleys aquel al ventre dejos.	But if you find of it any cause, then you place it into the belly below.
E aprop tu pren una agulha en la qual sia fiel gros fayt de x fiels, e entromet aquel deves le derier del ciphac, le qual es jos la codena dels testicols, la qual siec seccio; e aprop inscideys las extremitatz las quals emineysso del fiel entro que sian quatre fiels, e aprop compausa alcus de lor sobre alcuna figura en manieyra de crotz; e lia am aquel le ciphac del qual havem dit que es dejos la codena dels testicols am fort liament de dos partz.	And then you take a needle in which is a thick thread made of x threads, and introduce that into the derriere of the capsule, which is below the cord of the testicles, which is the section; and then incise the extremities which emerge from the thread until they are four threads, and then compose some of them upon some figure in a manner of cross; and tie with that the capsule of which we have said that is below the cord of the testicles with a strong ligature of two parts.
E aprop envolveys las extremitatz dels fiels e lia aquelas am liament vehement entro que alcu dels vayssels que noyrrisso aquels no puscan trametre alcuna causa per so que de aqui no accida apostema caut.	And then wrap the extremities of the threads and tie those with a vehement ligature so that some of the vessels that nourish those not can transmit any cause so that from here no abscess occur.
E pausa autra veguada liament segon foro le primier liament, lonh de lu mens tres ditz; e aprop aquestz dos liaments layssa del ciphac le qual es dejos la codena dels testicols la quantitat de la grandeza del dit, e inscideys tot le romanent segon redondeza, e osta de lu le huou.	And pause another ligature according to the forum the first ligature, long from it less three fingers; and then these two ligatures leave from the capsule which is below the cord of the testicles the quantity of the greatness of the finger, and incise all the remaining according to roundness, and take out of it the testicle.
E aprop inscideys en la partida dejos de la codena dels testicols per seccio de la qual corra sanc e sania ayssi cum havem recomtat en aquo que havem dit.	And then incise in the part below of the cord of the testicles by section of which blood runs and heals as we have recommended in that which we have said.
E aprop aministra lana submersa en oli, e pausa en la plagua; e aministra le liament le qual havem recomtat (e alcunas veguadas le ciphac blanc es cauterizat, le qual havem dit aprop la inscizio de lu temen de flux de sanc, quar motas veguadas accideys aquels) e leyssa le liament entro que per si caia.	And then administer wool immersed in oil, and place it on the wound; and administer the ligature which we have recommended (and some times the white capsule is cauterized, which we have said near the incision of it fear of blood flow, because many times those occur) and leave the ligature until it falls by itself.
Mays si le cazement de lu es tardat, lahoras de aygua cauda sia embrocat, e pausa sobre aquel entro que caia segon que havem dit.	But if the case of it is delayed, then of hot water be embroiled, and place it on that until it falls as we have said.
E aprop cura la plagua am l’autra curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanat.	And then cure the wound with the other cure of wounds until it is healed.
Capitol .lxvi.	Chapter .lxvi.
De hernia ventosa.	Of a suction hernia.
En aquesta hernia no e vist alcu que sia estat ardit sus la curacio de lu am ferr.	In this hernia, no one has been seen to have been bold in the cure of it with iron.
E les primiers diyssero que es fayta ayssi cum havem recomtat en la hernia que es am vi; la qual es que tu lies les vayssels aprop la seccio sobre aquela am fecilitat de lu; e aprop secca en le mieg loc en enviro le apostema am aquo que obro aquel, entro que caian les vayssels.	And the first said that it is made as we have recommended in the hernia that is with vi; which is that you tie the vessels near the section on that with facility of it; and then dry in the middle place around the abscess with that which opened it, until the vessels fall.

Capitol .lxvii.	Chapter .lxvii.
De la disropcio que es fayta en les anguonars.	Of the disruption that is made in the  anguonars.
Alcunas veguadas endeve ruptura en les angonars ayssi cum havem dit, e emineys le loc.	Sometimes there is a rupture in the anguonars as we have said, and it emerges the place.
E no deyssen als genetius alcuna causa dels budels al genetius; e si deyssen, aquo es pauc; e retorna s’en en totas horas.	And do not leave to the genitals any cause of the intestines in the genitals; and if they leave, that is little; and returns it in all hours.
Mays si es prolonguat le temps am aquo, es ajustada fissura en le ciphac entro que deysenda le budel en le ciphac; e accideys aquo per la extencio del ciphac le qual es en le angonars ayssi cum havem dit, la qual causa es quar le ciphac es estendut, e aprop es mollificat e·l loc es apostemat e emineys.	But if the time is prolonged with that, it is adjusted fissure in the capsule so that the intestine descends into the capsule; and it occurs that by the extension of the capsule which is in the anguonars as we have said, which cause is that the capsule is extended, and then it is softened and the place is suppurated and emerges.
E la cura de lu es am cauteri ayssi quo es precedida la narracio de lu.	And the cure of it is with cauterization as it is preceded the narration of it.
E alcunas veguadas es curada am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: e es que·l malaute jagua sobre le sieu dos entre las tuas mas, e aprop secca le loc de la ruptura dels apostemas emineys am seccio per la latitut segon la quantitat de tres ditz.	And sometimes it is cured with iron in this manner: and that the patient lays upon his two between your hands, and then dries the place of the rupture of the abscesses emerged with section by the latitude according to the quantity of three fingers.
E aprop strenh le ciphac blanc que es jos la codena entro que sia descubert.	And then tighten the white capsule which is below the cord until it is uncovered.
E aprop pren le ray e pausa aquel sobre le loc eminent del ciphac, e prem aquel al preon del ventre.	And then take the ray and place that upon the place eminent of the capsule, and press that to the preon of the belly.
E aprop cus le dos locs eminentz sobre la extremitat del ray del ciphac, e ajusta am la sutura un de aquels am l’autre.	And then sew the two eminent places upon the extremity of the ray of the capsule, and adjust with the suture one of those with the other.
E aprop extratz la extremitat del ray, e no inscidas del ciphac de tot, ni no extenda le huou, ni autra causa ayssi cum yeu te fi saber en la curacio de hernia entestinal.	And then extract the extremity of the ray, and do not cut into the entire head, nor extend the bowel, nor any other cause as I have told you to know in the cure of intestinal hernia.
E aprop cura aquela am la curacio de las plaguas, e cum inscideyses les fiels, mundifica aquela e restaura la plagua entro que sia consolidada; quar le ciphac es contrayt e no es ajustada la eminencia de ruptura.	And then cure that with the cure of the sores, and as you cut the fibers, cleanse that and restore the sore while it is consolidated; because the head is contracted and the prominence of the rupture is not adjusted.
E cauteri es milhor en aquest loc, quar es pus propda a salut.	And cauterization is better in this place, because it is more proper to health.
Capitol .lxviii.	Chapter .lxviii.
De mollificacio de la codena dels testiculs.	Of softening the cord of the testicles.
Motas veguadas la codena dels testiculs en alcus homes es mollificada per aysso quar las carns que so entre aquela son mollificadas, e es fedat le reguardament de lu.	Sometimes the cord of the testicles in some men is softened because the flesh that is between it is softened, and it is felt in the regard of it.
Adonc necessari es ad aquel que es preguat en la curacio de lu que fassa jazer le malaute segon le sieu dos, e enscida tota la codena la qual es mollificada sobre la codena natural; e aprop que ajuste doas labias am la sutura.	Therefore, it is necessary for him who is asked in the cure of it to make the patient lie according to his two, and cut all the cord which is softened over the natural cord; and then adjust the two lips with the suture.
E si vols, cus en le comensament la superfluitat de la codena mollificada am tres cozeduras o quatre e am ferma sutura.	And if you want, sew at the beginning the superfluity of the softened cord with three stitches or four and with firm suture.
