And if the corruption is in the breast of the hand or foot, it is very difficult; however, since you inquire about the corruption in what manner it appears to you, and that you open it, and cleanse it according to each disposition which is possible to you, and in this way the corruption is rectified to you, when it does not do you contrariety vein or nerve.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And know which are the saws and the instruments to cut these bones are very according to the situation of the bones, and the preparation of those, and the thickness of those, and the subtlety and the greatness and the smallness of those, and the hardness and their rarity; for that when you prepare for every kind of operation, the instrument convenient to that operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And know that that operation signifies to you about the kind of instrument of which you indigeysses; when with you is great study and long and knowledge of the manners of this art, and testimony of manners of diseases, for that when you have already by yourself that which is convenient to them of the instruments to every disease.
E yeu so a tu formant en la fi de aquest capitol le nombre dels instrumentz les quals pausaras cum eyssimples am les quals proceziras a la tua prohibicio la qual experimentaras sobre las autras.	And you so a you forming at the end of this chapter the number of instruments the ones which you will place as simple with which you will proceed to your prohibition which you will experiment on the others.
Forma de serra:	Shape of saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Shape of another saw:
Forma de autra serra:	Shape of another saw:
Forma de autra serra gran:	Shape of another large saw:
Forma de ray:	Shape of a chisel:
Sia le cap de aquest ray segon la forma de cap de clau stellat, e les puntz de lu sian segon la forma dels puntz alstefegi.	Let the head of this chisel be according to the shape of the head of a star-shaped key, and the points of it be according to the shape of the points of an awl.
E no conveneys sino que am aquel sian confricadatz les caps de las juncturas quan so corrumpudas, o es la boca gran ampla.	And it is not convenient otherwise than with that [the chisel] they be confricadatz the heads of the joints when they are corrupted, or is the mouth wide and large.
Forma de razori major dels autres:	Shape of a razor larger than the others:
Forma de razori menor:	Shape of a smaller razor:
Forma de razori lat:	Shape of a broad razor:

Shape of another saw decently made:  Let it be made with an arch of it as high as possible and the sharpness of it of iron, and the member of it of boy-knife decently made.

Forma de inscisori autra minor:	Shape of another smaller incisor:
Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Shape of another incisor; this one resembling a chisel, and the extremity of it is like a saw, and it is exhibited in many places in the ratio of the bones:
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	Shape of a chisel which is convenient for the ratio of that which is perforated of the bones:
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	And the extremity of it is triangular and of sharp extremity.
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of Indian iron, and similarly as all the causes that we have said of razors and incisors and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of incision extremities and of the serration of the bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities may be cut either by intrinsic cause or by extrinsic cause, or as you will have medicated that corruption by cure of those medicines and the cure does not confer, or sometimes the corruption going from the member which you do not strike by any cause, then when you cut that member into that which the hon acossec the corruption, so that the patient escapes through that of death or malice which is a greater defect of the member.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of that one to whom it happens, is that the member is made black before it is cured that the fire has already burned it, or it may be brought near the blackness before the pus that one puts into that member that it seizes it and that it nourishes the whole body; and therefore, be careful to cut into that.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly if it is a cause of corruption by percussion of some venomous causes as well as from a scorpion of the sea or from a viper or from a rutabaga and similar.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or the percussion is in the extremity of the finger, then you cut the finger and do not give space to the corruption so that it may enter into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	And similarly if it happens to the hand, then you cut it from the root of the wrist, and do not give space to the corruption so that it may nourish in the wrist of the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if instead of that, then you cut the arm into the armpit at the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if another passes the corruption and sometimes it goes around the armpit, then in that is the death of the patient; and to administer another cause another to that in cure is a quantity of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly do of the foot when corruption goes around the toe of the foot, then you cut it into one of the knuckles.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it takes hold in the arch of the foot, then you cut the whole foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it may go into the thigh, then you cut the leg into the junction of the thigh.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already reached the thigh, then in it there is no way but dismissal, and leave the patient to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the manner of cutting or sawing the member is that you tighten the ligament in the part farthest from which you want to cut, and tighten another ligament above the place; and extend the minister a ligament to the parts below, and extend the minister another ligament above; and you separate the flesh which is between two ligaments, and make a flat space until all the flesh is uncovered; and then cut or saw.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And cover that which is placed on all parts so that it does not touch the place, and that it comes to the patient's lesion adjusted and cauterized abscess.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	But if blood flows when working, then cauterize the place carefully, or place some powders on it that restrain the blood; and then return to your medication while it is being completed.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then bind the affected limb with a suitable bandage, and care for it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I recount to you what happens to a man in his foot, this same accident which I have recounted to you, which is when blackness occurs in his foot with a burning that was assembled like the burning of fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption occurs first in his toe before it extends to the whole foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepares himself by putting pus that helps the cure to go into the limb with the violence of it that numbs from pain and burning, and the incision in that foot goes into the joint, and fire heals.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	For a long time that same corruption occurs in the toe of the hand I indicated.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then it comes to me, and so I am pierced to repercuss that superfluity with what I place on my hand of medicines, then the purification of the body of him; and the superfluity does not repercuss and begins to go into the other toe before it begins in the hand.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he begs me to cut his hand, and I do not want to do that, hoping for the repercussion of that superfluity, and more than that, I fear the incision of his hand would be death, for the virtue of the sickness was over taking.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And because he despaired of me, he returned to his land and I came to know that the man prepared and cut his hand entirely, and he healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not added this narration except so that it may be helpful on what catches of this sickness, and that its meaning by which it is signified and according to which it is acted.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	Of the cure of the intestines and the quality of clysterization with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in some fleshy members and the space of the abscess is prolonged until it makes a collection of pus, and then it is broken and perforated, and pus is ejected from it, and the place remains hollow as if it were a vessel, and the skin that is above it is as fine cloth, and it has not reached the back corruption, and it has not imprinted on the bone or on the nerves or on the ligament, it is called a sinus, and it is not called a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	But however, if the space is prolonged until the corruption presses into some member, then it is called a fistula and not a sinus.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the cure of it is that the skin is incised entirely as it is turned, and most importantly when it is fine and made like cloth, and so that it does not adhere to the place because of its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you hope that the skin will adhere and that that corruption has not achieved a further consequence, and in the skin there has passed through from the front, then you cure that with clysters.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And it is that you consider the sinus, and then if it is large, and the brac that you see is of a fetid odor, then you clysterize that with an Egyptian medicine which is of oil and strong wine and cumin receiving equal parts, and they are put into a vessel, and they are boiled over the fire until the medicine becomes thick and reaches the consistency of honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then you take from it what is necessary and dissolve it with water and honey; and clysterize with that the sinus, and strengthen the orifice of it, and leave the medicine in it for the quantity of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then you extract that with a spoon; and do this for as many days until the sinus is purified and the stench is removed.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	And sometimes it is clysterized with ash water, when this medicine is not present to you; and it is that you take the ash of beech, and put water on it; and then you strain that and clysterize with it until you confess that the sinus is then healed.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	And if the patient has no tolerance on the Egyptian medicine nor the ash water, then clysterize that with water and honey and a little crushed cumin, and clysterize that with wine and honey mixed, because of the property of honey is that it purifies and washes, and the wine makes the sinus adhere, and especially when in the wine there is an excess of astringency and dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And as you do this sometimes and you confess that the sinus is already healed, then clysterize that with water that makes flesh grow in it.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And it is that you take of enguent dyaphinicon and dissolve it with rose oil and astringent wine; or that you clysterize with it some medicines and other enguents that have the properties which I have already written in the treatise of enguents.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	And if the orifice of the sinus is narrow in which the clyster nozzle is not received, then you enlarge it with a small iron little by little, and put in it gauze wrapped in Egyptian enguent or basilicon enguent until it is enlarged.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And similarly if the orifice is wide, then you add the lips of it with suture and leave it in the quantity in which between the clyster there is addition.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the patient's orifice from which the arm comes out is elevated to the upper parts, then dry that in the lowest place that is in it so that the arm runs inside, because when the arm is compressed in the prepondency of the sinew the flesh is engendered in it.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dry the sinew inside the environment of the bone as low as you want, then pierce it so that you prepare the limb with the preparation by which the arm runs lightly according to what is fitted to you and that no cause of the arm is retained in it.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidating medicines that are placed on the sinew convenient to what you want, extend those over cloth of linen.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth be of such a quantity as makes the communication of the whole sinew; and then cut with the shears in the right of the orifice of the sinew a tract wider a little than the orifice of the sinew; and then extend over another cloth of linen from the ends according to the quantity of the tract, and place it over it in a distant position from the orifice of the sinew so that it be removed the easement of the arm of it and do not see the large cloth sino after a few days once.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	But that which is over the orifice of the sinew, which you remove every hour so that what is adjusted in it of the arm may escape.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you know if what runs from the arm is much or little, or is digested, or is not digested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And thus you consider the place of that sinew, if in it the patient feels pain or not, and if there is an abscess in it.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And as your medication is prolonged in this manner, and you see the matter that is thrown over the orifice of the sinew already adheres, or approximates adherence, then the most you untie it on the third day, and when you untie the bandage, then change the cloth for another and renew the rinsing.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if from the sinew a little space goes virus subtle, then do not despair of the adherence of it, because the healing of it approximates, because so in some men in which a slow generation of flesh in the wounds, and of those so in which is done the contrary of it.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if from the sinew after many days is issued arm indigested, then know that the sinew does not adhere; and if the adherence of the sinew is delayed and is the cause prolonged, then you adjust in exsiccation of the medicines, and if the medicines are humid in their substance and in their virtue, they are dried as in rinsing day-finicon, when in it is adjusted superfluity of addition of zegi.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the most latter is the one which is cured, is that you take of rinsing day-finicon and be dissolved in rose oil, and be on it poured vi antic in its substance, and then mix that with it, and use of that.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And already seems in that action, when there is no arm, rinsing day-finicon, honey when it is cooked until it is thickened, and use of it; or that you take myrrh and aloen and incense, and grind all and pulverize over the honey when it is on the fire, and then line it with water over cloth and stretch that over the sinew; and line it with the honey the one which you have cooked until it is thickened, and pulverize over cloth and stretch that.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And sometimes are administered with it aristolochia long and roots of lily celestial (and it is lily celestial) and flour of errs and centaurea, and use of those simples or adjust, grind those and sieve and pulverize over the honey the one which I have recommended; and use of it.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the sinew is prolonged, and is not healed by this cure, then know that the corruption is in the preon of it, and already make inquiry in the bones or in the other hard members or to the ligaments; then you cure it with fistular cure, as above is said.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	Of the cure of panari and nails rubbed and incision of the finger added and section.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Panari is an abscess that arises from under the nail of the finger of the hand or of the foot, and often arises in the other fingers, and as it is prolonged and its cure is less valued, or is an abscess of abscess caut, or is corrupted, and throws out arm until it corrodes the root of the nail, and often corrupts that whole, and often pervades its corruption to the bone until it is a fetid odor, and is made the extremity of the finger lad, and the color of it is made dusky.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And therefore when you will have that with the water that we have said in the division and do not mix your cure, then cover that you cut with iron all the superfluity that is remaining from the nail and then cauterize the wound with water, because cauterization much is helpful in that.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	But if the bone is sound and the nail is healthy, and the additions of the nail void already comprehend the flesh to the parts of the finger, and they begin to sting it and leave it that, then cover that you place a fine ray under the angle of the nail that stings the flesh, and impel it up and cut it with facility, and place over that which remains of the flesh of the medicines comburent corrosive until it be all removed; and then cure it with rinsing until it be healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	But if the corruption already presses in the bone, then cover that you cut the bone that and extract it, for no time is healed that there is in it the corrupted bone.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you see the corrosion and corruption going into the wound, then you cut it in one of the nuts according to how it is pressed its memory, and then care for it while it is healing.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	If the nail is injured by a blow or friction, and there is pain in that area, then when you first begin to treat the patient, and then dry the nail with a sharp spatula, making a transverse cut from top to bottom, and be careful that the cut does not reach into the flesh that is left under the nail, because you will cause the patient to have very strong pain, and it will cause the birth of excess flesh in the area; and then care for the area with water that soothes the pain.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	But this adjusted flesh, which is born in the hands of some men, is very strong in the flesh, and very strong in the bones, or very strong in the nail.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them are born at the root of the joint, or the birth of them in some nuts of the fingers.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	But that one that is born in some of the fingers of the hand does not harm, and this one that is born in the joints is very harmful.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And of those that are born fleshy, the section is lighter, and that is that you cut it, following its root with a broad spatula.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	But that one that is born at the root of the joint, the cure is difficult; and therefore guard yourself from the abscess of it.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But that one that is born in the finger, when you first begin to cut the flesh of it with a round incision into the bone, and then saw it with one of those saws convenient for water, and then care for it while it is healing.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	But consolidation, which happens to the fingers between their movements or by birth of the man who is born in this way, or by the consolidation of plague or by burning of fire, or by similar things, then you must cut that consolidation while the fingers return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	And place between their cloths of the bandages in oil rubbed so that they are not consolidated lightly, and separate between those, or place between those a lamina of thin lead while it is consolidated as it should.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And similarly if consolidation happens in some fingers with the palm, then you cut that consolidation according to how it is prepared and convenient to the figure of the limb.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Of incisions of vices, they are varicose.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Vices are varicose, and they are veins wrapped thick and full of melancholic superfluities which come in motion in the limbs of the body, and the major advent of them in the legs, and most in the legs of the itinerants and the laborers and the carriers.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Therefore, you must administer purging of the body of black bile some times with strong expulsion, and then bleed the patient from the basilica vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	But the cure of them with iron is according to two manners: one is that it is incised and that black blood is thrown out, and the other manner is that the vein is elevated and all of it is extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The incision of it is according to this manner: at the beginning, embroil the leg with lukewarm water until the thick blood is resolved, which is feculent of the leg, and then strengthen the leg of the patient to the most sovereign part of the thigh, and to the part below the knee with a bandage, and then cut the vein in one place, or two, or three with a wide incision, and then elevate the black blood with your hand from the part below the leg up, and down, until the quantity of blood that you want and that seems to suffice is extracted, and which will take the virtue of the ailment.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then tie that, and command him that he abstain from foods that engender black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	And iterate the cure by phlebotomy when the veins are full and that night to the patient.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	But the elevation of them is according to this manner: you who raise the leg of the patient, if in it there are movements, and then put it in a bath and embroil the leg of it with lukewarm water until it becomes red and the veins are exuberant; or that it be exercised by strong exercise, if the bath is not present to you, until the limb be scalded.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	And then cut the vein in the right of it by incision in the long or in the back of it of the knee, or in the lowest of it of the ankle.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	And then open the vein with pincers and scrape the vein from all parts until it appears to the touch, and is the appearance of it that sometimes that rogue declining to blackness.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And therefore, when you evacuate and from the vein, you sometimes see that white which is cord.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And then you put below that the ray until it is elevated and thrown from the vein, and suspend that with a lion's horn or an onion.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	And then cut another incision near that one for three fingers, and then scrape the vein from the part below the vein until it appears.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	And then elevate that and cut that in the back incision of the ankle, and then extract that and elevate it until it is extracted by the second incision, and then extract that from the incision that is above that.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	And do this until you extract that from the incision that is most sovereign or most high of all the incisions, until all is extracted; and then cut that.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	And if it does not obey you to extract and elevate, then introduce a double strong needle with thread and tie that, or introduce behind it the ray and turn your hand to every part until it is ejected.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And guard yourself that it not be incised; for if it is broken, it is made difficult for you to elevate that part and it has come upon the patient by that harm.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when that whole thing is thrown out, then place on the area of the plague wool soaked in wine and oil rubbed and oil unrubbed, and cure that until it is healed.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the gut is contracted having tortuosity in which it is wrapped in the parts, and it is not according to rectitude according to that we have said, then cover that which you do on that whole tortuosity of it and the places of its wrapping, and then suspend that with hooks until you elevate that whole.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And guard yourself that your section does not cut the vein and that you do not plague that, for difficult it is for you to elevate that; and serve your prudence in that.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	Form of the incision with which the gut is cut:
Forma de unci orp:	Form of a hook orp:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not to it accuitated thus as the hooks nor is it of sharp extremity for that it does not plague the vein; and it is of gross flexibility lion, for if it were subtle, it would cut the vein by its subtlety; having is in it superfluous thickness as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	Of extraction of the vein of the leg.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs in hot lands as in the Ategi in the land of Arabs and in the lands of India hot and arid of little humidity and in which there are no herbs nor aybre.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And it is strongly generated in other places of the body other than the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	And the gestation of it is of putrefaction that comes from the bone as if venom descended from the serpent's body and worms and scarabs and worms engendering between the bone and the flesh.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	And sign of the acceptance of the coming of it is of this vein that accidies in the leg inflammation vehement; and then the place is vesicated; and then the vein issir from the place of that vesication which seems razit of plant.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	And therefore, when the extremity appears, then cover that with a piece of lead weighing one ounce, between two ounces, and tie it, letting the lead hang from the leg.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	And as many times as you see of it any cause to the parts outside, cover that in lead and bind that.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	And if the part is prolonged, then you incise a part of it and envelop the remnant; and do not incise that of razit until it is outside, for if you incise that it is contracted and enters into the flesh and makes happen abscess and poyredura in the place and bad ulceration.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	Because it must be treated gradually and be extracted little by little, until it is thrown out from the end of it and no remnant of it remains in the body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And of this vein is issued in some men that is in its length of v palms and ten and already has reached me that it is issued one of xx palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	And if it is incised at the hour of its medication, then introduce the ray into the track of it and perforate that with long track with the body, until it is evacuated all that is in the matter, and administer putrefaction of the place for some days with medicines; and then cure that for the cure of abscesses.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein sometimes has many ramps, and mostly when it appears at the junction of the foot or in the foot, and come to it many orifices, and it is issued from some orifice ram.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	And therefore cure that as we have said in the division and with what is said below.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Of section above worms generated under the skin and it is called the bovine ailment.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	This ailment is named in some lands because it often happens to oxen and is a worm few one which is born between the bone and the flesh, and goes in all the body up and down, and is shown in the feeling of its advancement from member to member until it disrupts the bone and is seen outside.
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	And the generation of it is by putrefaction of some humors as if it were worms and serpents and earthworms and ascarids in the belly.
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	And it is feared for the malice of it, for when it goes in the body and is elevated to the head, and has reached the brain, then very much it grieves in it and enters and destroys the brain, and this often happens.
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	And therefore when you want to cure that and extract it, then it is not done if not by its ambulation and appearance of it to the feeling, and then you must strengthen what is above it and what is below it with ligature and strong constriction, and then dry over it and extract that.
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	And if it is planted in the flesh and not the other, then you place cauterization with fire over the place until it dies, and the major cause that is feared is corruption of it with which it corrupts the place as we have said.
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	And if you see that being reached to the head near the brain, then strengthen over the forehead with a strong constriction, and then dry over it, and extract that; and make the patient use of modification of his body with medicines evacuating putrid bad humors, and guard himself from foods generating putrefaction.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	Of the section above the ailment.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This illness is called nafir in our land, and it is pain that comes in certain limbs, and then it is changed from limb to limb.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And I have already seen that as I will tell you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to a sick woman in a village, and I uncovered her arm and saw a small inflammation in the vein of the arm, and because it was removed for an hour, I saw that inflammation go as if a worm was climbing, but more lightly than being carried, as if it were living silver when it runs from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	And then it went to the pain of that place and settled in the muscle, and then it stayed there for an hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	And then it moved to the other side of the body until it reached the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And then I recommended to myself that I should turn it over all over her body as I had seen; and it was too marvelous of the mutation of it and the velocity of limb to limb.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	And I had already seen this before in my own veins in that manner, however, I have seen many who felt pain being changed from limb to limb.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	But I did not see this in the veins as in the woman.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I did not think it to be otherwise than that because the woman was old, on so of dry body and of uncovered veins, and in this appearance felt that windiness mutated.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	And it is necessary that it does not appear according to this retro-cure in those who are delicate and with humid bodies of well-closed veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And as you want the cure of it, and the patient feels that pain, then it is not to you apparent in the vein as we have said, then you strengthen over that and leave it lightly and secse over that until that windiness is contracted, and cauterize the place.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you do not see it in your veins, then you cure it with the shaking of the body and with that which you expel windiness, and charm them with pills foul and with pills of serapi and similar.
De extraccio de sagetas.	Of the extraction of arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Arrows are diversified according to the species, and according to the places of the body in which they are shot, for their diversity is that of those that have large points, and small, and concave, and blunt, so they are solid; and of those that have three angles, and of those that have tongues; and of those that have shafts.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And that which is according to the limbs and feet in which they are shot is according to two manners: for the limbs or are principal limbs concave, as the brain, the heart, the liver, and the lung, and the intestines, and the bladder, and their likenesses; and therefore when it hits in one of these limbs and appears to you signs of death, the cause which I will tell you later, then you must avoid the extraction of that arrow in those where death seizes that in the most dispositions, and when to you it does not appear these evils signs, and the arrow is not hidden in the depth of the limb, then you extract that and cure the plague.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	And of the signs of the neck is when it hits in it an arrow, and passes through the bone, and it is issued from the cyph, which is above the brain, for it is violently shaken, and scotomia, and vertigo, and rumble in the legs, and inflammation and rumble of the tongue, and spasm and mixing of understanding and vomiting of bile, and very much is cut off the word and destroyed the voice, and it is issued from the place of the plague white humidity resembling powder, and eyes of it resembling the fluidity of the flesh.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And therefore if these signs appear to you, then you abstain from the cure and the extraction of the arrow, if it is not outside.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	But the signs of the arrow when it hits the heart, are that it is near the left nipple, and feels with that which it is stuck in a hard cause, and it is not a void cause; and very much the movement of the arrow is similar to the movement of the hand, and running of the plague black blood, and it seizes that coldness of the extremities, and a sore cold, and syncope; and therefore know that death descends upon it all at once.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when the arrow has wounded the lung, so are the spitting of phlegm of blood from the plague, and the vessels that are near the neck are inflamed, and the color of the patient is changed, and he exhales great spirit, and demands the extraction of cold air.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	And if it hits the arrow in the ligament which is in the foot, and the pain then is near the small of the back, and it is made the leg great with vehement pain and with sigh, and it is not bad all the limbs of the muscles.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if it hits the arrow in the stomach, then very much the eyes of the plague are seen with some indigested food.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	And if it hits the arrow in the belly, and it is stuck in it, eyes some wound of the plague, or the web, or the intestine which is disrupted, and there is no hope in the cure of it extraction of the arrow.
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	And if the arrow hits the bladder, and it is issued from it urine, and it processes from it some cause to the parts outside, and very much is pain upon the patient, then you know that it is mortal.
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	May the other members, as well as the face, neck, throat, shoulders, and assistants, and the vertebrae of the back, and the clavicle, and the thigh, and the leg, and their likeness of the limbs, be saved according to the major dispositions when the arrow does not strike a vein or artery and is not a poisonous arrow.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I will recount to you what I have seen of the being of these arrows, so that you may signify by this about your cure.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The cause is, that in a man shot an arrow in the lacrimal of his eye in the root of his nose, and I extracted that from the other side, leaving the gray of the auricle of his ear, and it is healed, and it did not cause harm in the eye of his.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	And I extracted another arrow from a Jew who was shot in him in the gray of his eye, leaving the eyelid, and the arrow was already hidden and it was not obtained from that except a small extremity with which it adhered to its shaft, and it was a large arrow of the sharp arrows of the Turks, with a lion's iron in which there were no auriculas.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	And the Jew healed, and it did not cause harm in his eye.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	And I extracted another arrow from a Christian man who was shot in the throat, and it was an Arabic arrow, and it is the one that has auriculas; and therefore I incised upon that between two guides, and it was already submerged in the throat of him; and therefore I subtiliated with that, and then I extracted that, and the Christian healed.
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	And I extracted another arrow from a man who was shot in his belly, and I thought that he would die from that; and therefore, since forty days had passed and there was no change in him from his dispositions, I incised upon the arrow and engineered upon that, and he healed, and it did not cause harm to him.
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And I saw another man in whom an arrow was shot in his back, and the plague was consolidated upon him, and since it had been about seven years, I extracted the arrow from the root of the thigh.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	And I saw a woman to whom an arrow was shot in her belly, and the plague was consolidated from within her, and it was not changed in her dispositions in any way, and the woman did not suffer harm in any of her natural operations.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	And I saw another man to whom an arrow was shot in his face and the plague was consolidated, and it broke the arrow, not finding much pain here, and many appearances like this.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	And I extracted the arrow from the man of the prince of the king who was shot in the middle of his nose, and it had already declined to the right side a little, and the whole arrow was hidden.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	And I was called to the cure of him shortly after the shooting of the arrow, within three days.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	And therefore I felt the plague of the arrow very strictly; and then I inquired about that with a subtle attempt, and I did not feel that; but I felt it prick below the right auricle, and therefore I suspected that prick was because of the extremity of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And I plastered the place with a plaster in which is attractive and digestive virtue, confessing to myself that the place should be apostumed so that it appears to me the place of the arrow, so that it may succeed upon that.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And it did not cause harm in the place, signifying that the arrow had reached that place; and I continued with the plaster on him for many days and it did not cause harm; and the plague was consolidated meanwhile, and it broke the patient of the extraction of him for a space of many days until one day he felt the arrow inside his nose and recounted this to me.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	And therefore I placed upon the plague medicine acute corrosive for many days until it was open, and with the probe I felt that, and I felt the extremity of the arrow subtly, which adhered to the shaft.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	And then I adjusted it in the appearance of the plague by that acute medicine until it appeared to me visibly the extremity of the arrow, and I passed time with that for the space of time within four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And then, since the plague was amplified, and it was possible for me to intervene with forceps in it, and to remove that, and not to be obstructed by it, then I did not cease to subtly and ingeniously work upon that with manners of ingenuity, until one day I began upon that with manners of ingenious hanging, according to how it will come in the end of the chapter, until I extracted that; and then I restored that plague.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	And some physicians judged that the cartilage of the nose was not restored, and I restored that and the plague was consolidated, and the patient healed for whole health, and it did not harm him in any way.
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	And I recount to you the quality of the extraction of some arrows so that you may pause this rule and signification upon that which I have not said, because the parts of this art and the definitions of that are not comprehended with narration nor do those comprehend the book.
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	And the wise artificers compare with few about much; and with that which is present about that which is absent; and finds novel operation and novel instrument by the descent of the extraneous causes of the art when it occurs.
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And therefore I say that arrows are not thrown out of the members in which they are lodged but according to two manners: either by traction of the place in which it enters; or by the contrary of the other part.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And that which is thrown by the place where it has entered, or is an arrow coming from the fleshy place, and is thrown and thrown out.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	And if you do not obey the commandment of the hour in which you catch it, then you must leave it for some days until the flesh around it can heal, and the traction of it and its exit are relieved.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	And similarly if it is stuck in bones and you do not obey the commandment, then leave that for some days and repeat that with traction and movement every day, and it is thrown out.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if you do not obey the commandment aprop some days, then you must pierce in the circuit of the arrow in that bone of all parts with a subtle drill until the place of the arrow is amplified, and then extract that.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrow is stuck in the bone of the head and has already proceeded into one of the ventricles of the brain, and appears in the patient some of those accidents which I have said, then abstain from the extraction of the arrow and leave it inside until its being is equal to aprop some days; for if the arrow reaches the brain, then death is not prolonged to him.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	And if the arrow is not stuck but in the body of the bone alone and does not pass into the brain, and the patient remains for some days, and no accidents happen to him, then you engineer in the traction of the arrow and in the traction of it.
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	But if it is moved and you do not obey the extraction, then you administer drills in the circuit of the arrow as we have recommended, and then care for the place until it is healed.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	But if the arrow is already embedded in the place of the body, and is hidden from the feeling, then you inquire that with a probe, and if you feel that, then throw that with some instruments which are convenient for the traction of it.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot upon it because of the constriction of the plague and the length of the preon, and here is no bone nor nerves nor vein, then you fen upon the plague until it is amplified and that it is possible to extract the arrow.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if so to the ears which are held, then you deliura the flesh in which it is stuck of all parts with all the ingenuity that you can do; and engineer upon that, if you cannot upon the evasion of the flesh in the fracture of the ears and in torsion of those until you obey.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	And when you administer the extraction of the arrow in any place where it is, then you use with torsion of your hand with forceps at all parts until it makes that obey; and subtilia with subtle subtlety that the arrow is not broken and that it is made to you difficult traction of it and of that extraction.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	And if you cannot upon that of your hour, then you leave for some days until the parts that are in the circuit of it can heal, and then repeat that for when it is relieved.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	But if to you makes contrariety flux of blood, then you administer that which we have said of cure in its chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	And guard your virtue of incision of vein or of nerve, or of cord, and administer ingenuity in all manner a way to you possible of the evasion of the arrow; and do that with facility and tranquility and tardiness and firmness as I and to you have recommended.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	And therefore that you make contrary the arrow so that the patient is according to the figure according to which you must the placement of the arrow in it, for it is more helpful.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	But if that is not to you possible, then you administer that which is to you possible per the figures.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	But the arrows that are thrown out by the contrary of the other part, or that already from it proceeds any part to the parts of outside, or makes difficulty the extraction of the arrow by feeling of the part above the codena proper and times that eminent; therefore you dissect upon that; and be the dissection according to the quantity in which they take the forceps; and then throw that, for it is made lighter to commandment.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	But if it is retained in the bone, then you tortz the lame according to contrariety until the arrow compresses in the bone, and amplify to itself, and then extract that.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	And if not, leave that for some days, and then repeat that until it is possible.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the shaft of the arrow is in that, then you impel that with it.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	But if the shaft is fallen and you want to administer impulse, then you introduce and that, if it is blunt, a concave instrument so that between the concavity of it in the tail of the arrow and then impel that with it.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	But if the arrow is concave, then you impel that with a strong instrument entering into that, for the arrow is relieved by that.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is intoxicated, then you must concave all the flesh in which is the very, if it is to you possible that, and then cure that with what is convenient.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	And if the arrow catches in the feet, or in the belly, or in the bladder, or in the rib, and is proximate so that you touch that with the probe, and it is to you possible to dissect upon that, then dissect upon that and guard yourself from incision of vein or of nerve, and extract that, and then close the wound if it is indigents, and cure that until it is healed.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Form of forceps with which the arrows are pulled.
Sian las extremitatz de lor cum a bec de ausel que son faytas cum serra quan prendon sobre la sageta per so que no la layssen.	Let the extremities of them be like a bird's beak that are made like a saw when they grip the arrow so that they do not let it go.
E de aquelas son faytas motas specias, grans, paucas e migieras, segon la quantitat de la grandeza de la sageta e de la sieua pauqueza, e de la amplitud de la plagua, e de la constriccio de lu.	And of these many kinds are made, large, few and medium, according to the quantity of the greatness of the arrow and its smallness, and the width of the wound, and its constriction.
Forma de impellent concau de aquesta extremitat conquava ayssi cum pena de ausel per so que sia alleujat le intrament de la sageta en lu, e impulcio de aquela sorda:	Shape of an inward concave impulse of this extremity as if a bird's beak so that the entry of the arrow into it is eased, and impulse of that deaf:
Forma de impellent de sorda extremitat:	Shape of a deaf extremity impulse:
ayssi cum ray per so que sia alleujat le intrament de lu en la sageta concava e es impellida am aquel.	As if a ray so that the entry of it into the concave arrow is eased and is impelled with that.
De fleubotomia de las venas.	Of phlebotomy of the veins.
