Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so .xxx., de las quals so en le cap .xvi., so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua.	The veins of phlebotomy of which it is customary to phlebotomize .xxx., of which are in the head .xvi., There are two pulsatile veins which are near the ears, called alhasisain; two herbs that are in the two temples appear; and two veins that are in two lacrimals of two heels that are called aspicientz; and the prepared vein in the middle place of the forehead, and the vein that is at the extremity of the nose; and two guidegi that are in the neck; and two veins that are in the upper lip; and two veins that are in the lower lip; and — these are the veins that are called algelic —; and there are two veins that are below the tongue.
Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so .v.; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.	But the veins that are phlebotomized in the arms are .v.; Because of those one is cephalic, and it is the wild latz; and the people call it "the vein of the head," and deaf, and it is a medium vein, and it is composed of a branch of the basilica, and another branch of the cephalic; and that one the people call "vein of the whole body," and basilica is the vein which is placed in the domestic latz, and it is called "citillar," and they call that one the vulgarians "vein of the belly"; and funis of the arm, and it is placed on the focil, and it is that one in which it is phlebotomized, and it is that one that appears on the poutz by manifest appearance; and salvatella, and it is the vein that is between the said auricular and the smallest said, and there are two ramps in it.
E en le pe e la camba so tres venas; la una de aquelas es que es dejos la curvatura del denolh del latz silvestre; e la segonda es sophena, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz domestic; e la vena sciatica, e·l loc de lu es dejos la camba del latz silvestre; e en la camba son autras venas semblantz ad aquelas.	And in the foot and the leg there are three veins; one of those is that which is below the curvature of the denolh of the wild latz; and the second is sophena, and the place of it is below the leg of the domestic latz; and the sciatic vein, and the place of it is below the leg of the wild latz; and in the leg there are other veins similar to those.
Le juvament de las venas que so aprop las aurelhas es a cataris antics e emigranea e sahafati e ulceracios del cap malas antiquas.	The use of the veins that are near the ears is for ancient catarrhs and emigranea and sahafati and old bad ulcers of the head.
E la qualitat de sagnar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: es que sia ras le cap del malaute, e sia freguat le cap del malaute en le occipiti en le loc de amdoas las venas am drap ample am bona fricacio; aprop strenha le malaute le sieu col am una benda entro que apparan las doas e les locs de lor so aprop las aurelhas en dos locs depremegutz del cap; e quereys aquela am le tieu dit, e si tu sentes le pols de aquelas am le dit tieu, aqui senha am tenta.	And the quality of bleeding those is according to what I recommend to you: that it be scraped the head of the patient, and be rubbed the head of the patient in the occiput in the place of both the veins with a wide cloth with good friction; then tighten the patient their neck with a bandage until the two appear and the places of them near the ears in two depressed places of the head; and touch that with your finger, and if you feel the pulse of those with your finger, here is the attempt.
Aprop tu pren la lancea cutellar, e es aquela que es inscident, e aprop tu intromet aquel dejos la vena en la codena entro que·l fleubotomi vengua al os.	Then you take the sharp lance, and that is the one that is incident, and then you introduce that below the vein in the codena until the phlebotomy comes to the bone.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am la vena e la codena a las partidas desus e inscideys la vena am inscizio inscident.	And then you elevate your hand with the vein and the codena to the upper parts and incise the vein with an incident incision.
E sia la longitut de la inscizio la quantitat de dos ditz ajustatz o entorn de aquo; e fay yssir del sanc atant quant voles.	And let the length of the incision be the quantity of two fingers adjusted or around that; and make it as much blood as you want.
E aprop strenh am pulvils e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then tighten with poultices and leave it until it is healed.
E ja e precedit en le comensament del libre la inscizio de aquelas e de lor la cauterizacio.	And already it has been preceded at the beginning of the book the incision of those and their cauterization.
Mays de las doas venas arterias que so als templars le juvament de la fleubotomia es a emigranea antiqua e sode malvada e obtalmia assidua e cors de superfluitatz acutas effusas als huels.	But of the two arterial veins that are in the temples the use of phlebotomy is for ancient emigranea and sode evil and assiduous ophthalmia and courses of acute effusions of superfluity to the heels.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es segon que yeu recomti a tu: constrengua le malaute le sieu col mot entro que apparan las doas venas al sentiment per appericio manifesta e sia demonstrat le pols de lor dejos le tieu dit; e lahoras tu senha am tenta.	And the quality of phlebotomizing those is according to what I recommend to you: constrict the patient's neck tightly until the two veins appear to the feeling by manifest appearance and the pulse of them below your finger is demonstrated; and then you shall attempt.
E aprop tu eleva la codena desobre la vena a las partidas desus am le tieu dit indic, e intromet le fleubotomi inscident dejos, e eleva la vena en sus; e inscidey aquela ayssi cum has fayt en las doas venas autras; e fay correr del sanc segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	And then you elevate the codena above the vein to the upper parts with your indicated finger, and introduce the incident phlebotomy below, and elevate the vein upwards; and incise it as you have done in the other two veins; and make the blood run according to the quantity of your need.
E aprop deslia la coartacio del malaute, e pausa le tieu dit sobre la vena per una hora, e aprop pausa sobre aquela coto e pulvils e strenh aquela desus am fort constriccio, e layssa aquela entro que sia sanada.	And then untie the constriction of the patient, and place your finger on the vein for an hour, and then place on that coat and poultices and tighten that upwards with strong constriction, and leave it until it is healed.
E ja es precedida la rememoracio de lor, e de aquelas la inscizio, e la atraccio en le comensament del libre.	And already is preceded the recollection of them, and of those the incision, and the traction at the beginning of the book.
E donc le juvament de fleubotomia de la vena del front es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a las malautias antiquas de la cara e a emigranea e rogor e ulceracios fetidas.	And therefore the use of phlebotomy of the vein of the forehead is as close as the phlebotomy of the cephalic to the old ailments of the face and to emigranea and rigor and fetid ulcers.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es segon que yeu recomti a tu; so es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col am una benda entro que apparesca la vena; e aprop pren le insturment le qual es nompnat fossori del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And the quality of the phlebotomy of him is according to what I recommend to you; so that the patient tightens his neck with a bandage until the vein appears; and then take the instrument which is called a lancet, the shape of which is:
Pausa la puncta eminent la qual es al cap del fossori sobre aquela vena e percuteys sobre lu am penche o am autre causa en la manieyra de lu, e layssa lo sanc correr segon la quantitat la qual voles; e aprop deslia la perforacio del malaute e strenh aquela entro que sia sanada.	Pause the point which is at the head of the lancet over that vein and strike upon it with a pen or with another cause in the manner of it, and let the blood run according to the quantity which you want; and then untie the puncture of the patient and tighten that one until it is healed.
E alcunas veguadas es uberta am fleubotomi lat, empero no cove que·l fleubotomi sia de acuta extremitat ayssi cum les autres fleubotomis, abantz sia de lada extremitat, e fleubotoma aquela segon le tranvers, quar le os es propda e fort leu trencaria en lu le fleubotomi quan es subtil.	And some times it is opened with a lancet, but however the lancet should not be of acute extremity as the other lancets, rather it should be of blunt extremity, and phlebotomize that one according to the transverse, because the bone is proper and strong that it would break it in it the lancet when it is subtle.
Mays le juvament de las duas venas que so als lacrimals de dos huels per scabia del huels per rogor e sebol en les huels, e a las malautias de la cara.	But the usefulness of the two veins that are at the lacrimals of the two wrists for scabies of the wrists and for rheum and sebum in the wrists, and for diseases of the face.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia es que·l malaute strenha le col sieu am una benda, e aprop fleubotoma aquelas, e tu sias stant sobre le cap de lu.	And the quality of the phlebotomy is that the patient tightens his neck with a bandage, and then phlebotomize those ones, and you if you are standing over the head of him.
E sia fayta la fleubotomia segon le transvers a longitut un pauc am fleubotomi pauc, quar en le loc no es carn; e si le fleubotomi es subtil, fort leu la extremitat de lu es trencada.	And be made the phlebotomy according to the transverse in longitude a little with phlebotomy little, because in the place there is no flesh; and if the lancet is subtle, very likely the extremity of it is broken.
E aprop fay correr del sanc atant quant es a tu necessari, e pausa sobre aquelas coto, e strenh aquelas per una nueyt, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then make run of the blood as much as is to you necessary, and pause over those ones, and tighten those ones for a night, and then untie those ones.
Mays le fleubotomi de la vena del nas es conferent a febre acuta e a soda vehement, e a las malautias de la cara e emigranea e rogor que accideys en la cara, e majorment quan es antiqua.	But the phlebotomy of the vein of the nose is conferent to acute fever and to soda vehement, and to the diseases of the face and migraine and rheum that happens in the face, and mostly when it is ancient.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute strenha le sieu col e aprop te le sieu nas am la tua ma sinistra, e pren le fleubotomi subtil lonc e fica aquela en le mieg loc del cap del nas segon rectitut, quar la vena no appar al sentiment aqui, e quar le sanc comensa a fluir tantost.	And the quality of the phlebotomy of him is that the patient tightens his neck and then take his nose with your left hand, and take the lancet subtle long and place that one in the middle place of the head of the nose according to rectitude, because the vein does not appear to the feeling here, and because the blood begins to flow soon.
Cove que tu ultimes la tua ma am le fleubotomi petit a petit e fassas correr del sanc segon la tua necessitat; e aprop lia aquela per una nuoyt, quar aquela es restaurada leugierament.	Cover that you end your hand with the lancet little by little and make run of the blood according to your necessity; and then tie that one for a night, because that one is restored lightly.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de las doas guidegui a constriccio de ale e a comensament de lepra e a motas malautias e inpetige e malas ulceracios corrosivas ayssi cum herpotromeno.	But the usefulness of the phlebotomy of the two guidegui is to constriction of ale and to beginning of leprosy and to many diseases and impetigo and bad ulcers corrosive as well as herpotromeno.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que el malaute strenha dejos quascuna en le sieu col am liament; e estia le artifexs sobre le cap del malaute, e le malaute sia sezent sobre una sezela.	And the quality of the phlebotomy of those ones is that the patient tightens himself each one in his neck with a bandage; and be the artificers over the head of the patient, and the patient be sitting on a seat.
E aprop fleubotoma la vena al lonc am fleubotomi ample petit a petit; e aprop extratz de sanc segon temprada quantitat o segon aquo que vezes de necessitat que es ad aquo; e aprop fay semblant del autra vena.	And then phlebotomize the vein at the long with lancet ample little by little; and then extract of blood according to tempered quantity or according to what times of necessity that is to what; and then make semblant of the other vein.
E aprop deslia le liament e strenh las doas venas am strictura migiera per so que·l malaute no sia prefocat, e laysa entro al mati quar la plagua es sanada.	And then untie the bandage and tighten the two veins with a middle constriction so that the patient not be provoked, and let it until the morning when the plague is healed.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de las venas algerich, comfereys a petitas apostemas e pustulas de la boca e corrupcio de las gengivas e malas ulceracios e fissuras, e a malas ulceracios que so en le nas e en le circuit de lu.	And the usefulness of the phlebotomy of the veins algerich, confers to small abscesses and pustules of the mouth and corruption of the gums and bad ulcers and fissures, and to bad ulcers that are in the nose and in the circuit of it.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquelas es que fases cezer le malaute denant tu, e strenh le col de lu am una benda, e aprop revolveys las labias de lu e reguarda a doas venas de las quals la una es de la dextra de la labia e la segonda de la senestra; e la demonstracio de quascuna es per la negror de quascuna de amdos, e aquo mays es quar en le circuit de aquelas so venas menudas negras; e adonc inscideys cascuna per inscizio inscident.	And the quality of the phlebotomy of those ones is that you make  the patient stand in front of you, and tighten his neck with a bandage, and then roll up his lips and regard the two veins of which one is of the right of the lip and the second of the left; and the demonstration of each one is by the blackness of each one of both, and this is more because in the circuit of those there are small black veins; and therefore incise each one by incision.
Mays si dubitacio es dejos tu, e no sabes qual es de aquelas, lahoras tu enten a inscisio de la major de aquelas, e de la pus manifesta de aquelas.	But if doubt is of you, and you do not know which one of those is, then you understand to incision of the major of those ones, and of the pus more manifest of those ones.
E fay le semblant de las doas venas que so en las labias desus.	And make the semblant of the two veins that are in the lips above.
Mays costuma corr mays a inscidir las doas venas que so en la labia dejos.	But custom corr more to incise the two veins that are in the lip below.
Mays de doas venas que so dejos la lengua le juvament es aprop la fleubotomia de la cephalica a prefocacios que so en le guolayro, a la malautia de la uvula, e a malautias de la boca.	But of two veins that are below the tongue the usefulness is to the phlebotomy of the cephalica to provocations that are in the throat, to the disease of the uvula, and to diseases of the mouth.
E la qualitat de fleubotomar aquelas es que segue le malaute entre las tuas mas denant le solel, e eleva la lengua de lu, e reguarda dejos la lengua, de la un latz de lu vena e del autre latz vena, e la color de quascuna es declinant a negror.	And the quality of phlebotomizing those ones is that follow the patient between your hands in front of the sun, and elevate the tongue of him, and regard below the tongue, of the one side of it vein and of the other side vein, and the color of each one is declining to blackness.
E adonc fleubotoma quascuna; e guarda te que no ultimes la tua ma en fleubotoman aquelas, quar dejos aquelas so arterias.	And therefore phlebotomize each one; and guard yourself that you do not end your hand in phlebotomizing those ones, because below those ones are arteries.
E las tuas venas que so fleubotomadas en le coyde so en las quals corr costuma en totz les homes, e la fleubotomia de lor es fayta segon dos manieyras, o pongen am le fleubotomi mirtilat o olivar a subtilitat declinant; o secsar am fleubotomi cutellar, e apelha si alnessil, e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And your veins that are phlebotomized in the groin are in those that run custom in all men, and the phlebotomy of them is made according to two manners, or put with the lancet myrtle or olive to subtlety declining; or cut with lancet cutellar, and call it alnessil, and this is the form of it:
E aquest alnessil es que conveneys a seccio e de aquels so specias latz e subtils segon la amplitut de las venas e segon la strictura de aquelas.	And this incision is that it is necessary to make a section and of those so species latz and subtle according to the width of the veins and according to the stricture of those.
Forma de fleubotomi mirti:	Form of phlebotomy of the myrtle:
sia le latz de lu ayssi cum vezes, e conveneys a obrir las venas concavas plenas procedentz apparentz grossas, e ad aquelas que conteno sanc gros torbat.	Let the latz of it be so as sometimes, and it is necessary to open the concave veins full that appear thick, and to those that contain thick blood clotted.
E aquesta es la forma de fleubotomi olivar:	And this is the form of phlebotomy olive:
E aquest fleubotomi es de menor latitut e de pus subtil extremitat, e conveneys a fleubotomia de venas subtils que conteno sanc subtil citri.	And this phlebotomy is of lesser width and of more subtle extremity, and it is necessary to phlebotomize of subtle veins that contain subtle blood citrine.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena basilica la qual es una de tres venas: quar extratz le sanc de las malautias que so dejos le guolayro e·l col, e de aquo que siec le pietz e·l ventre.	But the benefit of the phlebotomy of the basilica vein which is one of three veins: that extracts the blood of the illnesses that are left the throat and the neck, and from that which seizes the feet and the belly.
E conveneys al fleubotomador, quan fleubotomia aquela, que guarde be aquela e sia sobre-temor en aquela, quar dejos lu ha arteria, e si erra e ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi, inscidira aquela arteria e accidira fluxs de sanc, per so que cove que no fleubotomes aquela am fleubotomi pungent, abantz sia sectant cum alnessil.	And it is necessary for the phlebotomist, when phlebotomizing that, to guard well that and to be over-fear in that, for beneath it there is an artery, and if he errs and adjusts in the puncture of the phlebotomy, he will cut that artery and there will occur a flux of blood, so that cove that in the phlebotomies that with phlebotomy pungent, be it sectant with incision.
E si no appar la basilica per apparicio manifesta, lahoras cove que tu laysses aquela e que tu mudes a la autre, o que cerques alcun ram sieu; o que fleubotomes en loc de lu finis del bras, quar aquela es manifesta; e secsa aquela am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the basilica does not appear by manifest appearance, then cove that you leave that and that you change to the other, or that you seek some branch of it; or that phlebotomize in the place of it end of the arm, for that is manifest; and secsa that with phlebotomy incision as we have said.
Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	But if you want the phlebotomy of it metyssa, then cove before the stricture of the arm that you touch the place within that you know the place of the wrists, and then lean over it with a hand; and then lay the arm and secsa the vein with concave incision with phlebotomy incision as we have said; and guard yourself that the percussion for some space of the place of the artery.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you see, as strengthens the ligament, inflation in the place that you have senhat with a hand, then that inflation is inflation of the artery, and therefore squiva that.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if you see the blood flow in the phlebotomy as such as of a child, and the blood is subtle rogue, then you know that it is of the blood of the artery; and then you coyta and place your hand over that for a long space; and then oppose your hand, and if the blood is abscindit, for many times it is abscindit, then you strengthen the arm and layssa that.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	And guard the patient from the moccio of it, and be over-fear of it and no maugua that for some days until it is sanat.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	But if the blood is not abscindit, and you see that you must not present medicine to that, then you inscideys the artery, if it appears to you; for the extremity of it is contrayta, and it is abscindit the blood; or that you take scorsa of fistic, and fen that, and take the one maytat and strengthen that over the place of the vein at strictura descent am liament and at pulvils within the other day.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	And then if the blood is abscindit, bo es; and if not, then cure that with that of which it is preceded to the rememoracio of the place of the polveras abscindentz flux of blood.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And the abscision of the blood of it is difficult in many dispositions for the small place of the plague and the possibility of the ligament of the arm.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	But of the vena fusca the phlebotomy is a benefit that extracts the blood of the superior part of the head and to the part below the body; for that because it is composed of branches of the basilica and of branches of cephalica, as we have said.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And cove to the phlebotomist that it be over-fear in the phlebotomy of it, for beneath that there is a nerve; and therefore if it adjusts in the puncture of the phlebotomy and touches the nerve, it will occur to it stupor, and it is difficult the sanacio of it, and fort leu no is sanat of all, And this nerve many times appears to the feeling; and if it is hidden to some men and it is subtle and is not shown, then cove that you pause the phlebotomy with the one with which you phlebotomize with incision of alnessil, and avoid the nerve with your strength.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then you fen the vein in the longitut.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The benefit of the phlebotomy of the cephalica vein is that it attracts the blood of the head and confers to the illnesses of the heels.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	And cove in this properly, if you want that the phlebotomy pungen with phlebotomy olivar or with phlebotomy mirti; for it is the most safe of all the veins, for it is not below it artery nor nerve.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	But however it is necessary to you that the phlebotomy that you guard that with the phlebotomy you do not pungas the head of the lacert so only, and seek the place pus leugier, and not not to it, if it is not touched with the first percussion that it be over that with phlebotomy some times.
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	But however fort leu is apostemat in some men, when it is not phlebotomized in the first percussion, but do not not to it in re that apostema.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	But the quality of the phlebotomy of it and the accidents of it are motz, in which you cove cogitar in their rectificacio.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first of these is that you should know that phlebotomy is not administered except in the preservation of health and in the hope of it and the precaution of the occurrence of diseases, and that phlebotomy should be performed on one of the veins that are in the arm, that is: cephalic, basilic and median cubital; and that phlebotomy should be done at the beginning of spring, fasting in spring and autumn, and in winter near the meal, when there appear signs of repletion.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And it should be done phlebotomy on the third day or at the first hour that three hours have passed from the day.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	But phlebotomy that is administered, more when it provokes convenience and necessity to it, or at night or during the day, at any hour and at any time.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	And that a child should not be phlebotomized before he has fourteen years, and a woman who is pregnant should not be phlebotomized except from the fourth month into the seventh, and the elderly should not be phlebotomized those who have already passed sixty years.
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	And as if someone wants to be phlebotomized in any way, it is necessary that they cleanse their bowels before phlebotomy with a lion's clyster, if there is a lot of retained feces, so that the veins do not throw the superfluities into the phlebotomy of the bowels, which are purified, and that they do not harm the main limbs.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	And they should not be phlebotomized the patients nauseous, certain and crapulent, nor those suffering from illness or intoxication until it is removed from them, nor from dropsy, and more that phlebotomy should be feared near colic, near vomiting, near the body of the belly, and near the multiplication of copulation and labor and exercise of fasting or vigils and of every cause that dissolves the virtue, either corporal or animal.
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	And before it, consider in the subtilization of humors, if the blood is thick, with foods and drinks, and with medicines if it is possible to it.
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And before it, enter in bath if no cause prohibits it, or exercise by some exercise so that the blood is subtiliated.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	And pause the phlebotomy of it in the foot of the day, that is, around the hour of terce, as we have said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	And pierce that the foot of that be guarded on that day from all evils accidents animals, as is anguish, anger, fear, and from all corporal accidents, as is labor and superfluous pain and copulation and similarities to them.
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	And to his bed, make it present the causes in the use of which custom of men am aromaticity and odor and am bals and similarities to them according to the quantity of possibility.
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And follow the phlebotomist upon a cushion that is pus than the cushion of him who is to be phlebotomized.
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	And before it, extract his arm, and rub that with his hand the phlebotomist two or three times; and before it, strengthen the ligament with a strap and wrap that two times.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	And let the stricture be temperate, for the stricture when it is not equal, or the stricture is with superfluity, then it prohibits the flow of blood; or it is with mollification, and then it prohibits the body of blood emission.
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	And before the stricture, it is necessary that he who is to be phlebotomized rub his hands together at the same time while the veins are inflated, and are declared to the feeling.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And before the phlebotomist, anoint his phlebotomy with a little oil antic properly; and before it, place his left hand's index finger upon that vein, below the place of which he wants the phlebotomy, so that the vein be a little inflated, and the percussion be seated for that of the veins is the one that is atrobas as if the heart fled, and of those is that is full of ventosity and when you place the phlebotomy upon it, it is contracted, and is discovered the phlebotomist; and the phlebotomy does not open the vein, and if it opens, that is strait.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	And therefore, for this, it is necessary that the phlebotomist be stopped and be solicited in all these causes.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	And before the phlebotomy, but if the vein is opened in one time, then it is good; and if not, then you iterate it another time below that place a little, or upon it with festinacio, if the place is not apostemat.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	And if the place is apostemat, or the patient fears, then you leave it for a day or two, and do not strengthen the ligament, for it will strongly pull the apostema caut, nor enter into bath.
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	And before it, iterate the phlebotomy if the need.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the opening is small and the blood flows subtly, and you fear that it will not be the quantity of blood that you want, then you iterate the phlebotomy in that tract according to rectitude and adjust in the opening a little, and do it with festinacio before the place is apostemat, for the place is apostemat in most men with little opening.
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	But if you see that already apostemat, then you do not iterate upon it, for it excuses you no cause; and pause upon it any part of the wound of oil, for it alleviates the body of blood.
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And it is better in this place than oil and other oils.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	And similarly, administer a fenestration of oil in all phlebotomies, with which phlebotomies are performed on the veins, the prohibition of the body of blood, and they do this tyriaca alfadoc and sagzenea when it is placed on the place, because the blood is subtiliated and is revolted when it is thick.
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	And if in the place of the phlebotomy a large abscess is generated, because many times accidents occur, and mostly to those who have not been bled except that time, or at the opening of the vein little, and then you cover it, and place on the place a sponge infused in water and salt, a little scalded, and strengthen it for an hour, because it is dissolved.
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And cover that it does this near the extraction of blood from that vein with the complement of it or of another vein.
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	And if in the place for some days any blackness or greenness remains, do not notice it; and if you want, place on it some cause of aloen and myrrh dissolved, or some cause of juice of mint or calament or similar to it.
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	And many times accidents occur abscesses and elevations due to phlebotomy of the basilica.
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	And therefore place your hand over it, and if then you feel softness due to your compression over it, then that eminence is bad and evil; and therefore guard yourself that you place on it any cause of that which they have said, because it will flow strongly from the artery of blood.
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And make a poultice with water in which it is stipulated, so that the place may be endured, and then cure it with the other cure until it is healed.
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	And cover that you extract blood from every man according to the quantity of his virtue and according to the color of the blood, which appears.
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	Because if the blood is black, then you let it flow until it is ropy; and similarly if you see it thick, then you let it flow until it is subtiliated; and similarly if it is acute, until the acuteness of it is stayed.
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat.	And cover that to one who is full and strong and has need of blood extraction in one time, that the phlebotomy of the vein be amplified and the phlebotomy be wide.
E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	And in that one who is frail, let the contrary of that be done, and cover that you extract that in troops of times, and that the tract be straight.
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	And the best that is administered in phlebotomy of the vein is that it be the transverse section, not the puncture.
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	And this manner of phlebotomy is safe from the flow of blood and from the incision of nerves, and is more praiseworthy and safer than phlebotomy according to latitude and longitude.
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	And to which it is customary to occur syncope due to phlebotomy, and cover that you cure that before the phlebotomy with a little bread infused in wine of millegrains or of simple oxymel scalded; and extract at the one of the blood in three times or four.
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	And if it is a cold constitution, then prepare before the phlebotomy pa infused in essence of myrrh or in essence of honey aromatized with spices such as pepper, cinnamon, ginger and similar, or in essence aromatized and much fragrant.
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	And if syncope occurs due to phlebotomy, and the cause of it is the emission of much blood, then cover that you prepare to drink water of meat and essence much fragrant subtle; and use of aromaticity with some fennel, and be the his feet with it.
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And use of the other causes that have been said in the division in the chapter of syncope by evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	And he who wants to even out his arm and dissolve his blood according to time, cover that to him of whom the phlebotomy is by much evacuation, and the virtue of him is frail, that evacuate the blood little by little, so it is according to the quantity of the virtue in the continuous days.
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	May who wants to even out his arm, and get rid of his blood according to the second time, and his body is strong, then do so about seven hours or nine of the first phlebotomy.
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	May who wants to draw the blood from his body to the contrary of the part to which it declines, cover that it be evened out on the second day or the third.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	May that body in which there is much blood already scalded and is acute and causes fever, cover that it be drawn from it blood in one time and be of it thrown a great quantity and be amplified the opening until syncope occurs, because you will have preserved all the conditions of phlebotomy; and that you place your hand over the wrist of him of the blood, so that it does not end up dead in the place of syncope, because many times this happens when the phlebotomist is ignorant and negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	And do not cover when you want to untie the arm and evacuate the blood a second time, since already be closed the orifice of the vein and be made difficult the emission of the blood, that you press upon it with vehemence and curved be extended slightly, because that is too bad.
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	Have that let it flow until it be phlebotomized secondarily; or remove that with the acuteness of the phlebotomy that is coagulated of the blood in the orifice of the vein; or place upon it of tyriaca alfarach, or of sagzenea, and compress that with a light compression until the blood be out.
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is suppurating, then leave it alone and do not touch it until the abscess is subsided.

And if necessity compels you to evacuate blood according to the method, and there is no excuse, then you should bleed that person either in that place or in the other arm in another vein.
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas. And the quality of the phlebotomy of that one is that the patient inserts his hand into warm water until the skin reddens and the vein appears manifestly.

E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And be the opening wide and be your phlebotomy with the one that you phlebotomize on the joint of the hand a little.

And if the flow of blood is prohibited, then you iterate the hand in the warm water and leave the blood to run in the water until you achieve your necessity.
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	But if you were in the days of summer, then you are excused from the iteration of the hand in the warm water, and the vessel is placed the body of blood in warm water in times of winter.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And the phlebotomy of this vein is safer than all the others, because it leaves no pulsating vein, nor nerve.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And the phlebotomy of the saphenous vein of the right hand is beneficial for the diseases of the liver.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re. E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And conserve that you do not finish your hand with the phlebotomy, because from there are the nerves of the fingers denuded of flesh.

Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	But the benefit of the phlebotomy of that of the left hand, is that it is beneficial for the diseases of the spleen.

Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	But if the flow of blood is prohibited; then you iterate the foot of that one in the warm water and let the blood run in that until it is evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the phlebotomist errs in the first attempt, then iterate with the phlebotomy in a little, because the place is safe; and do not fear of it malice, but that you guard yourself from the nerves as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And similarly do of the saphenous vein of the other foot equally.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And of the sciatic vein, the place as we have said is below the heel of the left side.
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the benefit of the phlebotomy of that one is to the pain of the hip when it is by blood caut.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the quality of the phlebotomy of that one is that the patient enters into a bath, and fastens and strains the thigh of that one from the side of the wide up under the heel under four fingers in a long and subtle bandage, so that it appears not by that.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And therefore when it appears, then you phlebotomize that one according to each engine that is to you possible and according to the transverse, and it is better; or incis that one by incision or secces that one by section, because the place of that one is safe.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is in most men most amiable; and if you find that, and it does not appear to the feeling of all, then phlebotomize some ram of that one, and it is that which appears in the back of the foot in place of the auricular and the annular.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And be careful of the nerves, and make the blood flow as much as you want.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	Then loosen the stricture and place it on the location of the phlebotomy, and tighten the area, slightly so it heals.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	Of ventosa and the qualities of using them.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Ventozas are of horns, or of iron, or of lead.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	And ventosa is made in two ways: one of them is with scarification and extraction of blood, and the other is ventosa without scarification.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this ventosa that is without scarification is in two ways, whether it is with fire or without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And to the ventosa that are administered with scarification and extraction of blood there are fourteen locations of the body, of which one in which ventosa are placed is the occiput, and it is the rear part of the head; and the middle place of the two parts of the neck together; and ventosa of the chin below the jawbone below the mouth; and ventosa of the two shoulder blades; and ventosa of the alohoster, and it is above the end of the rib; and ventosa of the two armpits; and ventosa of the two groins.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And ventosa does not extract the blood but from the small veins scattered in the flesh, and therefore it does not catch the virtue by those, as it is caught by phlebotomy; nor is it advisable that ventosa be made with fire or without fire in any disease caused by repletion until the whole body is evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if necessity provokes ventosa for disease or for continuous, administer it at all times at the beginning of the month and at the end of it, and in the middle of it and in any time that it is.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The cause of this is that of men in whom the blood is multiplied within that indigests of its extraction by ventosa and finds in their head heaviness and soddenness; and of those it is that finds repletion and rigor in their face and in their head, and in their neck; and of those it is that finds pruziment in their face and in their forehead and darkness and hebetude in their eyes; and of those that vomit the location of their ventosa; and of those it is that their ris is multiplied; and of those it is that finds taste of blood in their mouth, or that the tongue is apostate and spits blood; and of those it is that their sleep is multiplied, and of those that veils blood in sleep rigor and ancients and plagues and other causes to their appearances.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore when times in any of those causes, and properly if it is in the third or middle of the month, then command ventosa to be made more than it is passed from the day of two or three hours.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the benefit of ventosa of the neck is that when that confers gravity to the head and ad that which is poured into the eyes; but it is advisable that that be after evacuation of the whole body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this ventosa is in the location of phlebotomy of the cephalic.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not light that use of it that one that is of frega complexion, or in the one that is catarr, for it gives to that great damage.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And therefore it is not advisable to use it for the elderly, and in those whose heads are of cold diseases.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But to him that over that is continuing over it is made oblivion; and therefore it is advisable that you command the ventosa to pause his hand a little with the ventosa to the parts below, fearing the generation of oblivion.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	But ventosa of alkehel is in the location of phlebotomy of the vena fusca and of the basilica: and therefore confers to asthma, and to the constriction of ale and to the scissura of the sturment of ale, and to cough, and to repletion.
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And it is advisable that the ventosa alkehel be pulled a little, for if it is paused below, it engenders weakness in the body and in the stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And the ventosa of alhagdahan confers to the pains accidental in the head and to ophthalmia, and migraine, and pre-focus, and pains in the roots of the teeth; and it is in the location of phlebotomy of the basilica.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And it is advisable that you command the ventosa to not press his hand with scarification so that it does not pierce the artery and occur fluxes of blood.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And ventosa below the chin confers to alcohol in the mouth, and to corruption of the gums, and appearances to them of the diseases that are in the mouth, and stand in the location of phlebotomy of aliheric that is in the two lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But the ventosa that is made over the two shoulder blades confers to caphatan, which is made by repletion of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And the ventosa of the two parts of the armpits confers benefit of phlebotomy of three veins, so it is of the basilica, fusca and cephalica, for that one attracts the blood of all those veins more slender that are in the flesh, and those veins slender of the other veins more gross until that the attraction reaches the three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	And command the ventosa to not process too much in scarification, for the location is denuded of flesh, and below it are nerves and arteries.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And it is a ventosa with which is ventosa over the buttocks and confers to the hemorrhoids of the anus and to the ulcers further below.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And tell the ventilator to make a large vent, and that it be of copper, because the place needs a strong incision; and very fine, subtle ventilators are to be drawn, and it be scarified with a scarification.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	But smaller ventilators on the legs are made with less incision, because they draw blood from the whole body, and they resemble old pains of the lungs and the womb, and the bladder; and they provoke menstruation, and resemble both pain and labor; and they are in place of phlebotomy of two veins, and they cut, and of two veins.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	But some weaken the whole body and cause fainting in many men.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And of the ventilators, the cure is proper to the cure of the ventilators of two legs.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of the position of the ventilators is that you place the ventilator at the beginning open and draw it by temperate suction, and do not prolong the position of the ventilators, but place them lightly, and move them carefully, and that the humors come to the place by equal arrival.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not cease to iterate this and continue until you see the place already red and inflamed and that the color of the blood appears.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then you scarify and iterate the suction little by little, and then consider in the disposition of the body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	Because that man who has tender flesh of rare pores, you should scarify him once and no more, so that the place is not ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	And command the ventilator to amplify the scarification and proceed a little, and temper the suction with facility.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if in the blood there is thickness, then you should scarify twice, because in the first scarification the way of subtilization is opened to the blood and its fluidity.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second, to the scrutiny acquired of the extraction of the thick blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very feculent, then the third scarification should be made so that the last is achieved.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	And finally, when we want to extract the blood little by little or a little, one scarification suffices us.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want the extraction of much blood, we scarify with much scarification; and if we knew that the blood was thick, then we should scarify with a pre-existing scarification.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the term of scarification in which is the depth of the incision, only.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if that one whose incision is thick, hard, dark, and whose pores are narrow, then the places of the ventilators should be anointed more gently, more open, more resolved; if it is in summer, like olive oil of aloes or olive oil of violets, or olive oil of two almonds, or olive oil of fig; and if it is in winter, then narcissus oil, or lily oil, or chamomile oil, or of the same kind.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the superfluity is thick, greasy, then the oil should be of marigold, or balm oil, or aloes oil, or anise oil, and to those likenesses.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the ventilator has wide pores of tender flesh, then it should be prohibited from oil, and that those places of the ventilators near their application should be washed with water or with cold water of salvia, or with fig water, or with water of bladderwort, and likenesses to those.
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And that one whose blood is of much humidity, washes their ventilators with strong wine, or with myrtle and sumac water and likenesses to those.
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And of that one whose superfluities are thick, washes their ventilators with old wine, or with water of sage, which is marjoram, or of anise decoction, or of chamomile, and to those likenesses.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	And that the ventilation should be guarded before bathing; bathing should be administered near the bath for an hour or two, and that one should sleep near the ventilation.
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is necessary to regulate the ventilator before phlebotomy.
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	You should consider at the beginning: then if the ventilator or the one who is to be phlebotomized is choleric and windy, and has acute blood and inflammation, then you should prepare cooling causes, such as vinegar, endive with strong wine and lettuce, and secanabin, and syrup, and to those likenesses.
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And pause their meals as much as possible, and meats of tame birds, and foods seasoned with acids, and to those likenesses.
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And of that one whose complexion is greasy, he should be encouraged to drink syrup of althea, or syrup of alsecanabin of seeds, and sumac, and strong-smelling wine between veal and lamb; and that he should be commanded to use little drinking and eating, and pause the foods of his little and canary and sparrows and small birds and doves.
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And that on the day of ventilation and phlebotomy, the drink should be greater than the food.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And that some men should be given to drink in certain hours, tyriaca alpharac, or medicines of musk, which is muscade, or alcelita before ventilation or phlebotomy, or near, so that the main limbs be comforted and the blood be subtiliated; and they should not take that scalfatz.
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	But the wounds that are made by scarification should be wounds that are placed on the liver, and on the spleen and gout, and on the navel, in the places of the joints, and on the tip of the belly button, because these members do not tolerate scarification on themselves.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not desired for those [wounds], but rather the attraction of blood from the member, just as we place a leech on the nipple in a disease of blood flow from the nose; and we use that so that the cold, viscous air from the member may be dissolved, just as we place it on the belly and navel; because that rarefies the member and warms it and removes the pain because it resolves the air.
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And it is already placed on the boils when they occur in their opening or the pus, because by virtue of the strong attraction, the pus is drawn out and the boil is eradicated from its place.
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	And similarly it does when it is placed on the liver and spleen, drawing out the air that is enclosed in those places.
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these wounds are administered empty with suction alone; and sometimes they are administered with fire.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And sometimes they are administered full of tepid water in the ailments of the spleen.
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is so that the wound may be filled and be larger, so it is filled with water alone or water in which herbs have been boiled that are suitable for the purpose.
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of a wound administered with fire: its orifice should be two fingers wide, according to how we have formed it; and the quantity of the preon should be the majority of a palm; and it should be in the middle of it, in the place that is in the circuit, the majority of it, the tract should be small according to the quantity that enters it a needle.
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	It should be made of a thick iron or a citron, with large edges, lion, smooth and flat so that it does not damage the member because of its position on it.
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And in the middle of it, a transverse bar of iron or steel, on which a candle is placed with the fire.
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And already this wound should be larger than the one we have recounted; and the pause smaller than that according to the ailments and the state of the one who uses it.
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And the leeches of the infants and the emaciated are others than the leeches of the young and of robust bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the quality of placing this wound with fire on the member is that it extends the fire with firewood decently in front of a small candle of wax, and place it on the middle of the transverse bar in the middle place of the wound, so that the fire is ignited around the remaining part so that it does not burn the body of the patient.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then it should be placed on the member of the patient, and the finger should be on the tract that we have said, and when we have the leeches and do not indicate that we show the finger and that it escapes the vapor on that tract, then the wound is immediately dissolved.
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And prop the fire according to its manner, and repeat that if you indicated it.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But in a leech that is administered in the ailment of pleurisy, with water, in which there is no transverse bar nor tract, and it is not administered unless it is filled with water, and it is placed on the member alone.
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the form of it: And this leech, the more it is large, the better, because it can receive a large quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Chapter .xcvii.
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Leeches are not administered in all members, but in those members in which it is not possible to position leeches, because of their small size, such as the tongue and gums and the like; or in members denuded of flesh, such as the finger and nose and their like.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the quality of using those that have been found leeches that are in the waters of the ponds of purity.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And then they should be left in the water of the pond until they are famished, and that no cause remains in the belly of those; and then the body should be evacuated at the beginning with phlebotomy and with leeches; and then the member of the patient should be rubbed until it reddens; and then they should be placed on it.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And how they are filled and case.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to suck the location with a leech, it is more beneficial.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the location with vinegar and then with a lot of water; and it should be rubbed and squeezed.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the bleeding of the patient is prolonged after the application of the leeches, and that is the result, then you put a cloth of linen in cold water, and place it over it until the bleeding is stopped.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the bleeding is multiplied, then pulverize over it vitriol trias, or galangal and the like of the causes stiptics, until the bleeding is stopped; or leeches are placed on the location, and they are left until the beans adhere to the location, and the bleeding is stopped.
